text: For me, the IPA by which all others are judged. Earthy, hoppy, not fruity - the best. Best in the can.
Have had fresh and less fresh. Archetype of a style. High points but also one note compared to my faves of the style.

Aroma:

Medium/heavy aroma of malts, caramel, orange, tropical fruit and hops.

Appearance:

Turbid/opaque yellow/golden beer with a slight off-white head

Taste/Palate:

Starts medium/heavy sweet with malts, caramel, orange and tropical fruit; ends slightly bitter and dry with hops.

Overall:

This beer is intense, complex and balanced. This is especially true for its abv. Great fruity flavour with a lovely aroma. Great appearance and palate as well. Misses a bit of intensity however.

500ml can. Yellow liquid with a small white head. Nose is hoppy, fruity, grapefruit, exotic fruits, you can¬ít just stay there, you need to drink it, it is too inviting, can find some caramel malt as well. Taste is just as amazing as nose, once you take a sip you just can¬ít stop, abv isn¬ít even felt, you drink is like this is no tomorrow. A lovely IPA for sure.
16 oz. can. Pours hazy gold with a foamy white head. Aroma of juicy tropical fruit, citrus, grapefruit. Taste is tropical fruit, pine, mango, grapefruit, citrus. Very bitter finish. Excellent.

Poured from a can at MBCC first session. Hazy golden body, bubbly white head, spotty lacing. Fresh tropical fruits on the nose. Mid-sweet citrus flavours, lemon and orange, together with sappy peaches. Citrus peels to the ending. Soft in the mouth. Very nice, a bit heavy to drink though. (Copenhagen 12.05.2017).

UPDATED: JUN 4, 2017 Can shared. Pours pale cloudy gold. Pine cone on nose. Flavour is a caramel sweet with a dry grapefruit bitter end. Pours like a pale ale and looks like one. It drinks like one as well. Not a hint of abv. Lovely.

Burk delad med JoacimMvp, tackar och bockar! Riktigt kul att f√• testa! H√§ller upp i glas d√• vi delar p√• burken, √§ven om vi l√•ter lite vara kvar och testar fr√•n burken. L√§tt m√∂rkorange, n√•got disig. Till en b√∂rjan ganska sn√§ll i doften, men v√§xer till sig lite n√§r den varit i glaset ett tag. Smakm√§ssigt √§r det √§nnu st√∂rre. Ruskigt bra punch med ananas, citrus och mango i f√∂rgrunden. Stor och fyllig med en stor s√∂tma och h√§rligt klibbigt humle som n√§stan l√§gger sig som en hinna p√• tungan. H√§rligt stor beska som bryter av n√•got mot de senare NE-style iporna. Stor smak och h√§rlig humlepackad, maxad! Riktigt gott!
From Bierkrafr. In Teku glass. Watching Looper. Resinous, with pineapple notes. Very balanced and tasty but wont give it full score because some subtle veggie notes not completely pleasant

Satisfying, tasty example of IPA, a little bit overhyped, but indeed very good one. Slightly hazy, golden, mandarin colour. Big head with fine lacing. Aroma of pine, grapefruit, tropical fruits. Massive and enjoyable bitterness, lemon, blood orange, grass, citrus zest, juicy. Well hidden alcohol. I wish to drink it more often.

Cans from Mikkeller & Friends Bottle Shop. Drunk from the can, poured a little to see it. Slightly hazy yellow with white head. Dry, grassy aroma with loads of citrus, fresh cut grass, hay and zest. Similar highly bitter grassy, citrus taste with lingering fresh bitterness. Superb balance.

Hops Hops n more Hops, if you like Hops drink Heady Hopper. I have to be "in the mood", but this beer works well with a meal, nice steak or thick burger, best very cold IMO.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Mbcc yellow. Can. Golden hazy. Juicy fruity nose, tropicals, light green berries. Med bodied juicy intense, nice. Slight pine finish.

Bit overhyped for me, but still.. very nice brew.
Mostly orange, grapefruit, fresh grassy, pine. Moderate bitterness with light sweetness, bit sharper than other contestants of NEIPA X)

The aroma is full of hops, pine, mango, pineapple, tangerine, mandarine and orange. The color is golden and the head is white and frothy. The taste is full of hops, pine, mango, tangerine, mandarine, orange, passionfruit and nice bitter finish. Finally I got the chance to try this legendary beer, thanks to Mikkeller who are probably the only one in Denmark who can get this. A nice beer!

Hazy, orange colored, medium off white frothy head. Aroma is a bit malty, mostly strong fruity juicy and citrus hops. Taste is medium+ sweet malt, light caramel, strong fruity, grapefruity and floral pine hops, juicy, medium to strong bitterness, dry finish. Medium+ bodied, soft carbonation, oily. Quite hoppy.
(can, MBCC 2017)
Sample at mbcc.. Pours cloudy golden, hoppy aroma, cirtus, pine, fruity. taste is very hoppy, nice bitterness, very nice.
UPDATED: MAY 24, 2017 50cl can. Aroma is mostly citrusy hops. Taste: citrus, a bit of sweetness, some tropical fruits maybe mango and resin. Super nice smooth mouthfeel. Lives up to the hype!
Aroma of citrus, fresh hops, resin. Taste is moderate bitter and light sweet, mango. Medium+ body, oily feel and bitter citrus finish.

Can at MBCC.
Pale yellow with a white head.
Aroma of hops, grass and lemon.
Taste sweet, bitter, grass and lemon.

UPDATED: MAY 24, 2017 Massive Mangobombe mit hartem IBU Handkantenschlag. Puscht dich ins w√§rmende Honeyharzparadies ‚ú®üëΩ. Hatte mehr erwartet. Morgen die 0,5l CAN ;) !!! MBCC  2017.
8/4/9/5/19 Wiesenfrischer GreenHopduft umgarnt ihn. Cloudylover & haftende Tropicstachelbeere im yeasty Pepperkorsett. üéÜ

Having it from a can for a second time after almost a year. Very decent and polite beer. Sweetness bigger than biterness. Not overhopped. Balanced to the bone. In a perfect world every beer would be that solid. Well hidden alcohol. Tasty. Just perfect but not pushing the boundaries. If I lived near the brewery, I wouldn¬ít need more.

Had it straight from the can. Powerful citrussy, grassy and piney hop aroma. The taste is full of hoppy bitterness that intensifies and has lots of wonderful piney and citrussy flavor notes. The palate is just perfect. Medium to full body with lots of carbonation that carries the hop notes all over and lingers intensely in the mouth. Really an awesome beer.

13.05.2017, 1 pint can @ hotel room in Copenhagen:
Nice slightly bubbly-creamy longlasting head, hazy. Aroma is slightly dry grassy, weeds, leafs, hay, hops, moss, bark, flowers, light malts, lawn, fresh wood, oatmeal, hints of harsh citrus peel. Taste is slightly dry grassy, leafs, weeds, minerals, hay, bark, light malts, hops, sap, fresh wood, moss, oatmeal, citrus peel. Medium to longlasting bitterness, slightly dry concentrated grassy mouthfeel. Nice.

Super hoppy. Great palate for how hoppy. Hopiness lasts for a great aftertaste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Tap at mbcc17, copenhagen. Hazy light golden color, white head. Aroma has rich fruits, citrus, peach, hops. Nice hoppy taste, citrus, leafy notes, bitter finish. Quality iipa.
Cloudy golden with a medium white head. Aroma had fruity and fresh hops. Flavor was bold and fruity with plenty of simcoe hops. Finished dry and bitter.
Can @ MBCC. Semiclear yellow with bone white head. Tropical fruit, passionfruit and citrus with a whiff of hay and juice-like sweetness. Fruity with grass. Medium bitter and somewhat sticky.

Can @ mbcc. 
Poured golden color with a thin white head. 
Juicy fruity, tropical fruits, pineapples, mango. 
Juicy. Nice bitterness, tropical fruits, mango. Excellent.

Pours pale clear golden. Hoppy, fresh, citrus aroma. Lemon, grapefruit, pineapple, mango. Crisp, balanced.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Another can at home kindly sourced by Maakun. Hazy golden with thin greyish white head. Full on fruity sweet and juicy pineapple, papaya, peaches, and dry white widow. Moderate sweet and quite a nice bitter. Medium body, malty sweet juicy and soft carbonation.

Can shared. Bit hazy golden with good sized white head. Dank weedy hops, light cheese, onion, pineapple, mango, light cake, sugary malts, light grass. There¬ís nice weedy hops and plenty of fruits, but more ¬íbalanced¬í than Focal Banger, this has more malt character, even some marzipan. Almost full bodied. Very lovely yummie stuff.
Yellow hazy with medium white head. Nice strong fruity aroma. Good bitterness with nice fruity sweet sourness. Lasting bitter aftertaste.
Golden color and cloudy one. Very strong aroma. A bit sour, but still bitter taste. Rather bitter aftertaste
Uzupe≈Çnienie profilu, pite kilka razy jaki≈õ czas temu. Aromat tropikalny i cytrusowy. W smaku umiarkowanie gorzkie, fajny balans. W smaku cytrusy, nuta ≈ºywicy. Zawsze pyszne.

Fresh can from the brewery. 
Nice potent peachy aroma, some herb and citrus, Golden hazy appearance, some floaties as expected.
Its all about the taste! After a week of working my way through New England IPAs this marveled in its balance, depth and complexity. Peach, citrus juice and sweet rind, pine and resin combine with biscuity malts, firm bitterness and some herbal overtones. Smooth and easy drinking. No offence to those who say it doesn¬ít but IMO it really lives up to the hype, even in a world of Alchemist inspired DIPAs.
WAY overrated. Yet a good beer! Just doesn¬ít make it to the expectations because of all the hype.

Jesli jeszcze aromat lekko mnie zawi√≥d≈Ç to ju≈º w smaku by≈Ça bomba - grejpfrut i ananas i duzo, duzo wiecej..Znakomicie zbalansowane, soczyste, g≈Çadkie, ja nie wiem jakie oni tam soki powyciskali, ale czuƒá przy tym lekko stronƒô s≈ÇodowƒÖ, goryczka cudownie grejpfrutowa, ale nie jakie≈õ zalegajƒÖce albedo. Ludzie to nie jest piwo, gwarantujƒô, ≈ºe wcisnƒÖ≈Çbym komu≈õ, ≈ºe to niedos≈Çadzany sok cytrusowo - tropikalny. Alkohol nawet nie zagrzewa w brzuchu. Ju≈º wiem czemu jest napisane "Drink from the Can". Po co siƒô pierdzieliƒá - trzeba piƒá jedno za drugim..

UPDATED: MAY 14, 2017 Tropical fruits, green mango, grass, flowers notes. Hazy gold, medium, creamy, white head. Light sweet. More tropical fruits, sweet, creamy mango, passion fruit, bitterness intensifies, soft carbonation, medium bodied, sweet mango in the finish. Nice IIPA, but did not quite live up to the hype. Can at Hop City 17, Leeds. 

Grapefruit, other citrus fruits, orange, tangerine, light tropical fruits coming up, mango, light floral hops. Slightly hazy gold, medium, creamy, white head. Medium bitter. More citrus fruits, bitter orange, grapefruit, unripe tropical fruits, mango, floral hops, soft carbonation, medium bodied. Decent, but still not getting the hype. Keg at MBCC Yellow Session, Copenhagen.

Almost impossible to rate, if you have read about this for years, and suddenly get the chance to drink a can at Hop city festival! It¬ís a very well balanced beer, juicy hops, and great aroma, and the complexities of the flavour change as it goes down. The bench mark for much of what is happening in the world of DIPAs today. Delicious

It says drink from the can so I only poured a little to notice the color. Hazy golden yellow. Citrus aroma. Very smooth for a double. Medium body not bitter. Citrus flyover with a little bit of pine. Not as hoppy as their other offerings. 

It¬ís been a little over a year since I last had this, but I¬ím pretty sure if I could only have 1 beer for the rest of my life it would be a fresh Heady. 

John L - Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a hazy pale golden color with a big frothy white head that leaves a lot of lacing. Nice aromas of fresh fruit, citrus and pine resin. Flavors upfront of mango, peach, pineapple, citrus and it actually has some caramel malt balancing it out at the end. Very bitter but I was surprised to see that the IBUs were over 100; it didn¬ít feel that bitter. The body was rather light for a Double IPA but not unpleasantly so; it suited the beer. This is definitely one of the best IPAs I¬íve had.

So Heady Topper, the beer I¬íve been waiting for years to try. I had all these expectations in my head and all these thoughts on how it tastes, is it worth the hype is it even that good? To me, yes it¬ís that good, and it¬ís probably my favorite ipa for the simple fact that it¬ís such a simple beer. There¬ís nothing that¬ís over the top, or laden with adjuncts or trying to be the next hype beer. It¬ís just a super delicious simple ipa that blows all the hype beer out of the water. I was mid crack of the can when I could smell the hops blowing out. Pouring it, I got peach, mango, papaya and just the dankest aroma ever. Taste was exactly the same. Just amazing in my opinion, and I¬ím so glad I finally got to try it. An absolutely monumental beer and 100 percent worth seeking out if you¬íre not in New England. Cheers.

Can, thanks Ryan! Aroma is citrus, orange, peach, mango, hints of pineapple, pine, grapefruit and grass. Golden yellow amber, hazy, 1 1/2 finger white nice head. Medium sweetness, light to medium bitter, taste is tropical, sunripe orange, peach, mango, pineapple, mandarin, with a touch of light malt in the background. Full body, soft carbonation, beautiful silky mouthfeel, long beautiful finish with juicy fruitiness and nice soft bitterness. Wow, what a beer!
Piwo skonsumowane. Ocena na podstawie retrospekcji w celu uzupe≈Çnienia profilu.

Kompletna dysproporcja aromatu i smaku.

Heady Topper! Legenda.

Piwo zdoby≈Çem w wymiance z innym beer geekiem. Przywiezione zosta≈Ço z browaru Stone Brewing Berlin.

Na prawdƒô nie wiem ile to piwo mo≈ºe mieƒá. OglƒÖdnƒÖ≈Çem puszkƒô wzd≈Çu≈º i wszerz i nie znalaz≈Çem nawet najmniejszego ≈õladu jakiejkolwiek daty.
SƒÖdzƒÖc po aromacie mog≈Ço mieƒá mieƒá ze 2 miesiƒôce. Zapach by≈Ç umiarkowany, owocowy, przyjemny, ale nie zwala≈Ç z n√≥g.

Skopa≈Ç ty≈Çek Pliny The Elder z Russian River. Mo≈ºe nie temu, kt√≥re pi≈Çem lane w browarze w Santa Rosa (kt√≥re by≈Ço jak do tej pory moim najlepszym DIPA na ≈õwiecie), ale z pewno≈õciƒÖ wersji butelkowej, kt√≥rƒÖ pi≈Çem dwa razy.
What an absolute work of art! This is the smoothest Double IPA I have ever had. Smells like a fresh summer day out in a pine filled field. The finish is smooth and creamy to the mouth.

Can¬ít think of anything I *don¬ít* like about it. No one characteristic got top marks only because there¬ís probably always room for improvement. If Her Majesty, the Queen were coming I wouldn¬ít hesitate to serve this to her.
Pris √† Burlington, US entre amis. Bi√®re de calibre international. Go√ªt riche et agr√©able. Senteur incroyable. Tr√®s bonne bi√®re en bonne compagnie.
Amazing Brew, One of the Best IPAs out there. Notes of citrus, pine, and resinous hops. HOP BOMB, As good as an IPA can get

Can at BGM 2014

Nice light fruit aroma, yellow, hazy, white foam, light sweetness, medium bitterness, medium body, creamy, soft carbonation, bitter, long finish, very refreshing! Top of the tops!

Grass, grass some more grass,fruits,citrus on the nose. hazy yellow orange and a white head (even though i mostly drink this from the can so it should be n/a). very grassy flavor citric and fruity notes, pine light caramel from the malts a very hop forward and bitter beer. rich mouthfeel, medium heavy body very easy to drink rich complex hoppy bitter aftertaste. My favorite dippa in the whole wide world superior to the neipas of treehouse and trilium in my opinion. heady is as hoppy as it gets without being unbearable a dipa that drinks like a pale ale !!!
luscious gold with a fluffy head. awesome hop nose. Broad warm malt body with a diffuse hop flavor that reaches all corners of the mouth. Excelent balance. Nice!
√Åmbar turbio y espuma marfil. Aromas bals√°micos de pino, menta, pomelo. Cuerpo meloso y sabor intenso como en aroma con un final y regusto resinoso, largo y jugoso.

Can share at Leighton¬ís pad. Thanks to me in host for breaking out this. Pours hazy golden with a head that dissipates. Aroma is citrus, pine and tropical fruits. Taste is a juicy hop bomb but we¬íll balanced. A bit of dank pine. Great stuff!
Light golden hough. Hints of vanilla, hops and citrus in the smell. Surprisingly Not as hoppy as many IPA¬ís out there- you can actually taste the flavor. A delightful treat with a modest finish.
Can at home. Cloudy straw color. Aroma is tropical fruits, pine and citrus, taste is grapefruit, a hint of tropical fruits and some grass.

Fantastic brew when fresh; as with many high-end DIPAs it can fall off if you don¬ít get to it within a month or so. Not the prettiest of pours, but it isn¬ít outright ugly. Such a delicious hop profile.
Poured milky yellow/orange with a small off white head. Aroma of medium sweet citrus and soft malt. Medium body, flavour is sweet orange and moderately malty. Bittersweet finish.

Bottle @ "Frikicata Cervezorama", Sr. L√∫pulo, Gij√≥n. 24-01-2015.
1pt can.
Nice hoppy IPA. Pours hazy golden with frothy white head. Herbal,grassy, citrusy aromas and flavours. Moderate bitterness. Enjoyable.

Really? Do I need to say anything else. If you are a hop head, this is like a pilgrimage to Mecca. I thought Pliny was over rated. This absolutely lives up to the hype and blew my mind. I¬íve made 2 separate trips from Michigan to Vermont to get this beer. All I can say is that it was worth it. I¬ím going back as soon as possible.

Tall can (thx, Alex G.!). Pours a hazy golden with a strong white head. Aroma is piney hops, some grassy, stone fruits and slight spicy notes. Taste is the same with earthy and dusty notes. Strong piney bitterness aftertaste. Good one, but definitely overhyped.
One of the best tasting I.P.A s out there. Drinking from the can actually works!

Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupe≈Çniania profilu na ratebeer. Po prostu Heady! Sok z owoc√≥w tropikalnych, genialny aromat i goryczka fantastycznej jako≈õci. Wspania≈Çe piwo, totalny wyznacznik stylu, chcia≈Çbym mieƒá do niego na tyle dobry dostƒôp, by m√≥c traktowaƒá je jako everyday beer.

Une biere jaun√¢tre, dor√©e, avec une carbonatation tr√®s imposante et un corps un peu trouble. Au nez ce n¬íest pas la bi√®re la plus explosive, avec des ar√¥mes un peu alcoolis√©es et √©galement plut√¥t r√©sineuses. En bouche, c¬íest d√©finitivement beaucoup plus ax√© sur l¬íamertume que sur un autre profil de saveur. Les IBU se font dr√¥lement ressentir, mais l¬íamertume n¬íest pas agressante, ne vient pas tout prendre du liquide. Elle est pr√©sente mais appr√©ciable, avec un c√¥t√© r√©sineux que l¬íon remarque fort bien. Au final on comprend pourquoi elle est tant appr√©ci√©e, mais est-ce la meilleure DIPA au monde? Pas √† mon humble avis.

Disregarded the directions on the can in order to get a proper rating. I listened to the directions afterwards and drank it straight from the can. Hazy gold color with tiny specks of sediment. Aroma is tropical fruit and with bright hops. Light and refreshing aroma. Flavor is balanced and juicy. They have this whole IPA thing figured out.

50cl can from the Bierkoning Amsterdam
Aroma: A lot of tropical fruit, pine, resin and a strong caramel scent
Looks: Hazy golden pour with off white head
Taste: Citrus zest bitterness. Rather dry. A lot of citrus tastes
Feel: Medium body, medium carbonation
Overall:Very good beer, though in my opinion overhyped.
16oz can brought by bananabi11 via trade, and shared by all. Thanks! Color of old gold. Bitter fruity. Quite tasty. Finishes more bitter than bittersweet. The hype is warranted. 16.4
One of my favourite ipa very good hop balance and very good body!About aroma i want more!
Great hazy pour. Huge tropical notes. Amazing big hops, sharp orange zest. Perfect balance, one of the best !

hazy gold with sudsy white head and lots of chunky sediment. medium body with moderately high carbonation.

aroma: tangerine, roses, sweet bready malt, slight notes of hop resin.

taste: earthy grassy pithy bitter citrusy hops, bready malt
Fruity nose with grapefruit, pineapple. Medium body. Low bitterness. Alcohol well hidden. Perfectly balanced.

Pours a hazy golden yellow color with a big bubbly white head and a lot of bubbles on the side of the glass. Aroma is a mix of Pine, citrus, peaches, tropical fruit, a bit of floral. Taste is kind of dry at first then you get a first hit of hops and alcohol. It hits you in waves. It¬ís quite bitter. It lingers a long time. Pretty full body. It¬ís well balanced. Very good

UPDATED: NOV 12, 2016 Pours a cloudy bright yellow with light white head. A strong malt aroma with caramel, citrus and hops. A sweet malt, caramel, citrus, hop and pine taste. A lingering sweet malt and light bitter hop aftertaste.
Tasting session @ Budapest. Thanks for sharing to Oliver BREW YOUR MIND Brewery. perfect. thats all!!!!

Thanks a lot, bartlebier, for sharing this cellar-treasure @ October-brewpub! Outstandingly balanced DIPA, packed with fruity, grapefruity and piney hops, with a big malt body to let the complexity of hops shine. Great balance of sweet and bitter, perfect carbonation.

50cl can at home. Cloudy straw/light golden colour, white foamy head. Crisp and complex citrusy, floral, grassy, spruce hop profile, lightly malted, medium bitter finish. Very well balanced, maybe a bit too much. Nicely building, hopped-up aftertaste: grassy and citrusy. To my liking the body could have been bigger, but it makes the hops stand out nicely: great flavors. Mouthfeel¬ís oily, medium-low carbonation.
Hazy gold Amber little white head; aroma is mild hop malted grains; flava is rich hop bitters and mit much else; feels thick chewey with moderate fizz; finishes bitter tangy roasty

Pours a five finger white head that fades slowly to a ring leaving a good lace. Hazy light amber color. Good carbonation and medium bodied. Pine hop nose and flavor is pine and grapefruit, occasional hints of caramel. Lingering pine hop bitterness. With most raters saying this DIPA is the best I expected more. Dogfish 90 minute is better. $15.03 for a 4-pak of 16oz cans from Montpelier Discount Beverage Montpelier, VT.
From can and tap a couple of times. Smells really good with lots of nice hops. Hazy colour, nice hoppy flavour.

Hazy golden color with White medium head. Medium body. Aroma of pine and grapefruit. Hoppy grassy taste. Also pine, lemon, grapefruit and light malt. Great balanced on bitterness. One of the best beers ever tasted!

16oz can from the brewery. Clear golden with some sediment.Fruity nose with grapefruit, orange zest, pineapple. Up front bitterness with a light lasting tropical sweetness on the back-end. Very pleasant in mouth; medium bodied. A well balanced, stellar beer.
Can. Clear Golden color, white head. Fruity, citrus, orange zest, lychee. Great mouthfeel, bitter aftertaste. Balanced. Sweet

Hazy golden color with a fingers worth of head. Aroma is of grapefruit, peach, stone fruit, pine. Taste of grapefruit, stone fruit, peach, lemon peel, grassy, pine, light dankness. Light doughy malt, medium mouthfeel, pointed bitterness.

it¬ís that good. rare for a beer with this much hype to be as good as I expected. the pineapple flavor was all at the tail end of this...whcih is almost weird. for a double IPA, it¬ís exactly what i want in terms of balancing bitter with hops with sweet with alcohol. what makes this special is the delay between the hops and the sweet fruit you get later in the drink. it¬ís unusual and it¬ís awesome.

This beer lived up to the hype for me! I did as it said and drank from the can to start, Amazing!!! but I wanted to see it and get a better smell so I poured the rest into an IPA glass. It could be the best smelling IPA/beer I¬íve ever been lucky enough to sniff. I can go on and on about the amount of hops that smack you in the face or tastebuds but until you have one yourself you will not understand.

I felt the need to disobey the can¬ís instructions: "drink from the can!" in order to give it a proper review. It poured a cloudy gold with a finger width head. The aroma was mostly floral hops with some citrus and some grassy hops. It had a strong citrus flavor with some subtle hoppiness. As blasphemous as it sounds, I don¬ít think this beer meets the hype.......

Heady Topper is an superb Imperial IPA with a hazy light golden and a soft white head. Nose is a very pleasant citrus. Initial taste is has a wonderful bitterness with the grapefruit taste you would expect. Fades to a spicy afterglow. Carbonation is just right, Finishes clean, with a trace of mint and an almost key lime taste. This is a great IPA that everyone should try at least once.
Pours a hazy golden color nice pineapple and citrus aromas flavors of tropical citrus pineapple great hoppiness and delicious beer

16oz can purchased at the Alchemist Brewery in Stowe, VT. Pours dark burnt orange. Delicious mouthfeel, citrus notes and very bitter but in a good way. Lasting bitterness and flavor all the way down. One of the top DIPAs for a reason.

2016/09/12 - I have been looking forward to trying this beer for a few years now, so here goes...Pours a slightly hazy pale amber colour with a thick, soapy white head that lingers and leaves moderate, patchy lacing. Aroma hits you in the face the second that the can is cracked. Amazing aroma. Tons of fruit (grapefruit, orange, lemon curd, pineapple, mango), heavy floral and light vegetal notes, bread, caramel and pine. Taste is lots of citrus and tropical fruits, vegetal notes, light caramel, bread, mild pine and a hint of alcohol as it warms. Mouthfeel is medium and smooth with creamy carbonation and a dry, moderately bitter and slightly warming finish. This beer is worth the hype; delicious, complex and unique enough to stand out.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: SEP 22, 2016 16oz can. Pours a hazy orange gold with a medium white head. Aroma is floral, fruit, earthy, and lightly malty. Taste is grapefruit, peach, light pine, and hints of bread with a maltiness in the finish. Moderately bitter. Medium body. Soft carbonation. Full, creamy mouthfeel.

Notas citricas, frutales y tropicales muy intensas.
Corona de espuma abundante de buena retencion. Cuerpo medio, color naranja, ligeramente turbia.
En boca es dulce, intensamente frutal, final seco, retrogusto extraordinario.

Al paladar es excelente. Destacan las notas a pi√±a, naranja, mandarina y toronja. El final es largo y sorprendente.

Definitivamente una cerveza que mejora conforme pasan los teagos y queda cerca de la perfecci√≥n.

Pounder from a friend. Thanks Major Tom! Oak, pineapple, overripe grapefruit nose. Cloudy amber, medium head, good retention, some lacing. Grapefruit, pineapple, pine, oak, thistle. Medium body, easy carbonation, resinous. Extremely hoppy, nice sharp bitter bite. I would have liked a maltier balance, but that¬ís the most trivial nit pick. Yeah, it¬ís worth the hype.
Sample at a tasting. Fruity and quite dank. Light malt sweetness with dank notes and a somewhat harsh bitterness. Not up to the hype, I am afraid.
Hazy, straw color, Aroma is good, Hoppy but not too much, well hidden. But when taste it, the hoppy flavor comes very strong. Very complex but well balanced. Piney... Dry finish.
They definitely say drink out of the can for a reason. Great , difficult to find, beer. Refreshing, bold, soft... it's great

Can, courtesy of Casp. Finally getting the chance to try this! Nose is clogged, but I hear that is not important for this beer anyway. Thick, heavy, fruity, intense. Very, very tasty. Some pines, some tropical stuff. Long fruity mango finish, very nice. Good stuff.

Can from the brewery, less than a week old. 
A completely opaque straw gold with a juicy sweet fruity hop bouquet of orange blossoms, prickly pear and mild pine. Med-full bodied with a relatively soft mouthfeel and a super dry finish. The taste lives up to the hype with tons of juicy hops playing all over the spectrum from fruity to peppery to piney this is good stuff but wasn¬ít mind-blowing or anything.
Unas de las cervezas mas completas que conozco, bomba de lupulo sin ser necesariamente una bomba de amargor, gran balance.  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android

Can via facebook trade. Thanks Javier. Poured from can like instructed. On first sip was a bit underwhelmed however on second the flavor becomes a little more apparent. Peach and melon and a bit of light resin on the backend. A little onion to round things out. Nowadays there are plenty local double IPAs that would stand up to this. It's nice but maybe a bit over hyped. Between this and pliney the elder I would take pliney.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

16 oz can @ Idletyme Brewing. Pours hazy pale yellow golden with thin white head. Aroma is juicy lemony fresh hops, earthy light caramel malt. Taste is clean light caramel malt; big earthy hops - lemon, grapefruit, and grassy notes stand out. This is excellent, but honestly overrated.
Overall: Floral, citric notes, pine, resin. Oily and smooth. A modest fine bitterness.Note: Can 355 ml at home. Reviewed 2016-08-02.
Lots of citrus and floral hips. Very smooth for a double IPA. Maybe the hype set my expectations too high.

Finally got try the infamous heady.. Super bright aroma, great full mouthfeel. Got overripe peaches, orange juice, a little funk of pickles. Nice lacing, cloudy pour. Amazing how the taste changes as it warms.

Great beer! If I lived in VT, this would be my go to. Honestly after having tried it, don¬ít know what all the hype is about..

De llauna al BBF-Lab. Cervesa color groc-daurat una mica t√®rbola i amb escuma blanca poc duradora. Aromes d¬íherba, resina i afruitats que recorden al mel√≥ i/o al pomelo. en boca tamb√© trobo cereal, galeta i m√©s resina amb un final llarg, sec i amarg. Molt bona.

Canshare with Bratchris - Aroma is enormously tropical, candy-like fruits. Incredibly complex aroma. Flavor has lemoncurd, sherbet, tropical, citrus. A very clean bitterness finishes this beer nicely. World class.

Cans and draught since the second-coming of Alchemist (post-flood), most recently on draught at the new brewery, 7/8/16.Never did manage to have it pre-flood. Seems like I was always missing it by a week or a few days. But I¬ím confident it¬ís as good as it always was.Tough to rate these sacred cows. What more could I possibly say here for its 1,482nd rating? I generally shy away from rating the big boys like this (haven¬ít really wanted to log a rate for Westy 12, for the same reason). But whatever.Of Focal, Crusher and this, that I had on draught at the new brewery, this was the weakest of the three. Not by a huge margin, but a noticeable one.A bit too much garlic and cat/sweat, moreso than in other batches I¬íve had. Probably a pretty standard "problem" with beers of its nature, though I do think it still remains highly enjoyable. Lots of sweat, lemon rind, light pineapple and dank spiciness. Good, dry, crackery malts back it and the yeast is clean, providing no alcohol or flaws. Soft melon/watermelon as it warms, emerges, enjoyably so.Fantastically soft texture, with a dry nature overall, but still a malty-soft feel to it with mostly tight carbonation. Bitterness is certainly felt, but never becomes overbearing/fatiguing. Gains various levels of tropical fruit and citrus depending on how fresh it is. I do love the dryness and overall understated hop character. It¬ís always enjoyable seeing people that don¬ít understand it drink it for the first time and complain that they don¬ít think it¬ís very good and don¬ít get what the big deal is; since I¬ím a cynical asshole.

Pint can, very hazy (unpasteurized) apricot, thick head and sticky lacing. 
I chuckled when I saw other reviews mentioned tomato, but uh, yeah, tomatoes! I get it. 
Velvety smooth, not spicy, aromatic, nice smooth bitterness on the finish. 
Delightful. Gift from friends (thanks Barry) returning from Vermont.

Pours hazy apricot with a fair creamy head. Aroma features strong hoppy and citrus tones. Bold flavor delivers resiny hops, fresh malt and tangy orange-grapefruit citrus notes. Mouthfeel offers firm body and lively fizz. Yet another beer off my bucket list!
Can. Color hazy orange with small white head. Aroma grapefruit, peach, citrus. Taste bitter, citrus, peach, grapefruit, herbal.

Cloudy orange color with foam ring. Grassy hoppy nose with some tomato aromas. The taste is delightfully clean bitter with a creamy, light juicy and a little sweet thin body. Very nice bitterness, a tiny boozyness and a little dryness in the aftertaste. Perfect to drink beer.

Hazy bright yellow with little white head. Aroma is tomatoes, grass, sugar, pine cone, citrus. Taste is is very sour with fruity sweetness. Mouthfeel is very smooth, more of the same in the finish. Overall good.

UPDATED: JUN 29, 2016 My 100th US brewery. Can from a trade with sneakychi, many thanks! Pours hazy orange color with a white head. Aroma is tomato, resinous, grassy hops. Taste is juicy, resinous, grassy, yeasty. Smooth mouthfeel, a bit of a booze punch in the back. Very good, but completely different from what I expected. It¬ís much more simple, but still a bit delicate. Extremely drinkable though.

UPDATED: JUN 13, 2017 Really fresh can, danke Stefan! Salty, dank, light vegetal - strong tomato vine! Cloudy yellow, white lace. Medium body, foamy. Herbal, tomato vine again, fermenting citrus peel, salt finish. Alright, interesting, a bit overyped, but very very drinkable.

(can, many thanks to sinh4!) hazy golden colour with a frothy white head. aroma of herbal hops, nettles and sweatsocks, with a light touch of cherry stones, some yeast slurry and honeymelon. flavour is mostly yeast and pale malts, quite resinous, with some more nettles, herbal hops and a medium-bitter finish. medium- to heavy-bodied with average carbonation.

Very pale opaque orange pour with healthy frothy white head a half inch high. Delicious juicy citrus aroma, bit of tropical fruits like pineapple too, pollen and lavender as well. Carbonation is average, nothing to note of mouthfeel, finishes crisp. Strong malt backbone, some herbals, bit boozy, acidic strong citrus that's slightly bitter. Dynamite. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: JUL 8, 2016 Can from Bier Berlin bottle shop. Heavy hoppy aroma of citrus, grapefruit, peach, followed by nicely balanced caramel. Taste reflects the aroma. Medium body. Medium to high bitterness. Medium carbonation.

From a can. Hazy golden with a frothy offwhite head. Aromas of fruity hops, caramel, citrus, resin. Medium bodied with moderate carbonation. Medium sweet, heavily bitter. Delicious hoppy character into an exquisite finish. Extraordinary IPA,

1 pint can. A cloudy golden beer with a small white head. Aroma is of citrus, especially orange, floral hints, pine and hops. Taste is bitter with some carbonation. Medium bodied, smooth and astringent with floral and very bitter finish. Perfectly balanced hoppy beer.

appearance:  cloudy yellow gold, with a finger of thick, creamy white head that persisted and shrunk only slightly; good lace rings around the glass.  aroma: up front it¬ís citrus first (lemon, grapefruit, some blood orange), then floral, then tropical (pineapple, mango), and then resinous pine, over a hint of pie crust and pepper.  taste: the hops meld almost completely into a distinct whole, with elements of pine, grass, herbal, tropical, floral, and citrus hops all coming together into an earthy, funky, fresh, bright mix; there¬ís some malty sweetness and notes of lemon curd underneath to provide some heft.  finish: 	dry, slightly chewy, with the hops and sweetness and a hint of alcohol all coming together with enough carbonation to keep the thing from crushing you. notes: 	It¬ís surprisingly drinkable and balanced, and the alcohol is well hidden. Mouthfeel felt almost grainy, but in a good way. Did not expect this to live up to the hype, but no kidding it actually did. Can from Paul at work, who is my new best friend.

UPDATED: MAY 22, 2016 Can in Burlington poured into pint glass with commonmac and rosskyle and samadouche. Hazy orange with white head and excellent lacing . Clean funky citrus nose. Amazing taste from the start. Incredibly smooth, then citrus, clean subtle spice. Citrus funk, then well masked alcohol and hop. Sweet more than bitter. Alcohol comes out as it warms. Exactly what a dipa should be. This actually lives up to the hype.

This is strange to type but I¬íve finally been able to consume one of these and it comes at Ri Ra in Burlington. Sadly, yes it¬ís out of a can at an Irish bar but let¬ís be honest does it matter where you imbibe on this legendary beer? Commonshawn, rosskyle, and samadouche are also enjoying this one. Beautiful orange and golden in color with healthy half finger white head. Tropical fruit and subtle pine on the nose. Taste is a perfect balance of sweetness and hoppy notes. Tropical fruit and sugars play a great role. Softer mouthfeel than anticipated and it makes it even better. Unbelievably smooth. I¬íve fallen in love with this beer. I will consume again. This I promise you.

Served on tap at Ri Ra Irish Pub. Hazy orange color with a white head. Citrus resin hops aroma. Tropical fruit avocado pine hops flavor. All well balanced. Medium body.

It¬ís deffently one of the best beers I had, worth all the hype ppl say. It¬ís amazing that it is a double and bittered almost like a pale and the resin flavor come out on every sip.

Pine aroma filled the room as soon as I opened the can. Hazy. Ive been over IPAs for awhile, but this could bring me back in. Very drinkable. Really accents the pine, tropical fruit rinds, and citrus. Cracker dry. Really evolves on the palate, starts off pine and rounds out bitter. Good bitter though. Thanks ThePatrickman for helping me score this want.....week old none the less!

58 year old physician with all kinds of discretionary income found myself standing in line, in the rain, in 35 degree weather, waiting for a Heady delivery in Barre, Vt. Asking myself: "My God, has my life really come to this?" Scored a case, not embarrassed by my actions. The aroma blew me away. Flowers and lemons. Does not drink like 8%, which is dangerous. Got down to one of my last cans and committed heresy by pouring it into a snifter. What a beautiful yellow almost fluorescent color! Beyonc√© in a can.
I really didn¬ít think there was any way it could live up to the hype. It did.  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android

Rated from a 4 pack that my co-worker brought back from Vermont. Tried in both the can as suggested and poured into a glass. Not much of a difference in flavor/aroma but the carbonation was obviously a bit higher in the can. I must say I enjoyed this beer out of the glass a bit more. Pours a hazy golden with a thick white head. Aroma is of medium strength in the hop vibrancy department, citrusy/grapefruity. Flavor has strong grapefruit /citrus up front then a twinge of orange. Simple pale malt bill to let the hop character to shine. Medium bodied with a smooth texture and moderate carbonation. Drinks VERY easily for an 8% abv beer. The bitterness level, while totally appropriate for an IPA, is VERY smooth. While it doesn¬ít taste like Bells Two Hearted, it has a similar drinking experience for me. Overall, didn¬ít quite knock my socks off but a really good beer that I would like to have again.

A week old can, pours hazy light gold, creamy white head doesn¬ít stick around. Aroma of grapefruit juice almost grapefruit pith, some tangerine and light honey like malt. Flavor lots more grapefruit, smooth honey like malt flavor, firm bitterness. Creamy mouthfeel almost slick, bitterness doesn¬ít linger. Super smooth no alcohol warming, sneaky 8.0%

Aroma: dried pineapple, spearmint, grassy notes, mango
Taste: peach, mango, pine,

Gift can that is product of a Smokey and the Banditesque beer run. Pale hazy yellow, no lasting head, little lace. Hops on nose. Sip is good, more hops than malt with plenty of each. Hops turn bitter fast. I get it, but this is more a case of demand or exclusivity prompting a higher rating.
Hazy yellow orange pour with a white head. Aroma is citrus, peach, pine, and toffee. Taste is peach and citrus with a bit of pine. Easy bitterness. Soft palate. Great beer.

Very hazy light golden and a soft white ringed head. Nose is grassy spearmint, husky malt and more honied citrus. Initial taste is an excellent strip of bitterness, fairly grainy and faintly grapefruit. Fades into a decent nosh of spicy honey booziness. Finishes clean enough, more minty citrus and creamy key lime and lingers out steely and vibrant and not at all like a fresh sipping DIPA. UPDATED: MAY 29, 2016 Un corp onctueux qui d√©voile des saveurs douces de melon miel, mandarine et l√©g√®rement florale. L¬íamertume se m√©lange merveilleusement bien avec les saveurs. Un chef d¬íoeuvre tout simplement.

Can from a friend. Light and hazy amber with medium amount of white head. Aroma of hop, resin and grapefruit. Medium body. Soapy. More resin. Drinkable enough, very hoppy, bitter and, honestly, strange in a unique "this is interesting" kind of way. Must be a million types of hops in here.

Pours a hazy light orange gold. Aroma is delightful mix of citrus, mango and pine. Taste is bright citrus and tropical fruit with gentle hop bite. Nice carbonation. Nice complexity. Nice balance. Excellent.

Four-pack after waiting in line to pick up Lawson¬ís Sip of Sunshine. Was actually offered Heady as well so figured I better take it. Brewer recommends drinking it straight from can, however, its color is one of the strongest traits. Orange-cloudy is pretty darn close to perfect. Citrus aroma a plus as well. Piney-citrus taste-too bitter for my taste.Clean finish. A good beer but I have trouble understanding the hype. Can name a number of Vermont beers I¬íd rather drink before this.

I intend to have this again. Courtesy of Magic Mike Trahan. Beautiful glowing golden color. Aroma was surprisingly faint and taste was a dry, hoppy unified spicy beam. Not the most complex IPA I¬íve ever had which makes me wonder how it was stored and how old it was. But obviously a top tier product.

Don¬ít believe the hype. The good: It is very drinkable. It does taste good. Contrary to many I believe the color is fine. The bad: There are many better Double/Imperial IPA¬ís out there. Many from Oregon. Many from the North east. It says to drink out of the can. I¬ím sorry I¬ím not 18 drinking bud or busch light.. It¬ís a little pricey. It¬ís hard to get. Which is why I lean to the hype issue. It does totally not live up to the hype that it is the holy grail of IPA¬ís. It is a very good, very drinkable beer. I have enjoyed over 12 of them so I feel I have a pretty good idea. Would I buy it again yes, However, when I went to buy it, I was more excited to see all the other beers that I could get singles of that were available. When I go back to buy it it will be for the other beer possibilities not just Heady Topper.
Can from a friend. Orange and cloudy. Huge hop aroma. Giant hop bomb mind f@#k! Best double IPA in the world. All hail the Alchemist!

Can from Tristan. Hazy light orange pour with a fluffy white head. Huge citrus, mango and tropical fruit hop aroma. Light malt body, crisp with clean citrus and tropical fruit hop taste. Light hop bite in the aftertaste. Excellent!

Hazy light amber, offwhite froth. Fruity aroma, peach, grapefruit and pineapple. Similar flavour, fruity with good piney bite. Very drinkable. Very nice.

Can. Pours hazy amber with airy white head. Complex aroma of citrus, hops and fruit, with notes of malt and touches of yeast. Sweetish flavour of fruit and malt,mwith bitter notes of hops and grass and citric touches. Bitter, hoppy afteraste with touches of fruit and hints of grass. High carbonation. Well-balanced and very enjoyable. Good stuff.

Can, 8%. Grapefruity aroma. Cloudy orange colour. Small stable white head. The flavour starts off quite bitter but there is also a fruity and papery note in there. High bitterness, I would actually have liked a bit more sweetness to balance it. Very good creamy mouthfeel.

From Can (from drankencentrale Rotsaert, Zedelgem for 9,95 euro) as it should be, but poured in a perfect glass (not like it should be). But I wanted to share ... My wife wanted to share. Nice golden colour with perfect stable and lacing head. Smell ... hmmm like perfect hops, just like the taste. Very soft and maybe the most balanced beer I¬íve ever tried. On this moment the nummer 3 IPA in the word and I understand why. Nice experience and worth the money!

Incredibly hoppy.. well at 120 IBU, what do you expect? Heavy amounts of pine, good amount of tropical citrus (pineapple/grapefruit) and a hint of rosemary. It¬ís a bit too much for me as it appears I prefer more of a moderate 80ish IBU IPA but damn, this is a new experience for me.

A hazy orange color with a white head. Good lazing. Aroma of citrus, some pine, slight yeast and caramel. Taste is dominated by citrus and pine, but with a nice balance of bitterness and caramel. A good IIPA.

UPDATED: MAR 25, 2016 Believe the hype. Initiated into Headyness by   can at the Green Mountain Inn. Samples from can and glass. Unbelievable beer experience when  administered by either route. Really ugly appearing beer however . Best left in the can as directed. Hop aroma is overpowering Tropical fruit,  herbal. Peach flavor blasted by the diverse hops. Intense bitter finish.  Believe the hype.

Appearance: Opaque golden colour with a small white head.
Aroma: Fruit, hops, perfume, tropical fruit, citrus, pineapple, a bit floral.
Body: Medium to full body, medium carbonation.

It loses points because it says to drink from the can. Amazing aroma and flavour. Wow. I could drink this all day. No bitterness.

Can from thepatrickman-thanks! Have had this just once before and somehow didn¬ít rate it?! Slightly cloudy light gold. Nose leaps out of the glass while pouring (yeah, I know, drink from the can...) with classic grapefruit pith and pine. Taste is malty, dry biscuit base with long bitter grapefruit finish and flavors of citrus hops and pine.

Fresh can yesterday, but also many, many cans over the years. Heady is a strange beast -- there¬ís no doubt that it¬ís a great DIPA, with a complex layer of hops and a fantastic aroma. But I¬íve tried it in a blind taste test of some of the great New England DIPAs (Trillium, Tree House, Maine Beer Company), and it always comes out towards the bottom. Compared to the latest generation of fruity, juicy hop bombs it tastes a bit too bitter and too one-dimensionally piney. Can¬ít deny it¬ís good stuff, though, and a giant piece of beer history.

Never disappoints. From a region full of great DIPA it is still one of the best.
Every beer lover should try it.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Opalescent golden (EBC 8-10), frothy white head, top lacings. Aromas of orange, pine, lime, sublime bright caramel notes, barnyard, some lychee and pink grapefruit develop onb the nose. Smooth carbonation, light slick, soft and elegantly slender body coming at a surprise at this abv. Excellently balanced, light sweet with a well structured hop bitterness profile. Develops a beautiful lasting softly dry finish. Very harmonic beer!

Aroma- hoppy floral deliciousness
Color- light slightly cloudy. Straw colored
Taste- bright hop start with a hoppy finish that isn't overly tart

Overall a fantastic DIPA. You aren't confronted with an overly alcoholic aroma or taste and the hops are well balanced with the malt to provide a smoother finish.

Can. A small pour into a glass reveals a hazy amber pour with white head. Aroma has grass, apricot and peach. Taste is refreshing with significant bitterness. Every tastebud is on fire here. Starts sweet with rasin and ends with slightly warming feeling from the ABV. High carbonation. Extraordinary

Can. Finally got my hands on this thanks to my b-law. Color is cloudy orange yellow. Aroma is full on tropical notes (pineapple). Taste is tropical hops with some pine notes. Medium bitterness. Nice balanced beer. Not overly bitter. Creamy texture. This is a very good IPA.

Their secret is horse urine. The secret behind the secret is that you have to feed the horses tangerines and lemons. So there you have it. True alchemy - gold from horse piss.

In a 16oz can. Big head. Not the prettiest beer: Looks like cloudy urine. Aroma of mead and toffee. Flavors of pulpy orange juice, honey, tangerine, toffee, Finishes with a bit of sweetness. No... bitterness. No... sweetness. And back and forth it goes. The hype is well-earned. World-class.

1 Pint cans enjoyed @ home, several times the last couple of weeks. Pours hazy golden orange with a fluffy white head. Aroma is bursting with citrus, grapefruit, oranges, orange zest, pine, peach, pineapple, mango, grassy and spicy bitterness. Flavour is medium sweet and medium bitter. Full bodied, smooth and juicy texture, soft to average carbonation. Finish is citrus, tropical fruits, juicy and lingering bitterness.

Probably a little harder on this beer since it was a can I was holding on to for half a year. I remember it tasting better. Still a vg IPA. Hazy golden, minimal head, strong bitterness. A bit of pine in the hops.
The mother of all Ipas, the best IIPA i¬íve ever tried very drinkable , I¬ím and addict , very hard to find!
A bit of pine and yeast in smell. Pale yellow. Fruity with pine finish. Molasses with passion fruit finish. Good solid beer.

I know! "Drink From The Can!" they say... but I HAD to pour a small amount to a sniffer :) 
The beer is a little hazy, yellow with a one finger high, white head. 

Nose: A lot of fruity hops! Orange, mandarine, grapefruit, pear, citrus, pine and honey. 
Taste: So good! An explosion of tropical fruit. Citrus, orange, grapefruit, pine, grass and malt. 
Mouthfeel: Full body. Crisp carbonation. Oily feeling. Dry, bitter ending. 

This IS a great beer but we do have a little bit to much hype here...

Aroma is sweet and hoppy with mango, pineapple, grapefruit and everything you expect from this style, only a little better. Taste brings it big time, orange peels, green grass, pineapple, pine oils and general awesomeness. It had a little more "green" aura than I expected, but still a top notch Imperial IPA. Praise the Lord.

I have been waiting to try this beer for a while and needless to say I was disappointed. I think it was probably because the hype was so high. Had a great aroma, which was very clean and tempting. I drank it from the can so I was not able to really get an appearance factor. The taste on the other hand is what caught me off guard. Many blended tastes of fruit, spice, pine, resin with an awkward after taste that left me puzzled. Defiantly a must try, but have had many more enjoyable beers with less recognition.

Finally had a chance to try this and was not disappointed at all Amber color with a small, off white head that left nice lacing on the glass. Aroma of pine, floral hops, citrus, honey, and alcohol Taste of sticky pine sap, citrus, resiny hops, grass, grapefruit, and some alcohol in the finish. Socks blown off a GREAT beer

Can shared by Murat, february 5th 2016, tnx mate! Hazy, yellow body, with a small white head. Aroma starts pretty subtle, pine, citrus kicking in. After a while it opens up as a serious hop -forward aroma, balanced by a nice rye-ish malt presene. Taste is all about the huicy hops, peach, grapefruit, with pine being present, though not overwhelming. After settling down thinking ok this is a serious hop bomb, it delivers a new punch of fruiyu hp√•√•iness. Clearly defined yet baanced bitterness in harmony with a notable malt sweetness, absolutely top notch for an iipa. Finish leaves a robust malt sweetness together with grapefruit, for the few seconds I¬ím waiting before the next sip. A great beer! Does it live u to the hype? Not sure, but I believe it does it as far as an imperial ipa can, so that¬ís a yes for me. You won¬ít find many better of the style.

Large can at O¬íConnors, thanks for the share! Cloudy golden with white head. Aroma hoppy, herbs, grass, lemon, orange, grapefruit, pine and malty notes. Taste is slight malty and big on the hops. Herbs, grass, fruit, resin with a lingering high bitterness that I really love. Easily one of the best DIPAs I¬íve ever had. Believe the hype.

Can at Farmhouse Tap & Grill, Burlington. Deliver 2 days ago and canned 5-6 ago according to bartender. Colour is deep golden with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Fruits, citrus, grape, hops and malts. Very nice burst of hops when opening can. Definitive DIPA? Massive drinkability.

Thanks to my man Chris Cope! You rock! Pours a cloudy yellow with a frothy head. Aroma Is a great mix of pine and floral. Taste is malty sweet, but not obnoxious. It's bitter, but also balanced. As good as advertised. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Can at Croxleys Ale House RVC. Wow! The can is right, "wave after wave of hoppy goodness" Obviously one of the best IPA's on the planet. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours golden with a thin line of white head. Aroma; Citrus, herbal, orange, malt, grass, mandarin and floral notes. Flavours; Citrus, grass, mandarin, malt, herbs and pine. Well balanced beer.

1 pint can thanks to _angst_! Sampled on February 10, 2016.Very cloudy golden color, white head with lacing. Hoppy, herbal, light citrus scent, also some caramel malt. Bitter, hoppy, grassy, dandelion stems taste. Bitter, resin, bread crust, soem orange marmalade aftertaste. Medium to full mouthfeel, high bitterness.

I wrote to this Company because it did not live up to what I expected, I gave them the batch Number and hope i just got an old can of this brew. I t is good and will try it again if i am assured it is a fresh one. Best part it was a free beer as a new friend i gave a bomber of Yellow rose (lone Pint) returned a favor cause I have never tried a heady topper before. MAYBE IT IS ME? I just love a certain taste in ipa I can only find in Yellow rose, Born Yesterday, and the 2015 batch of Hoppy Birthday to you, and In the 2015 kegs of space cakes by Clown Shoes. If any one knows what I am tasting and can refer a simular taste to me please do so.
pour pale with a fine white head. wauw a nice aroma. like opening a bag full of fresh hops. mandarin, orange, floral, dank. taste medium bitter, really nice ballance!

Draft, from can - Pours a darkish orange-amber in color with a very small white head that fades quickly. Low carbonation. Aroma is piney with some citrus and also some malty sweetness. Flavor is a "heady" mix of sweet malts along with medium bitter citrus and pine hops. Palate is quite thick and almost slightly oily. Finish is medium bitter and lingering along with the intense hop flavors. I absolutely LOVE this beer.

A: Orange/yellow to brown, with a nice and thick two finger white head. N: Grapefruit, wet wood, forest, hemp, dandelions, bubblegum T: grapefruit, forest, mushrooms, pine, resin O: Very nice and very well balanced! Lovely bitterness and packed with hop flavours.

duft: frugtig s√∏dlig appelsin mandarin 
smag:citrus lime rimlig bitter med kant af frisk appelsin lidt honing melon. bl√∏d tyk malt eftersmag

From a can. Since I live in neighboring NH I can make periodic beer runs. The best aroma of any beer I've ever had. There are so many different tastes in this beer I may never tire of it. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Can. Golden/light amber coloured. Unclear. Dense light beige haed. Aroma. Herbs, flowers, vague tropical fruits, sweetness, grape, grass. Flavour. Herbs, flowers, tropical fruitgs, sweetness, grape, grass, spice. Medium to full bodied. Ends flowery bitter and grapy. Very nice and well worth all the hype IMO.

From can. I love you MrOrla! <3 pous hazy orange with a white head. Aroma of juice, tropical, citra hops?, seems super fresh! Taste is tropical, peaches, pineapple, prolonged bitterness, light sweetness with a bitter finish. This baby has all the right moves!

Pint size can picked up at Mikkeller Bar, Victoriagade. Let¬ís see if this is worth all the hype. Hazy, golden colour with an amber tint, and a creamy white head. Fruity aroma with sweet exotic fruits, apricot, peaches and citrus fruits - grape and a hint of Nelson Sauvinon. Taste is bitter. Medium to full body with a creamy texture and an average carbonation. Finishes long lasting dry and bitter with a lot of citrus fruits. A slightly toasted note. Excellent IIPA - well recommended.

A 1 pint can canned on 15th December 2015 (I would have drank it earlier but was very sick for a long period of time) and tried from the can at first then poured into a Spiegelau IPA glass. It poured a hazy golden yellow orange colour with a two finger white head that dissipated fairly quickly but left nice sticky lacing. As soon as I opened the can the tropical aromas immediately came pouring out, but there was still a hint of the metal from the can. After pouring it into the glass, the aromas were not as strong but better with a mix of tropical pineapple, mango and citrus mandarin, orange peel and lemon zest. There was also a hint of pine. Taste was strong juicy citrus grapefruit and pine with a hint of tropical mango and pineapple. Nice front loaded bitterness which continues into the aftertaste. On the can it says ¬ìdrink from the can¬î so I tried that as well. I have to say that taste is just as impressive from the can. Medium bodied with medium carbonation. Overall, an excellent DIPA. Must buy and taste fresh if possible. I only wish I wasn¬ít very sick when I received it¬Ö but I know I wouldn¬ít have been able to enjoy it as much if I drank it a month ago as I wouldn¬ít be able to taste or smell much. Although it says to drink from the can, which I did try, I still prefer to pour it into a glass to enjoy. It allows you to enjoy its look and gives a clearer aroma. Well worth the hype.

The aroma is heavy tropics. Flavor is hoppy but not as much as expected even though it¬ís got a lot of flavor fooling around all the way into the after taste. Pine, bitterness and tropics. What stands out is how smooth and well balanced it is and still complex. Best beer in the world? No, but the best IPA I¬íve ever had.

Can(s) from the recent Mikkeller Bottle Shop opening in Torvhallene, Copenhagen (both DFTC and via glass) - pours a glowing fuzzy golden orange colour with nice firm slowly dissipating white head and light lacing. Gorgeous tropical and citrus fruity with big in your face hoppy prominence, juicy and fresh with big hits of tangerine, grapefruit, mango, peach, resinous and grassy hoppy goodness, pine needles throughout, solid caramel malty backbone, lovely initial sweetness followed by a solid bitter finish. Immense.
Awesome! Maybe I¬ím biased because of the hype but this really was incredible. So many layers of flavors, really well balanced. Just incredible.

UPDATED: FEB 3, 2016 Can. Had it straight from the can as suggested on it so it could be black or red for all I know. :-D Fresh and hoppy aroma. Taste is sweet and resiny with a boatload of citrussy hops, pine and spices. Long-lasting bitter finish. Medium body and carbonation. I¬íve had more hoppy beers than this, but this one IS very smooth, balanced and quite delicious to be honest.

UPDATED: FEB 3, 2016 Can. Pours hazy golden with big creamy lasting head. Aroma is peach, dank hops, resin, green, citrus, pineapple, guava, tropical fruits, weed, orange and zesty spiciness. Taste is just the same. Resin, grapefruit, weed, oily texture from fresh hops, peach, melon, light spice. Really bitter and dry finish. Very crisp. Very good. Everything and more than i expected.
The aroma is sweet citrus and hops. The taste is true to the aroma. This beer is so incredibly smooth if you can get your hands on it! Not much I can add that hasn¬ít already been said...
No need for another review of this beer. It's awesome and lives up to its hype. Go after it if you haven't had it. A+
Can. Pours hazy golden. Aroma is grapefruit and pine. Taste is sweet and grapefruity / juicy with a piney grapefruit hoppy finish. It was worth the effort it took to get a can here in CO.

Lightly hazy yellow with a pale head. Aroma is tropical fruits, citrus, hint of dankness. Light-medium bodied, well balanced, lightly astringent resiny finish. Taste is tropical fruits, resin, citrus.
UPDATED: FEB 14, 2016 Got this one @ Szynkarnia Wroclaw: epic imperial ipa, really grassy and citrussy. Loved it.

Cloudy pour, somewhere between yellow and orange with a huge foamy head. Aroma is full of citrus with a slight bite to it. Kind of floral as well with hints of very overripe fruit. Taste is incredibly juicy. Full of citrus and passion fruit. Insanely balanced, which makes it so drinkable. No alcohol detectable. Medium bodied.
Extremely well balanced and layered taste. Amazing DIPA. Explosion of hops and citrus aromas. Def not overrated.

16 ounce can into tulip glass, no can dating. Pours fairly hazy/cloudy golden orange color with a 2 finger fairly dense and fluffy white head with great retention, that reduces to a nice cap that lasts. Nice dense foamy lacing clings around the glass. Aromas of big grapefruit, tangerine, pineapple, peach, papaya, mango, melon, lemon zest, orange rind, light pepper, pine, cracker, bread, herbal, and floral/grassy earthiness. Fantastic aromas with awesome complexity and balance of juicy citrus/tropical/piney hops and light-moderate pale malt notes; with great strength. Taste of big grapefruit, tangerine, pineapple, peach, papaya, mango, melon, lemon zest, orange rind, light pepper, pine, cracker, bread, herbal, and floral/grassy earthiness. Large amount of pine/citrus rind/spicy bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of grapefruit, tangerine, pineapple, peach, papaya, mango, melon, lemon/orange rind, pepper, pine, and herbal/floral/grassy earthiness on the finish for a while. Incredible complexity, robustness, and balance of citrus/tropical/piney hops and light-moderate pale malt flavors; with a great malt/bitterness balance and zero astringent hop flavors after the finish. Moderate dryness from bitterness that increases through the glass. Medium carbonation and medium-full bodied; with a very smooth, sticky/resinous, and fairly creamy/bready balanced mouthfeel that is awesome. Alcohol is very well hidden with minimal warming present after the finish. Overall this is an absolutely amazing DIPA style. All around incredible complexity, robustness, and balance of juicy citrus/tropical/piney hops and light-moderate pale malt flavors; and very smooth and easy to drink for the ABV. A insanely delicious offering.
Fantastic great nose and great taste. Super balanced yet complex. Each level from start to finish of this beer melds seamlessly together. Glad I could taste this beer!

Can. Pours a cloudy yellow gold with a moderate creamy beige head. Aroma is pine and grapefruit. Flavor is bittersweet malt and lots of juicy tropical fruit. Notes of pineapple, grapefruit and mango. There is an underlying sweet caramel maltiness. I guess there is a good mix of hops and tropical fruit. It just seems a lot lighter than I was expecting. Still, very nice. Thanks for sharing JB.

I¬íts Heady Topper,. The juicy hop aroma is just awesome. It¬ís not beer, it¬ís hop juice. No booze, juicy characters and nice bitter(but doesn¬ít feel like 120 IBUs). Also very drinkable. Can definitely agree this is the top IIPA.

Well, this rarity stumbled off a truck and into my lap, and I knew just the right person to pop it open with. Straight from the can first, and then poured to the glass. The mouth feel was the most remarkable aspect for me. The fine fizziness helped the citrus, grapefruit and hops to swirl across the palate from first bite through the pleasing smooth finish. Great beer, and even better company.

The white whale Limpin to my kitchen. Yellow honey must in the glass. superbly balanced body. Drink it from the can you say? Yes the pink grapefruit abounds but is enveloped by sweet full malts before they are allowed to overwhelm and run wild. Nice pick Chris!

Can (trade with non Rate Beer member); drank mostly from the can, poured a few sips into a glass; pours hazy gold with a white head; aroma of tropical fruits, pine, and a hint of malt; taste is bitter with tropical fruits, malt, and pine; finish is bitter; very nice (slight downgrade on the appearance since I mostly drank it from the can)
Great beer only available in Vermont color not great.... Why I¬ím assuming they advise to drink from the can but otherwise fantastic.  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android

16oz can into tulip. Tried a little from the can too. Minneapolis. 

Cloudy pale yellow-orange. Very nice head. 

Aroma is earthy, a little musty. Some grapefruit and lemon notes. 

Taste is largely bitter. Some sweetness in the finish. But less than expected.

Body is very full. Probably the best I have had for the style. Mouthfeel is almost frothy. 

Overall, very strong. I would put abrasive or king sue above this though. 


---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: MAR 13, 2017 Relate after having a few more times. This has to be bumped up. It¬ís so complex and delicious. ORIGINAL RATE - Can from buddy at work. Light golden pour, frothy head. I poured it into a glass despite the instructions on the can! Citrus bomb! Fruity aromas leap from the glass. Flavor is citrus fruit, grapefruit, mango, melons. Lots of fruit. Sweet and malty, thick. But a nice balancing hop kick brings a moderate to high bitterness. Light and drinkable. The pint was gone too soon. Nice.

Canned. Full sample. old note. Can max two weeks of age. Aroma has citrus, pine, other tropical fruits. Straight from can so no idea about the looks. The taste is moderate bitter, has some toffee and biscuit sweetness, pine/resin, citrus. Good stuff.
Had this beer a few times. Very good double IPA. Great nose and taste, if it were easier to get I would trade for more often but definitely over hyped.

Smells of grass lemons pine resin with caramel on the back end. Colors a nice light gold color slightly transparent. Tasted lemony sweet at first with a sweet slightly bitter hop profile with a nice malty backbone. Flavor lingers on your tongue almost for the perfect amount of time nice carbonation. Really good beer would drink again.

OK this is a great Tier 1 IPA.
That is all I have to say.............If you like IPAs you will love Heady......OK, that is all I have to say now.
I don¬ít believe that I had a fresh example of this beer--the two tins having travelled a long way to get to Calgary. There¬ís bones of a very nice beer here; but the hops are best at their freshest.

Got this one from De Hopduvel in Ghent, BE. The next one I will drink from the can, but this one I had to dissect. No idea how fresh it is.
Golden-orange pour, hazy, with very little head and no retention. It does give way to a very fine and sticky lacing, but is in no way impressive looking - the focus must be on the taste.
The smell is like a typical west-coast IPA, lots of pine, citrus (grapefruit mostly, and some lime) and tropical fruit aromas, some dankness, maybe some green apples, a bit of honey and a slight funkiness.
Moderately complex and balanced taste. Pine notes up front, citrus (grapefruit and lime again), followed by the sweeter notes of pineapple, papaya, mango. Bitter-sweet aftertaste, and a surprisingly light body. On the down side, it does have a strong herbal bitterness in the end, and the alcohol is a bit too present in the aftertaste, but maybe I had an old can, not sure.
Decent beer, definitely one I would try again, but not the best IPA out there.

Opaque with an orange hue. Alluring nose has hints of sweet orange. Flavor is juicy and bright, and it¬ís loaded with notes of tangerine and grapefruit rind. Bitterness is balanced, and it lingers nicely. Malt side is cakey and doughy with a mild sweetness. Finish is yeasty with a nip of alcohol; more cloying than I like in an IPA. Regardless, this is some seriously tasty stuff.
Thanks Davido! Subtle, very nice. Malt at the start, biscuity, then hops creep up. Pine, resin, lots of grapefruit. Minerals. Great stuff.

Can from Village Market, Waterbury VT. Drank some from the can, then poured out the rest. Cloudy, orange gold. A film, and ring of white head. Nose has punchy, tropical fruits. There¬ís a herbal character to it, not unlike fresh hop cones. Some notes of orange zest and rind. Light malts, that come across sweet and biscuity. Taste is robust, slightly earthy, pithy bitter. Plenty of mouthfilling sweetness. Fullish body, with perfectly pitched carbonation. Finishes fairly long, pithy bitter. Very easy drinking.

Can shared at a tasting. 12 days out of the brewery. Thanks biirusaikou! Pours a lightly hazy honey colored gold with a big soapy head that lingers throughout. Lots of grapefruit with some grass, orange, lemon and light weed character. Medium body with medium to medium high carbonation. Super juicy and fruity with lots of bitterness on the palate. Great, refreshingly bitter finish that lingers on the palate. Surprisingly well-balanced and hides the abv well. Awesome stuff.

One of the best smelling beer I¬íve ever had. Very light in color: pale yellow. It has a really good taste with the hops clearly coming through and over balancing the malt. I¬íve had IIPAs that were much more balanced, but this is more hop-centered. Medium-bodied, lightly malted with good carbonation. I find the after taste to be an unpleasant abrasive bitterness that is not there for me in many other IIPAs. The aftertaste is enough for me not to rank it nearly as high as others in this category.

can. drunk from can as intended with just a small pour for appearance. a cloudy gold beer under a large, stable, creamy head. white grapefruit, grass, citrus and spicy hops in aroma. flavor has moderately high bitterness with enough light, fluffy, pillowy, vanilla malt flavors. hops are mostly light colored citrus and floral notes. hint of vegetal matter. nearly dry in the finish with a a medium body and highish carbonation.

Can shared by Jackl, thanks! Sweet malt and tons of fresh, bright hops. Bitter, with citrus and pine. Heavy palate. I expect this would give me a hop burn but there is enough sugar and sweet malt that it is not abrasive initially and very drinkable, even if heavy.

Out of the can as directed. Big dank piney scent explodes out of the can. Can¬ít see the beer as it was not poured. The flavor is lovely. Perfect amount of malt and then assaulted with piny resinous hops. Absolutely awesome beer. Thanks to my buddy Stefan for the can.

Hazy pale body with low head. Aroma is a fruit basket. Pine, apple, pineapple, grapefruit. Taste has well balanced fruity bitterness, pretty gentle bitterness. Nice malty sweetness. Fruity balance in the after taste. Light alcohol notes. Body is full, high carbonation.

Cloudy, with small but rocky head. Aroma is grapefruit, citrous, also some malts. Flavour: medium body, sweet, but it¬ís corresponding with bitterness. Grapefruity bitter, little bit herbal. Most amazing is, that it taste like APAl you don¬ít feel 8% abv and 120 ibu. Mesmerizing.
Bottle at a tasting. Brutal hops experience. Even at 6 months of age this is a really strong resiny piney citrusy hops experience. Stands up to the hype.

500 ml canned about half a year ago, shared by Gurthnar, big thanks for this major want!
Dark yellow, hazy body, with a big, fluffy, off-white head.
Aroma of grapefruit, pine, orange, resin, pineapple, biscuit.
Tastes of pine, grapefruit, resin, orange, pineapple, subtle passion fruit, biscuit.
Medium, a bit oily mouthfeel, with an average carbonation.
Finishes bitter, dry, piney, zesty, resinous.

Very tasty. Even after half a year very hoppy and crisp. Perfectly balanced and clean, with lovely, straight piney and citric hops and a stunning, pleasantly dry finish. Really world class, but still not my favourite IPA, hopefully I can rerate this fresh someday.

From can. Hazy yellow golden colour, white head. Aroma is intense hops, brutal tropical fruits, lemon, passionfruit, resiny. Taste is also brutally citrusy hops, tropical fruits, some bisquity tones and malty sweetness. Bitterness is very pleasant. This beer is BRUTAL!!!

500ml can shared by Gurthnar at Bratislava RB Tasting, big thanks. Yellow hazy color, small white smell. Smells Pines, sweet herbs, grass, citric, grapefruity, light currant. Full body, soft carbonation, slick mouthfeel. Tastes Pines, citric, grapefruity, oranges, grass. Finishes with some hops, citric and pines. Decent stuff, hops not totally crisp, a bit underwhelming but still good.

Hazy yellow colour with white head. The aroma has strong citrus notes, fresh hops, tropical fruits like pinaple, grapefruit and pine notes. Has great combination of hops, citrus taste, bitterness and fruity sweetness. Very well balanced.

From the can: golden, hazy, white head. Heavy aroma of citrus. Very balanced with an incredibly smooth hoppy finish. Body is light to medium. Worthy of the hype! One of my favorites for sure

Pours golden, hazy with a nice white head. Aromas of citrus and tropical fruits. Tastes really nice and balanced with tropical and citrus fruits, caramel, and some sweet fruits. Body is light to medium with low carbonation. Very nice!!!
Perhaps the best IPA I¬íve had. Full hoppy aroma, great hop flavor. Slightly cloudy if you pour it out of the can.

Semi-sweet citrus and hop flavor up front. Not much syrup or boozy tones. Sweeps into a bitter grapefruit and fresh hop middle and then trails of with various notes of pine, citrus peel, subtle malt with little to no booze at the end.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Thanks Kristin who I went to high school with and isn¬ít even on RB. I still felt like I should give props. Cloudy yellow with a white head. The aroma contains some lemons, tropical fruits, and perfume. Unique. The flavor is quite bitter but not overpowering with some lemons, pineapple, and a hint of grapefruit. It remains fairly tame by some hop destroying beer¬ís standards without a big malt presence either. There is a hint of sweetness in the finish. It suggests I drink it from the can. At first I was like hell no. But once I tried it I kind of get it. Is this worthy of the hype? Maybe I¬íve had better IPAs. But its very good nonetheless.

canned, big thanks to hoffman for bringing this along to festival na naplavce. lightly hazed golden with a firm head; aroma of pine, grapefruit, toffeed stonefruits; big whack of bitterness with some warming, faintly medicinal alcohol, red berries, nicely balanced; not hard to see why this is so popular

From can, poured a little to take a look. Cloudy yellow with a bit of white head. Aroma is intense fresh hops. Well balanced with much of the hops right in the front. Piney without being resiny, finishes with a crisp bitterness.

Can thanks to Jack! Pours a clear golden orange with a white head that dissipates to the edges. Aroma has a good amount of bitter citrus with some light pine and a bit of a sweet grain backbone. Flavor is similar with a great combination of bitter citrus and pine with a light grass note and a light sweet grain backbone.

From can on 10/1/15. Nose is nicely resinous, pine, citrus. Taste is the same. Not overly complex. Very well balanced. Not too bitter. Piney, citrusy, yummy. Poured into a glass. Looks great. Cloudy VT IPA. Creamy texture. Thick lacing. I like it. Not life changing or mind blowing but just really really well done.

I wrote a long fucking essay about this beer, then RateBeer deleted my essay, so fuck it. I¬íll sum it up real quick: I was disappointed. Sip of Sunshine is better. Blue Dot is better. Dirt Wolf might be just as good, and it sits on the shelves everywhere I go. A great beer, but not worth the hype.
Out of a can as advised. Floral, soft melon, mango, mild grassy bitterness, nectar/honey, touch of graininess. Very soft and delicate. Ridiculously good.

Very anxious to try this. Been trying to trade for it all summer. Canned Sept.7th

Pours a very hazy bright orange body, looks similar to orange juice. Head was pearl white and an inch. Head retention and lacing were extremely good. 

Smell is big on citrus and resinous pine. Guava, pineapple, and mandarin orange dominate the nose. Not much malt and no alcohol is detected. 

Taste is of peppery, bitter, tree sap, mixed with acidic pineapple and grapefruit. Lime rind and juniper berries are also in there, bitterness increases as beer warms. Malt and alcohol are pretty light.

Mouthfeel is medium bodied and well carbonated. Head stayed throughout duration of consumption, added a nice froth to the beer. 

Overall this was a very good Ipa. One of the most visually pleasing beers I¬íve seen, very unique. The hype surrounding this beer is very high and to a certain degree I think its a detractor to the overall score. Would love this beer more if it wasn¬ít such a pain to get, don¬ít think it falls into the category of all time best when it comes to its style.

From a can pours out a golden topped with a nice head. Have had this a few times and is always good. Nose is pine citrus hops a nice caramel sweetness. Taste is more of the nice hop kick well balanced malt bill. Not to sweet and just the right amount of bitterness.
Pours gold with a nice white head. Big citrus hops on the nose with a punch in the face flavor. Really well balanced. What else can be said. Awesome!
Pours a hazy gold. Aroma of citrus and grass. Taste is of citrus fruits and subtle tropical flavors. All in all one of the best DIPAs I¬íve ever had.

Aroma: Rich cool mandarin, some piney citrus

Appearance: Pale yellow colour and thin cloudy head

Taste: Light sweet, heavy bitter but not aggressive - subtle

Palate: Medium body, slick oily texture, fizzy carbonation, and complex hop-flavour finishes

Overall: Full-flavoured and never boring, nearly perfect balance

Thanks to an amazing co-worker, I am the proud owner of a 4-pk of the highly sought Heady Topper! And, that¬ís about where it ends. Tried the first one in the can and the second in a pint glass. Definitely better in the can, as recommended. Aroma is all the pleasantries you¬íd expect from a fine IPA. Nowhere near enough malt presence for me. Balance? None. Contrary to what it says on the can, it¬ís bitter. If you pour it out, it is a cloudy pale yellow color that looks like skunked Budweiser. A palate wrecker. I could name at least 20 DIPA¬ís I¬íd take over this. Good, but very overrated (as I unfortunately expected). Meh.
Great for a Imperial IPA, Lots of greapfruit kind of hop. nice creamy body with a great complex after taste!
Can: Poured a hazy yellow with a white head. Aroma is strong hops galore. Taste is super citrus hops and lingers all the way through.

UPDATED: SEP 9, 2015 Drunk from a bar in Vermont, weekly drop. Sure it¬ís fresh and dank but I find it a bit too dry and it was murky as hell when I put a small sample into a glass. The taste is there but it¬ís just too damn dry. The tropical fruits are excellent but I find this overrated compared to other IPA style kings.  - Whops, realised I didn¬ít mark up my overall accordingly to my taste scores.
A big, aggressive, malty IPA, with tons of roasted caramel above its floral citrus and strong hop undertones. Balanced and lingers long, a monster for the style.
