Wywar z chmielu i to dos≈Çownie. Tak buchajacego chmielem zar√≥wno w aromacie jak i smaku piwa jeszcze nie pi≈Çem. Kapitalne pok≈Çady cytrus√≥w mango, owoc√≥w tropikalnych o wysokiej ale swietnie u≈Ço≈ºonej goryczce, przy tym wszystkim zabojczo pijalne. BOMBA

UPDATED: AUG 24, 2015 Pours hazy orange with a small off white head. Head retention is good. AROMA: tangerines, spice, malty, orange, herbal hops, pineapple, citrus, spruce, grass bitterness, tropical fruit, "dank", peppercorn, caramel, yeasty esters, slight peach, lime zest and melon. TASTE: tangerines, hop spice, malty bitterness, pineapple, herbs, caramel, tropical fruit, peppercorn, yeasty, orange, melon, grapefruit, spruce, alcohol, lemon drops candy, spice, grassy bitterness, citrus and slightly tart. AFTER TASTE: hop spice, grapefruit/citrus, malty bitterness and bittersweet tropical fruit with an oily creamy finish.

No lies, this beer was fantastic. It wasn¬ít my favourite IIPA ever but I would recommend it, buy it again and enjoy every sip. This is a smooth one right here and not to be messed with at a hearty 8%. Fresh citrus hop flavour abounds and begs he enjoying to enjoy further. This yellow and cloudy king is a treat and a wonderful afternoon sipper for such a potent pleasure.
Strong citrus aroma. Golden in color with light head. Slight malt flavor but overly hoppy with strong citrus and slight piney flavors especially present at finish

Finally, the illusive, the illustrious, the.... illuminating, Heady Topper! The beer that needs no introduction! The beer we¬íve all been waiting for. As far as beers go it¬ís an IPA¬ís world, and as far as ipas go this is one of the greats! But... Maybe it was it¬ís reputation that kind of made me expect a little more out of this beer. I mean don¬ít get me wrong this is a reasonably balanced, solid, intense ipa. I think I just set my sights a little higher than anything could ever be and then made myself disappointed...
Can split with diarmaidBHK - pours golden orange with a white head, nice lacing. Great piney aroma but not a lot of bitterness. Finally! An IPA that I like!

Can from four seasons liquor and wine. Pours golden with a white head. Massive, dank citrus hops on the nose. Big, huge hop,notes on the tongue with a lot of bitterness on the finish. For such a big beer it¬ís pretty well balanced considering the style.

UPDATED: FEB 12, 2016 One pint can that I poured even though it says not to.  But I have a number of them so I do what I want.  Stuff is like eating a handful of hops with little bitterness.  Pours a little orange color with a gold hue.  Head is white with large bubbles that linger.  Aroma is citrus heavy, dankness, crusty bread, and flowers.  Mouthfeel is juicy with a tingle.  Oranges, grapefruit, tropical fruit, touch of piney bitterness, biscuit, softly sweet.

Finally managed to get my hands on one of these and it was well worth the wait. Took a few sips from the can before pouring. Lovely dank, hoppy aroma with a slight tropical sweetness. It¬ís an explosion of flavour with piney bitter hops, mango, slight pineapple and slight citrus fruits. A lovely bitter and hoppy aftertaste works so well with the sweet fruitiness. So well balanced and more than lived up to expectations. Not too bitter, not too sweet and one of, if not the best DIPAs I¬íve tried. No idea when this was canned but it tastes very fresh. Outstanding.
By far the best IPA ive ever had. Better then Pliny. This IPA is extra juicy and just worth the price in trade

Piƒôkna, wyskoka, drobno pƒôcherzykowa piana ale niestety szybko znika pozostawiajƒÖc lekkƒÖ koronkƒô. Bardzo intensywny aromat ameryka≈Ñskiego chmielu, bardzo cytrusowy, lekko ≈ºywiczny, mega orze≈∫wiajƒÖcy zapach wrƒôcz zielonych szyszek chmielu. Do≈õƒá pe≈Çne w smaku. Bardzo pijalne. Originally reviewed on 8/3/2011. On tap at the Alchemist in Waterbury, VT. $4 for a 12 oz. pour. Can¬ít beat that. Hazy orange body with a delicious white head. The beer sticks and leaves lacing all down the side of the glass. Waves of hop aromas. Unbelievably delicious citrus and floral hops. It has the strongest citrus hop aroma I¬íve ever smelled. Great hop flavor up front that just lasts and lasts. Somewhere in the distance is a slight sweetness to balance it out. There is hardly any bitterness. Slick and easy to drink. A gulpable IPA. I put back 3 of these easily. The best IPA I have had and a great endnote for my east coast beer trek. Worth the drive and something I hope to get once it is canned!

Pours hazy yellow with low white head
Aromas hoppy of citrusy fruits, resin, pine, caramel
Taste is an explosion of hoppy citrusy fruits, grapefruits, pineapple, resin, caramel. Brilliant mouthfeel, medium carbonation, bitterness. Awesome!

UPDATED: NOV 7, 2016 [A PRESENT FROM BERLIN BEER WEEK,special thanks to eric]. From the can, i don?t know how looks this beer. Grassy aroma on the first from the can, followeed by piney, citruss hops presence. A little bit of caramel too. Full flavored ipa, a lot of sweet bready malt on the first, little stop fuelled of tropical fruit, like anans, papaya, a little bit of mango. Re start with the citrussy notes, a lot of orange and grapefruit, suggestion of orange flowers. Infinitely final and aftertaste with thw grassy, piney notes. Dank on the palate, medium body and oily mouthfeel. What an umbelieveble beer. Beest DIPA ever. For sure. üòä i?m so glad of this present. Birra che merita la fama che ha. Condivisa con un grande amico che mi ha omaggiato facendomela assaggiare, e direttamente dalla lattina. Non posso sapere che aspetto anbia, ma basandomi su delle foto djrei splendido. Appena aperta, la lattina sprigiona aroma forre di luppolo. Anche cos√¨ si sente pino, seguito da erba, seguito da arancia e pompelmo, ancora in sottofondo caramello. Aroma domplesso e buonissimo. In bocca si presenta ancora pi√π complessa. Attacco dolciastro, un po? di pane subito seguito da un ondata abrasiva di pino e di verde. Potrebbe sembrare qjel tipo di birra abrasiva, ma il pino non copre ogni aspetto, lascia spazio a frutta tropicale dolce, anans e papaya essenzialmente con suggestione di melone acqua e mango. Arriva la componente agrumata, pompelmo e arancia croccante, suggestione di fiori d?arancio che torna al naso, prima di altra dolcezza che √® data da pesca acerba, candita. Rirorna poi una estrema secchezza pee un finale eterno in cui ancora il pimo e gli agrumi si mescolano. Ogni tanro, emergeva sul finale dopo la componente agrumata anche una certa componente di caramello. Un eterno andirivieni dinsapori, per una birra quasi liscia e che chiedeva immediatamente la sorsata successiva. Esperienza onirica e quasi surrwale, mai bevuta una birra del geneee. Un grazie speciale ad una persona speciale che h regalato una perla del genere. 



Nel bicchiere si presenta oro carico, quasi arancio, con poche velature. Limpida ed imperiosa, presenta una schiuma fine e compatta che persiste omogeneamente anche dopo essersi posata. Al naso l¬íinvito √® dei migliori, con una tempesta balsamica e di aghi di pino che invadono il naso. In sottofondo per√≤ si trovano frutta tropicale come anans e papaya,ma anche nocciolo di pesca e leggerissima marmellata agrumi. In bocca la magia non si spegne, ma anzi ti accoglie con una splendida ventata piena di resina ed aghi di pino, prima del dolce e gentile ingresso di frutta dolce, macedonia.evolve velocemente ma con armonia, prima di portare l¬íamaro del nocciolo, del mango, ed ancora tanti aghi di pino.

Canned. No clear date, but this was released within the week I believe, so it¬ís fresh. I know it says drink from the can, so I¬íll do some in the can, some out. Pours hazy unfiltered yellow with a very creamy white head. Aroma is fresh slightly dank hops, tropical fruits, mango, citrus, pineapple, grapefruit, piney resin. Flavor is just a burst of hops. Piney goodness, slight dankness, distinctly sweet note up front, grapefruit, pineapple, tangerine note, tropical notes. In between the citrus and tropical fruits, there¬ís a distinct sweetness up front that continues into the middle. Not as sweet as Lawson¬ís Sip of Sunshine, but still not overly bitter at all. Not boozy. Super crushable. Nice sticky sweet mouthfeel. This is awesome. I could drink this all day. Normally I¬íd sip a DIPA and just savor this, but this I just want to down immediately and crack open another!

473 mL can. Pours (sorry folks) deeply murky, green tinged burnt orange, almost opaque with hop and yeast matter with a massive head of lasting white. Nose leaps from the glass, dank and citrusy hops. Lots of pine, resin, grapefruit, orange, earthy spices, peach and some tropical fruit. Body is surprisingly light with average carbonation. Creamily textured, silky smooth and saturated with hop oils. Lightly sweet grainy and bready malt followed up with a massive hop bitterness that somehow remains dangerously drinkable. A class of it¬ís own, a very different beast. Delicious.

Can
Aroma-citrus
Appearance-pale, hazy, white foam, 
Taste-medium bitterness, medium sweetness, lightly sour, 
Palate-medium body, slick feel, average carbonation, bitter finish
Overall-perfect

Sensoric glass. Golden, medium hazy with big, semi-densed, white head. Good lacing and head retention. Medium to high piney, resin and tropical fruits (passion fruit, lychee) aroma. Clear malty (toast, cereal) aroma. Taste is high bitter with nice semi-sweet, medium malty punch in the middle. Medium body, creamy texture, average carbonation, finishis semi-dry and highly bitter. Very nice DIPA, well balanced and packe with lots of aromatic hops.

Can from a friend. Hazy yellow color, white head. Bitter taste with grapefruit, peach, mango, hops, pine, resin, grass and caramel. Bitter finish with grapefruit, mango, peach, resin and pine. Exquisite imperial IPA.
Nice appearance a light cloudy yellow colour plenty of hops in the aroma. The flavor is it receive and happy with a very dry and bitter finish. Excellent

Drank from the can as that is the suggested method of serving. Still has a strong floral and citrus aroma , bitterness is clean but a little overwhelmed by a malty sweetness. Very clean fermentation you would not know this beer is 8%.  Update. This beer is so sweet to me that I¬ím starting to not want to drink it as I get to the bottom of the can.

Can at the Blackback pub, one mile from the brewery. Heed the warning, drink it from the can. I did pour a small sample in a glass, though, just to judge its appearance/color. This beer is all about freshness and hops. They have indeed done a great job to pack a big, but not overwhelming hop punch in the can. A small downside is that not a lot of the aroma can escape through the small opening. Overall, very nice and very drinkable. Personally, I think it¬ís a little overhyped, but still out there among the greatest of the great.

Canned 473 ml. Huge thanks to Rodney for getting this and sending one can to Zagreb. Shared with JFK10000 and Miro. Tried the sip from the can and poured into glass. Pours hazy golden with white head. Great fruity citrus/grapefruit aroma, much more intensive from the can. Hoppy fruity piney flavor with malt backbone. Very balanced. Light sweetness and heavy bitterness. Great lasting bitter finish. Loved it. If I had to choose one beer to drink from now on...
This beer is gross. Can¬ít drink more than a few sips. It¬ís cloying and sweet and not bitter enough for a dipa

It is genius brew indeed. Hazy, orange, golden color with lasting white head. Aroma and taste is all about citrus fruits. You got it all, lime, lemon, orange, grapefruit, some peach too. Mild bitter finish, very noble hoppiness backed up with a little alcohol. Extremely drinkable!

Can @ ZEBF 2015. There it is, the legendary Heady Topper. Got a fresh one, three days old it seemed. It¬ís a nicely hopped double IPA, with a bitter taste of pine, citrus and bitter peach. Caramelly malt body. Nice.

16 ounce can. Pours a cloudy yellow gold color with a moderate creamy beige head. Aroma is pine and grapefruit. Flavor is bittersweet malt and lots of juicy tropical fruit. Notes of pineapple, grapefruit and mango. There is an underlying sweet caramel maltiness. Every sip brings complex hops and tropical fruit. Amazingly drinkable for such a highly hopped IIPA.

Poured from can to glass. Golden straw hue with creamy white head. Aroma is pine, orange peel, tangerine. Mouthfeel is nice with a light body and crisp carbonation. Taste is dry with a hop bitterness following. Overall this is a nice IPA.

Can @ Home in Berlin


Appearance: Cloudy golden hue, small white head

Aroma: Pine, tropical fruit, citrus

Taste: Pine resin, mango, pineapple, grapefruit, light malt backbone

Palate: Perfectly balanced, nice bitterness, medium body, great beer
Extremely super heavy hop taste and aroma. These beers that are just a dumptruck full of hops don¬ít impress me at all.

Chased it down while in Vermont for bachelor party. Even though I¬ím not a real fan of ipas, I was glad to get my hands on a pairof 4pks to bring home. Excellent balance made this not overly bitter and extremely drinkable.
Drank at ZeeBra 2015 (20-6-2015). One of the best IPAs out there. Rich, compelling, fresh, hoppy taste. Not too plain or too soft. Sharp and compelling. Like it.
An IPA as it should be. Tropical fruits, grapefruit, pineapple and with a good bitter finish. Love this one.

Orange color, hazy beer, 2 fingers white head, little and medium bubbles, lasing. Aroma: piny resin, lemon, gapefruit, sweet orange, mango. Taste: medium sweetness, medium bitterness. More sweet flavours like mango, sweet orange, mandarine than in aroma. A little bit lingering resin-grass bitterness, which is building up and increasing in beer as it warms up. Palate: low carbonation, medium body, smooth. Well hidden alcohol, beside minimal warming in stomach you cant say its high abv. Overall: really good IPA, but not as good as it¬ís hyped. Definitly have no start to rochefort 10 or other excellent beers, even in IIPA category I wont say its the best. 
If you drink for the can (as alchemist suggest), you get less of aroma, and more of pure taste, slightly different experience, but I prefer way it taste from glass.

From old notes. 475ml can from Olbutiken shared with friends after Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2012. Hazy orange color with white to off white head. Heavy hoppy aroma, juicy fruity, tropical fruits, citrus fruits, orange, grapefruit, peach, pine, malty notes too. Sweet and bitter taste like aroma. Medium oily body with soft carbonation.

Drunk from the can, as suggested (though I think a glass would have been better), but poured in a glass to assess color and head.

Appearance: a pale amber or gold color, hazy with a slightly off-white head.

Can from Blackback Pub. Tropical fruit and pine aroma. Juicy tropical and citrus taste, pine, resin, slight caramalt, and of course a bitter finish.

Absolutely lives upto the hype. This is the best ipa I have had. This ipa is for all non ipa lovers

Can, 4 months old

By far the best IPA I've had so far. Great hop aroma and taste. Was very smooth for a double IPA. Can't tell you about color or lacing because I enjoyed it from the can as they suggested. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
This is a pretty good one. Very close to two hearted but with some grapefruit to it.
Tout simplement la plus extraordinaire bi√®re que je n¬íai jamais go√ªt√©. L¬í√©quilibre est parfait, la puissance est √©norme et la drinkability l√©gendaire!

Barwa zlota, metne, ladna drobnopecherzykowa piana, ladny lacing. Aromat intensywny, biszkopty i cytrusy. U mnie niestety rowniez siarka i dms ale to piwo nie jest zbyt swierze. Pours a golden beer with one finger head. Aroma has tropical fruit notes, resinny. Taste is bitter, piny, balanced, dry finish. Overhyped...

Received a can as a gift. The beer is just awesome. I¬ím not gonna go into details but I must just mention that it is one of the best Double IPA I tried in my life yet. Clean and hoppy the way I imagined it.

Puszka; barwa z≈Çota, opalizujƒÖca. Piana opada do obrƒÖczki. Intensywny aromat chmielowy, cytrusowy, grejpfrutowy, pomara≈Ñczowy, mandarynkowy, le≈õny, ≈ºywiczny, mango, owoc√≥w tropikalnych. Smak cytrusowy, grejpfrutowy, s≈Çodowy, owocowy. Goryczka wysoka, ale krotka i przyjemna. Bardzo pijalne. Alkohol ≈õwietnie ukryty.

Pours hazy orange with nice head. Aroma: perfectly balanced white fruit and mango with some pine. Taste: first pretty sweet (malt, mango, orange), then herbish-piney with a not too extreme but very pleasant hoppy bitterness. Super drinkable, ABV well hidden, at the same time complex, with every sip being very enjoyable (you want more and more).

Can bought at Beee&Food Festival in Poznan, Poland. Pours cloudy orange with impressive pillowy white head. Aroma of hay, resin, flowers, spruce, toast and herbs. Taste is good balanced with light sweetness ending in a bitter finish. A good Imperial Ipa for sure, but I have my doubts if it¬ís the best in the world.

16 Oz can poured an split. Much thanks to Eugene for sharing this, and making this day even cooler. Pours a cloudy, fizzy yellow color with an oily head. Grassy hops aroma and a very smooth hop flavor. Very earthy hops, which a difference to what I¬ím used to. Tasty beer though. Solid imperial.

The initial swig from the can is very balanced, though definitely hop forward, and very clean. Once in a glass the aromas are very opened up. Tropical fruit, pineapple, citrusy. A slightly hazy appearance, light orange with a decently lasting white head. Dry, bitter, very clean. Medium bodied, highly drinkable.

Pleasing balance of hops and malt from the minute you crack the can to the last sip (when the beer has warmed somewhat, obviously). Not only is this beer exceptional, but it comes in tallboys as well! Very thoughtful. And as to the ratings that dinged HT on the ¬íhype,¬í forget the hype. Rate the beer!

Can, cloudy yellow beer, big white head, good lace. Aroma lychee, orange, mint and spring spruce. Taste is light malt, spruce resin, faint citrus, and citrus rind. I wish the taste delivered what the aroma promises. Still, this is juicy, yet light and drinkable, especially for 120ibu. Palate light, carbonation bright.
Bottle share (or can share). Beautiful aroma, heady indeed. Nice robust, slick body, hoppy notes dominate without distracting. Clean finish.

Poured from the can. Thin white head, glorious golden, lupulin hazy color. Tropical, citrus bomb on the nose. Hop dankness. Hints of sweet tropical fruit and notes of pine across the palate. Hides it¬ís alcohol well. Overall a bomb double IPA
MrOrla meets Shaun HIll. Pours golden witth a white head. Aroma and taste tropical fruits, pineapple, hopforward, light malts, notes of pine, very fresh and crips. Amazing stuff

In a can. 1 week old. Aroma iis pretty complex and very hoppy- apricot, pineapple, grapefruit, and pine. Taste is also very fruity and hoppy, medium bodied, with a lasting firm bitter finish. enjoyed this alot.

Ok this beer is awsome it has everything that you need from strong ipa. Hoppy aroma, fruity taste, good "in your face" bitternes and well hidden alco. In the other hand in Poland we have some dipa¬ís that are equal and 4 times cheaper than this.
Poured from can hazy golden color with two finger white head. Aromas of fresh citrus orange and hops. Taste is awesome grapefruit hops and very balanced.

Piney and resonous with hints of fruit lying underneath. A bit cloudy I¬ím the pour with a nice white head. Flavor full of hops but not bitter which is good for someone who isn¬ít the biggest ipa fan. Almost sweet on the back. Great representation of the style. Could be beginning of my conversion to ipas
Pours cloudy golden with a small white head. Aromas of grapefruits and pine. Tastes similar and hoppy. Very refreshing with good bitterness. Delicious balance.

So I am finally getting to try this. Trev was nice enough to send me some relatively fresh cans, you are too nice. It¬ís a murky light golden color with a medium head. Some green and citrus hops, not a lot of bitterness on the noise. Flavor is malt heavy moderate bitterness. It¬ís nothing like I expected and surprisingly not as hoppy as thought. It¬ís malt heavy and hides the hoppiness more than I like. I guess it¬ís fine and just not worth the hype for me.
user_location: HdG (past: NYC, KS, Rain City), Maryland, USA

text: Ok aroma, slight pepper scent with a bit of hops. Very cloudy and not that pretty to look at, with a pale yellow color. I see why they want you to drink it out of the can. The taste is disappointing; some hops, not much citrus and just a bit of funk. Not what I thought this beer would be.
pours a golden orange (I tried it first from the can) Aromas of Orange, citrus, hops. Taste is a hop bomb in the best possible way. Super balanced and super drinkable. Lives up to the hype.

Can. Golden orange pour, with a white head. Citrus, tropical fruit, high bitterness, grassy, grapefruit, mango, mild caramel sweetness, and some pine. Medium body, pretty drinkable, and very tasty. A nice IPA, I would want to drink this again.

Can. Drank from the can and poured into a snifter. Out of the can you get a creamy fuller body with excellent fruit forward hop flavors. In the glass the body is a little more muted but you get the wonderful citrus and stone fruit hop aromas. Very hazy appearance. Overall an excellent IIPA that has more body than the west coast IIPAs. Big citrus / stone fruit forward hop notes. Nice bitterness - not over the top and very smooth and easy to drink. Lives up to the hype.

Has great aroma of tropical and citrus fruits. Hazy, pale body with nice head. Tastes great, has little malty background and powerful grapefruit hoppy finish. Bitterness intensifies in aftertaste. Greatly drinkable, you wouldn¬ít notice this ABV. Top class beer.
Heady Topper is excellent but there are many beers that I would rate ahead of it.

Can. Barwa zlota, miodowa, piwo metne, piana biala srednio trwala, delikatnie krazkuje. Cytrusy rz?dz?, intensywny aromat czerwonego grapefruita, swiezy, lekko slodkawy. W smaku lekko wytrawne, goryczkowe na wysokim poziomie skontrowane delikatny slodycza, goryczka cytrusowa, srednio dluga, chmielowa, minimalnie sciagajaca. Pijalne az za dobrze, niebezpiecznie pijalne, mozna powiedziec.

Can. Amber beer with a cream head. Summer fruit and tropical fruit aroma with grapefruit and pine. Grapefruit and tropical fruit flavor with light pine. Medium bodied. Good bitterness. Tropical fruit and grapefruit linger with light pine and light malt backing.

(Half of can) Yellow, hazy colour. Medium body, low carbonation, a bit oily texture. Medium sized, medium fast to slowly falling head. bbMinimal lacing. Aroma: Strong hoppy, dried zest, grapefruit,tropical fruits, peach ,medium strong pine. Taste: Soft to medium malty sweetness, strong hoppy, piney citrus. Strong and long resiny bitterness. Very long, piney, bitter finish. Good drinkability, good hidden alcohol.

Golden, cloudy colour. Great, white head. Some malts in aroma and citrus fruits (especially grapefruit), pine, grass. Dry, hoppy taste. Lot of citrus fruits, grass and pine also. Great, balanced bitterness.

Can courtesy of Cuso. Hazy yellow color with white head. Citrusy aroma. Citrusy also in flavor. Flavor of grapefruit zest is present. Medium body, average carbonation. Balance towards bitterness. Sweet in beginning followed with assertive bitterness which lingers long in aftertaste. Alcohol is well hidden. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Can shared by Cuso and Gurthnar, many thanks guys. Pours hazy yellow/golden color, white head. Aroma of grapefruit, orange. Taste is medium sweet, bitter, grapefruit, orange. Very nice finish starting medium sweet and ends extra bitter. Alcohol is absolutely well hidden.

UPDATED: FEB 2, 2017 Can. Pours hazy and golden, quite pale with frothy lacing head. Aroma is a bit of malt in the begining and after hops: citrus, grass, pine and also peach (from yeasts?). In flavour citrus, mango and grapefruit plus some malty base. It¬ís bitter, but doesn¬ít feel like 120 IBU, very balanced. Alcohol well hidden. The beer has medium-heavy body, finish is dry. Very drinkable, great Imperial IPA.

Barwa ciemnozlota, piana obfita drobnopecherzykowa, trwala. Aromat bardzo intensywny, oczywiscie chmielowy, troche slodki, owocowy w strone owoc√≥w tropikalnych. W smaku dokladnie to co zapowiada aromat, goryczka dociera dosc szybko, jest bardzo przyjemna i kr√≥tka. Piwo jest wyjatkowo pijalne, alkohol bardzo dobrze ukryty, z kazdym lykiem chce sie wiecej.

Can. Pours a murky yellow color with a white foamy head. Aroma is spicy hops, floral, pine, citrus and crazy intense hops. Flavor is spicy hops, citrus, pine, and fresh grass. Nice!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Can. Amber, cloudy beer with white head, which disappears quite quickly. Aromas of tropical fruits, citrus, resin. Taste is somewhat sweet, malty at first, but soon high bitterness is dominating. Bitterness is surprisingly complex, grapefruit-like, with distinct resinous character. Long, bitter, very pleasant finish. Great beer. Very drinkable.

Surprisingly clear, pale beer with a nice white head. I was expecting a cloudy fluid with some yeast floating around since i opened a can straight from a journey and it didnt have much time to cool in the fridge. Aroma typical for the style, american hops give some citrus and forest smell and malt adds some sweet note. Although the IBU is really high (120?!) the bitterness doesn¬ít feel overwhelming, it is on point, doesn¬ít disrupt the falvour with is pretty sweet thanks to malts. The palate feels good, carbonation is maybe a little to high, but on the other hand it makes the beer feel fresh. Overall the beer feels great, one of the best or even the best dipa in the world. If you have a chance to get this beer, do it - you won¬ít regret.

MacBoost helped me land this somewhat "hard to get get" beer. From the can. Looked for dating, none available. Pours a hazy orangish glow, with a fluffy white head. Was expecting a bunch of floaties, but did not really see any. Good looking beer. Aroma is of hop citrus, light malts, biscuits, and some grass. Taste is big on the light citrus front, grapefruits, oranges, mango...with some cracker yeast flavor coming in. For 120 IBU¬ís the bitterness was not overwhelming, somewhat dry finish. Great beer, would definitely drink again, if offered.

Backlog. Can share at Dominion Wine and Beer in Falls Church. Poured into a taster. Hazy dark gold with small white head. Tons of citrus hops, bittersweet, but not overdone and lacking the Fruity Pebbles notes of some other big citrus hop bombs. Very smooth and tasty.
Simply put, there is very little bad you can say about this outstanding IPA. Hazy golden hue. Smith malt start, big hop flavor in the middle, and nice long finish. Believe the hype.

Appearance - poured from can (I know it says not too! I can't help it!) a cloudy pale golden. Thick white head

Aroma - big citrus, melon, and earthy aroma. Great grapefruit and earthy aromas during the experience. 

Taste - sweet and initially bitter, with a very smooth bitter finish. One of the more balanced ipa's I've had

Mouthfeel - surprisingly more medium-heavy bodied than I expected. Very sticky. 

Overall - lives up the hype. A perfectly balanced beer

Amber, hazy color with white, talk but short-lasting head. Very complex aroma of hops with lichi upfront. Also some caramel/biscuit notes after warming. Body could be little more liqueur. Low to medium carbonation. Great stuff.

Can, pours golden, hazy with stable white head. Intense hoppy citrus and resin aroma with tropical notes. Medium bitterness, citrus notes in taste, great malty, cereal but not sweet background. Great balance, alcohol noticable only by warming in throat. Great beer.

UPDATED: JAN 11, 2016 Can. This was a very nice gift to receive. I poured this into a goblet despite the long rant on the side of the can. By the way, that¬ís one of the dumbest things I¬íve seen on a craft beer package. They worked so hard on the aroma that they want to preserve it to the point of no one else being able to smell it? I can¬ít really smell your beer if it never leaves the can! Then there¬ís the thing about stirring up the sediment. If I drink from the can, repeatedly tilting it to my lips I will stir up the sediment much more than if I pour it into a glass once to decant. Then there¬ís the whole drink fresh command but no date stamp on the can. The whole paragraph makes the author come across as uneducated and arrogant. Too bad I don¬ít get to lambast the beer itself because it¬ís damn good. The aroma is endless. It¬ís a clean, elaborate, powerful bouquet of hop glory. There¬ís a load of melon up front with citrus rind, pineapple, herbs, grapefruit and a dash of forest. The color is pretty light, it doesn¬ít look like they use much specialty malt at all. Doesn¬ít taste like it either, though it gives the impression of having wheat in the grain bill. It has a smooth, yet full palate. The bitterness is strong, but it comes across mostly on the front end and is completely surrounded with huge hop flavor. Layers of juicy hops give way to a dry finish. It¬ís so vibrant and delicious that it goes down way too easily. I get more melon and huge citrus in the flavor with a little dankness creeping through on the back end. I¬ím glad I got to try this. It¬ís a top tier IIPA for sure. It¬ís not overrated, as it completely deserves the ratings that it gets. Overhyped, perhaps. I¬ím not sure I understand driving hundreds of miles to purchase several cases to store and let fade away in the closet when there are a handful of world class IIPAs easier to obtain. Anyway, awesome beer. It was truly a pleasure to consume. 

[January 10, 2016]

Can. I still think this is a phenomenal Double IPA and I still think the text on the can is utter nonsense. The aroma, which I can¬ít enjoy unless I properly decant this into a glass, is wonderful. It¬ís certainly in the top tier of the style. Dank herbs, tropical fruit, citrus, just anything I¬íd want from hops explodes to the point of being easy to smell it from a few feet away. The bitterness is perfect. It¬ís got enough bite to let you know what style it is, but not the super aggressive backend bitterness that others have. Layers of sweet fruit and herbs add flavor, yet the finish is still fairly dry. Wonderful, wonderful beer.
Can at BGM2. Lots of fresh hops upfront - citrus, resin, herbal, tropical notes. Solid malty backbone, amazingly well balanced. Dangerously drinkable at this ABV. Great stuff.

Great aroma of fresh fruits, mango, pineapple, peach, citrus. It¬ís hazy, dark golden color, with rather poor head, but nice lacing. It¬ís nicely carbonated, and it¬ís super easy to drink. It¬ís almost like session IPA, a bit refreshing and even dangerously close to light. Taste is not very complex. It¬ís rather dry, sweetness in it is on far background, but yet - it¬ís really good balanced. Bitterness seems not that big tho. It¬ís rather short and strict, end quite quickly in aftertaste. It really is an awesome beer. It gets better in every sip. You just somehow need to take another one, immediately after placing the glass on the table.

0.473 can. Hazy, gold color and a medium, white head of poor retention leaving a delicate lacing. Very hoppy aroma of citruses, resin, coniferous trees, mango, peaches, and grapefruits. Taste is bitter but balanced; again resin, pine trees, bitter grapefruits, and fruity sweetness. Medium body, slick texture, and average carbonation. Finish is quite sweet, very nicely composed, follows the taste but pine trees dominate this time. Overall a marvelous beer, I¬ím glad I had the chance to taste it.

Well. Awesome aroma of fresh citrus and tropical fruit, some resin in the background and... the lack of malts (slight touch of caramel is not enough in imperial IPA). But still - Heady Topper is surprisingly refreshing and easily-drinking beer. One of the best imperial IPA I¬íve drunk so far. For real.

Can at Beer Geek madness 2.  Hazy golden color with medium white head. Nice clean aroma of citrus hops, resin, biscuity malt. Strong citrus hoppy, resiny taste wit notes of caramel. Long hoppy bitter finish. Very tasty balanced beer.
Aroma: fresh hops, resin, grapefruit, biscuits and alcohol in the backgroundTaste: heavy bitter, light sweet, grapefruit, resin, biscuitsToo long finish

golden, hazy, medium white foam; hoppy, grapefruity, peach, grass, pine, with malty, caramel base; very high bitterness, medium+ sweetness, very delicate sour notes; full body, thick and oily feel, average carbonation, very long bitter finish;
Overall: fantastic taste and aroma, without flaws, very bitter but greatly balanced, fantastic beer
Drank it from the can. Aroma of pine, citrus. Big hop flavor, not too bitter, very well balanced and refreshing. One of the top IPAs, definitely.

Aroma: hops bomb (citrus, pine, resin, white grapes), passion fruit.
Appearance: hazy golden color, nice white head.
Taste: high bitterness (red grapefruit, mango, pine), really refreshing citrus taste, nice malty backbone, really balanced, alcohol is perfectly covered, semi-dry.
Palate: medium body and medium carbonation, bitter finish.
Overall: Perfect DIPA, speechless.

Intriguing aroma of young cut grass and homegrown herb. Sample poured cloudy, brassy with white halo. Medium mouthfeel, cut grass and intense homegrown flavors, with herbaceous mint and spruce notes on biscuit malt backbone. Finishes with subtle bitterness. (Quite intrigued by the sample. I hear there¬ís variance in product that might be chalked up to age, travel or brewing variance. Probably should come back to this one.) Thanks Nate.
Everything that an ipa should be, it seamlessly integrates a lot of floral, tropical fruits, pine and citrus together. Definitely lives up to the hype
Can shared at the KoBB meeting. Light pour with a big white head. Aroma is Pez candy, hop pellets, and light grain. Taste is sweet grain, a little toast, and bitter. Dank finish.
16oz. Thanks to AndyReynolds - nose is kitty peepee. I don¬ít get the hype. For a DIPA, easy to drink.

UPDATED: MAY 29, 2016 Shared by koleminer20. Aroma is dank, hoppy, citrus. Appearance is golden, opaque, white head. Taste is dank, very piny, somewhat citrus but mostly pine, very very good. Mouthfeel is perfect, perfect carbonation, flavor hangs a bit. Overall, very impressed.

UPDATED: JAN 17, 2016 473ml can shared with Jo and Seb. Aroma: tropical fruits, citrus, mango, pines. App: hazy copper, small white head. Taste and palate: medium body, medium bitter finish. Overall: not the first time I¬íve had this beer and sure not the last time. The aroma of this beer is so good. A really awesome beer. An icon beer.

As good as it gets!, piney, citrusy, resinny, notes of guava. Its what other IPAs aspire to be, in a special place along with Pliny the Elder, Blind Pig, and a few others.
 They insist you drink from the can but I can¬ít but help to want to whiff as I drink so I pour mine. Beautiful Lacing that will stick to your glass. if you let it dry get ready to scrub!

4-pack bought at Craft Beer Cellar in Waterbury, VT. WOW. Fantastic IPA. Poured into a Shaker, against the advisory to drink from the can (hey, I wanted to see what it looked like, and I had 3 more after all) - hazy orange in colour, with a 1-inch head that hung around almost all the way to the bottom of the glass. Aromas of tropical fruit, grapefruit, pine sap, pepper and cloves. Intensely hoppy, but surprisingly not overpoweringly bitter - there is a strong malt character to the beer to support the hops. Drank the second can from the can, and I have to agree with the brewer¬ís notes - a certain amount of the volatile aromatics do seem to be lost in the pour. It IS better from the can. Overall a really, really great IPA.

Can in blind tasting. Cloudy orange, with one finger fine bubbled head. Lots of mango, white pepper, lemon, lime, green peppers. Soft carbonation, very smooth on the pallet. Medium pine and grapefruit bitterness. Moderate biscuit sweetness.

Pours a hazy bronze color without much foam.Tropical fruit and floral aromas, huge tropical fruit flavors. Sweetness from yeast and malt balances out the hop bitterness - would never have guessed it was anywhere near 120 IBUs. Moderate carbonation. Excellent overall - perhaps not the best beer in the world, but deserves its place in the conversation. If you can¬ít get a hold of it, it reminds me of Belgian-style IPAs, such as Raging Bitch from Snake Dog

Aromas of orange, tangerine, orange zest, floral hops, tropical fruits, mango, subtle pineapple, caramel, biscuit malt, grains, and some pines. Appears a bright orange with a beautiful foam head. Taste is pleasantly bitter upfront followed by fresh orange juice, tangerine, dry citrus, pineapple juice, mango, herb-y, grassy, hay, lemongrass, caramel cream, crackers, biscuit malt and more orange peel. Finishes extremely dry with resinous hop oils. Overall, definitely worth the hype. A+ beer.

Poured against the can¬ís wishes into a tulip. Cloudy grapefruit in color. It¬ís like a sunset, with many varying shades of orange. One finger of fuzzy off-white head becomes a moderately-sized ring that leaves some spatters of lace. Holy jeebus. This is one of the dankest, grassiest, most resinous noses I¬íve encountered. It¬ís not bright; it¬ís absolutely FUNKY with hops. Behind the blend of liquified weed and grass blades, I get saltine crackers, a touch of burnt sugar and orange cream. The crackers crumble under the weight of the hops, and I love it. The resinous character can be read in the flavor, but a little bit is lost in the translation. The dank funk is still there, but the bitterness behind them is huge. Sugar-dusted orange slices and grass mix with sticky alcohol, a little caramel, and perhaps even some mango. It gets better and better as it warms and as the malt sweetness improves. By the bottom of the glass, it¬ís nearly perfect. Medium in body with nice creaminess. Carbonation is moderately high and pinching, breaking the beer into just a touch of fizz. Velvety. Though the alcohol¬ís a little more noticeable than I¬íd like, the bitterness and malt strike a nice balance. The hype...is well-deserved. Heady Topper¬ís one of the dankest, funkiest IPAs I¬íve ever put in my mouth. And it comes in a can?! I¬ím in love.

This is an almost perfect ipa and from the east coast!! The body is just enough with a great amount of aroma and flavor. This is my favorite type of ipa style. Love that people are bringing it back to nj so often now

Resin, citrus, floral, grassy. First sip said it all. Strong, sharp aroma followed by a surprisingly smooth flavor and finish. Definitely puts the taste buds into overload for a bit. Find it! Drink it!

UPDATED: MAR 29, 2017 Tasted from can and poured into taster glass. Hazy orangish gold with white head. Aroma is lemon, grass, earthy notes, pine, floral. Very well balanced and clean bitter taste. Medium sweetness of caramel and earthy flavors with floral, lemon and pine notes. Excellent tasting. Lives up to the hype. One of the best IPAs I√¢¬Ä¬ôve had. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: MAY 21, 2017 At a friends house talking about Pliny the Younger and some of the other rarities of the world while drinking wine and he says he has a couple of 4-packs of HeadyTopper in his fridge -in San Francisco mind you. 
So of course I have to try some. 
And it is delicious. Worth the hype! 
Smooth for 8%. Not too overpowering wiht the hops. Tastes/feels wet, not in a no sh*t Sherlock, it¬ís liquid kind of way, but just wet. Don¬ít know how else to describe it. Fresh, maybe. 
Loved it. Happy to have crossed it off my bucket list. 
I¬íll have to make his house a more regular stop after he visits home.

Had at an event at Monk¬ís in Philadelphia. A crowded bar filled with beerheads, awaiting the 6 O¬íclock hour so these shinny tin cans could be served (because you would never want to pour this out, it strictly says "drink from the can" all around the rim). It is important to note that my love of the can is why I gave it a 5 in appearance. The aroma and flavor were exactly what I expected, fresh hops the hit you from front to back. It tingled the tongue and left a wonderful floral hop flavor to enjoy well after the beer had been swallowed. Great beer, worthy of its reputation.

For centuries  bloodletting was thought to be a good way to cure illness, folks in the 70¬ís thought it was a good idea to wear a lot of polyester, in 1990 millions of people thought Milli Vanilli produced good music. What¬ís my point? Humans are prone to mass delusion. The current wave in beer -- this "the more hops the better" kind of thinking that could lead thousands to claim Heady Topper as one of the world¬ís finest beers -- is just that. I really and truly do not believe that this beer actually tastes good to anyone. It is monolithic and plain gross - like drinking a can of pine-sol. May history be my witness: global warming is real and proclaiming to actually enjoy all these mega-hopped beers is nothing more than a fad -- one that¬ís been supercharged by dudes responding to some kind of intellectual insecurity.  Heady Topper represents the apogee of the pendulum swing, it is time to return to the timeless qualities of reason, balance, and refinement.

How could one say anything wrong about this beer as an IPA drinker. "Drink from the can" and enjoy the marvelous masterwork that goes into creating one of the best imperial/double IPA¬ís on earth. This beer is a masterpiece and it would be a penalty for me to say anything is wrong here. Enjoy!

Finally! Thanks Khiem! I had two cans. One I drank from the can, and the other I drank from a glass the next day. Khiem says they are pretty old though, pushing a year.

Hazy orange, gold with a thick, foamy, off-white head that lasts and laces.

Aromas of grapefruit, pine, grass, biscuit, light tropical fruit, and caramel. In the glass I get more tangerine and grapefruit notes. Flavor is grapefruit, pine, biscuit, grass, light tangerine, and caramel. Medium bodied, smooth with a dry and bitter finish. Lingering citrus.

Now I need to rate a fresh one.

Une double ipa des mieux r√©ussi .Cette bi√®re dessant comme une gorger de velour dans le gosier.des ar√¥mes de fruits de la passion et un certain go√ªt cr√©meux qui nous oblige en n¬í en perndre une autre fois.Sans doute une des meilleure dans son cr√©nom .Merci mon Pat pour cette belle d√©guste que je n¬íoublierai pas de si t√¥t.

UPDATED: MAR 14, 2015 Can at Monks. BIG dried hop flavors. A literal forest of hops condensed down to one beer. Complex mix of piney, earthy, resiny, leafy, herbal hops. Extraordinary to have such a high IBU without it tasting like a Tripel (e.g. Dogfish 120 or Pliny the Younger). Slightly sweet to be sure but in balance very dry front to back. See other reviews mention this beer as citrusy but other than some orange pith in the nose the bitter taste feels to be coming from a really deep spicy earthiness. Truffles and black peppercorns. Has a very distinctive finish. Almost a subtle smoky rauch element at the very end. Ridiculously well constructed.

Big thanks to Willrunforbeer for the can. Hazy orange pour with a wispy head. Delightful peachy hop aroma with notes of tropical fruit, orange, pine and more citrus. Flavors were slightly bitter with more than enough fruit to go around, more citrus and peach. Oily mouthfeel with tingly carbonation. Fresh, fruity, bitter and complex are the takeaways here. Awesome stuff worthy of the hype.
Can at Craig¬ís. Pours golden, nose is pine, orange, grapefruit, taste is similar, dry and bitter.

So my wife went over to visit her friends baby and came back and said they got you a beer and pulled this can out of purse what a great surprise. I¬íve tasted before but never enough to rate. So huge thanks to Steve for this. Pours hazy straw color. Nose of tropical fruits and bitter pine but not over the top. Tastes of pine, peaches, resin, florals, grass, and hints of raw dough. Bitter yet creamy mouthfeel. Lingering finish of moisture sucking pine. Great capper to a very nice day.
Cloudy golden color. Aroma and flavor is citrus and a little dankness. Very soft and clean palate.

Had two cases brought four days after appearance in the VT store. Drank a half in a snifter, waited a half an hour (and had a Trappist dibble) then tried another from the can. Very clean appearance. Smells like hops and pine cones. Strong, clean and direct on the palate. Tastes like hops, bitter lime, pine, hops and a touch of citrus. Very astringent and long lasting, which here is a debit. A most disagreeable beer. Why does anyone drink this? Meantime my son and his buds were lavishing attention on this so I surrendered the rest of my can to James and had a Saint Bernardus. That¬ís not a disagreeable beer.

Couleur dor√©e avec un beau col blanc. Aromes de fruits tropicaux, beaucoup de r√©sines. Alcool est bien cach√©. Tr√®s raffraichissant, tr√®s bonne, une excellente DIPA, m√©rite effectivement le top 5!
Overall great pour. This brew stand alone in the glass. Sits well on the palate front and back.

1pint can, hazy golden hue, with a big frothy pillowy white head, leaving some laces. Nice essential citrus oil, very spicy herbal floral tropical fruit, leafy, citrus, cedary, piney, resiny hoppy nose, with some green grapefruit, passionfruit, guava, mango, shiso leaf, pine bark, lime, lychee fruity accents, with a lemon, lime juice, lemon pie crust, yuzu, shiso rind, subtle fruity citrus yeast note in the aroma follows through on a medium-bodied palate, with a good spicy, fruity yeast, herbal flowery piney, cedary, tropical fruit, citrus, resiny hoppy, spritzy, zesty lemon, grapefruit, lime rind character, with some pine bark, lemon pie, lemon marmalade, faint panettone cake dough, faint lemon candyish lollipop, shiso leaf, yuzu peel lemon tea leaf flavours leading towards a zesty fruity lemon, lime, grapefruit peel citrusy, intense lingering piney, resiny, cedary, citrus, tropical fruit hop bitterness finish.

Delicious DIPA. It¬ís a well balanced DIPA but it¬ís more tasty then we usually see. The citrus explosion is exceptional, so many hops in there. Good bitterness but everything is well balanced. At 8%, it¬ís really really tasty. 120 IBU is felt but it¬ís far from being too bitter. World class beer.

Can poured a little in glass to check color and head. Hazy Orange/ tangerine color,thick billowy off white head leaves massive amounts of lace on glass. Damn!!! Smells of citrus, fresh baked bread, pine forest,dank and homemade candy. Taste of citrus,grapefruit,orange,toffee, and caramel. Medium body, big carbonation, soft, smooth mouthfeel and a mellow lightly bitter finish. I must say this beer lived up to the hype. Nice easy drinking dipa that tastes like an IPA. Very well balanced beer that show cases the hops well. Mellow fresh hop experience,bold,bright and in your face flavors and aromas. Definitely one of the best beers with out there! Thanks Matt C for getting me a can. Apparently some hipster bought 9 cases and the store sold out! Maybe I will go buy all the mustache wax just to ruin your day f ing hoarder!!!!
Can at one mile house. Light color with a nice hoppy grassy profile. Very good. Thanks to jay for the pour. Pretty awesome

P-E-R-F-E-C-T...Perfect!!!! There is nothing better bar none. I just tried some high end DIPAs in my presidents say VT weekend excursion and none are as good as this straight from the can. They have perfected a beer and no it. Waited in lines but came home with a total of 9 cases of heady and this my friends is a must have. Anyone rating this lower than a 5 is shearly not an IPA lover and are being over critical. When something is great this is the Michael Jordan of beers. Cheers!

Having heady topper at the best hotel in vermont is a life changing experience. The hotel vermont is a true gem and made our beer expierence amazing. Family road trip to claim this perfect IPA. Just a perfect beverage. It¬ís a true 10.
From the can. Pours hazy orange. Smells dank. Taste amazing and leaves a lingering but quite please bitter aftertaste.
Very delicious. Quite dank with plenty of hops. I would say this rates up there with my favorite double IPAs.
When the brewer says "drink from the can" you should drink from the can! Don¬ít pour this beer into a glass.

UPDATED: AUG 17, 2015 Sampled from a can (thanks, Steve Shires!). Hazy pale orange colour with a dense white head. Heady aromas of citrusy hops, and a complex taste full of lively citrus flavours. Hints of pine along with orange, lemon and grapefruit flavours. This is a spirited example of an IPA, beautifully made and highly drinkable.

Amazing New England IPA it definitely lives up to its hype and i hope i can get my hands on a four pack next time i¬ím in the Vermont Area because one is just not enough and 4 seems like the perfect amount.
Thanks to Matt Hernandez. 16 OZ can pours a cloudy straw yellow with a medium white head. Aromas of citrus, dough, and floral with hints of yeast. Flavor is mild bitter.

Botella . @Se√±or L√∫pulo. Despacho de cervezas, Frikicata Gij√≥n 24/01/2015
Color amarillo, Aromas frutales. Amargor bien balanceado.

Poured into a teku glass showing about 5 mm of sparse white foam that quickly dissipates into a hazy dark yellow and some yeast in the beer.

The nose shows a lot of pine and cannabis with more tropical and exotic fruit flavors upon warming up slightly. 

The palate shows a lot of intense, juicy, and ripe pineapple and touches of lemon/lime. The bitterness definitely reaches the sharp IPA bitterness point of 120 IBU fades instantly back into a clean and refreshing fruit shown before. The finish is clean with a slight astringency afterwards.

They call this one of the best beers in the US, it¬ís very easy to why.

Was up visiting family in Stowe, got lucky enough to score a ton of this to share with friends. The hype adds to this beer for sure, it's hard for me to disentangle taste with excitement. Love the flavor profile, great taste, hilarious can

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

[Can] Tried a can of this smuggled back to the Midwest by a friend. Pours a light orange color with a rocky white colored head. Big aromas of orange peel, grapefruit zest and sticky resin. Lots of citrus zest, tropical fruit, light booze, pine sap and tangerine with a sticky caramel backbone. Very tasty. Glad to have tried it.

UPDATED: JAN 20, 2015 Pours a cloudy orange brew with amedium white head with good retention , aroma is moderate to heavy bitter and moderate sweet with peach, tropical fruits, orange, grapefruit, pine and caramel, medium to robust bodied, smooth, great balance, flavor is moderate to heavy bitter and moderate sweet with a bitter finish and a long aftertaste, the tastiest ipa i¬¥ve ever tasted, actualy the best beer.

Can got provided by Steve, thank you very much!

Has a completely clouded orange-amber, peachy color with a decent, long staying, froth head.

Smells of grass, mixed with pine and dank, tropical fruits, foremost orange, nectarine and tangerin, due to the resinous maltiness.

Tastes much hoppier than the nose revealed, unleashing an hop onslaught on the palate from the very beginning, masterfully balanced by earthy white-bread malts, which receive a glazed accent, as the hops turn dry, parting from their grassy, slightly tropical initial direction. The fruitiness begins with ripe oranges, peach and tangerine, while more and more citrus peel gets added. While the malts are indeed capable of setting a counterpoint to the hops, they don¬ít got an overly sweet character to them, more like a biscuity earthiness - just the right amount to prevent this brew from being hop water. Finishes with a dry, long lasting grapefruit bitterness, coming along with quite a bit of pine and a distinct maltiness. Drinks overly smooth, while ending with an enjoyable, almost herbaceous, bitter hop bite, developing from the fruitiness, without swallowing all of its sunny components.

Thought I would finally rate this beer, so I opened another can! Pours a hazy pale orange. Delicious (and strong!) aromas of citrus and tropical fruit. The smell alone makes me love cracking open a fresh can. Absolutely delicious, complex, fruity flavor. This beer is unabashedly all about the hops.  Extremely drinkable at 8%, like all of the best DIPAs. Simply excellent.

473 mL can. Cloudy golden amber pour with a nice thick off-white head. Aroma of some citrus malt, tropical fruit, resin and pine. Taste is caramel, then waves of hop goodness, pine mostly, some herbal notes too.
Pours deep gold, very little head, little flakes of hops. Amazing smoothness for an IPA. Best IPA I have had.
I am one of few who have had this...as it is tough to get. Worth the trades and the waits...big floral pine aroma...big bitterness good way. Just a perfect XXIPA. And in a can...superb.

16 oz can. Tasted on 12/23/14. Beer courtesy of Espo. No canned date. Rated from memory no tasting notes. Overall a very good beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

The elusive Heady Topper. This is my second time with the brew, although I didn¬ít get a chance to review it the first time, and am glad I waited since I have a better idea of what is out there since that first experience.
The pour is a light tangerine topped with a porous, rocky head that reminds me of the creamy on a Creamsicle. I can smell the hops coming up from the surface, lightly caramel with a tangerine-grapefruit combination on the front side, mild and inviting.
The sensation on my tongue is lightly bitter, but very nicely balanced with the malts...not uncomfortable at all, and with a lasting flavor of resiny grapefruits. The experience on the swallow is not dropping me with amazement, but it¬ís tasty, no doubt. As instructed, I did drink from the can but saved about 60% for my tulip. Either vessel was generally the same gustatory experience, and I enjoyed the brew quite a bit from both equally.
It¬ís a really good beer with a high IBU that is made comfortable by a well balanced recipe. The Alchemist has done an amazing job of creating a beautiful DIPA, and a great job of marketing it!
(I will most definitely recycle this can!)

From the can. Pours opaque gold with a thick fizzy bubbly white head. Smells like resin, musky hops, grapefruit, sweat, pine and citrus hops. Smells even better from the can. Tastes like grapefruit, resin, orange citrus hops, smooth booze, caramel. Tastes even better from the can as well.

Can. Pours hazy bright gold with creamy white head. Aroma is bready and cereal malts, tropical fruit and citrus esters, some dank and grassy notes, and faint spice. Flavor is a huge burst of super flavorful grassy and citrus hops, tropical fruit esters, great malt base, and some faint alcohol spice. Extremely well balanced with medium/full body and medium carbonation.

Huge pineapple and citrus hop aroma. Cloudy golden color with a minimal off-white crown. Pine and pineapple flavor. Ample bitterness without going over the top. Smooth and oily texture. Overall, this is a great IPA and I really like the hop profile, but I¬ím not sure it¬ís quite as awesome or special as its reputation would lead one to believe...

Poured half the can into an ipa glass and savored the rest in the can. Beautiful looking beer with a great pillow-cap fluffy head that seems to last quite awhile. The aroma of lemony tangerines and grapefruit is delightful. Real easy to drink, the 8% not noticeable, and the smoothness is ridiculous! Also I enjoyed the lack of a bitter aftertaste. To summarize; Heady Topper was the most wonderful and amazing IPA I have had to opportunity to try. The hype is well deserved and all my expectations were met! Well done indeed.
16oz can pours a hazy yellow brown color color without much head. Nice hop profile, though a little harsh. Noticeable alcohol. Nice complexity from the yeast.

Beautiful. Pours great amber colour with frothed white head, laces the glass well with each sip. Aroma is incredible. Huge hops with grapefruit, orange and citrus. Taste is smooth, hard to guess without looking that this is an 8% beer.

Some can descriptions are never accurate! And some are right on like this one: "so drinkable it¬ís scary", "young fresh and hazy", "wave after wave of hoppy goodness on your palate","dense hoppy finish in your mouth","an unfiltered and unpasteurized experience","not intended to be the biggest or the most bitter","I wish I could crawl right into the can" -John Kimmich, aka the Alchemist, describes his beer the best right on the can!
I must say I believe the hype on heady topper! I don¬ít think Ive ever consumed a beer so quick, wave after wave of hoppy goodness is a perfect description! sweet lemon butter tannins to ripe peach honeyness to satsuma tangerine¬ís to sweet ruby red and pink grapefruit¬ís. I want more! And would love to try on draft!

Amazing. I could drink this beer all day. The fact that it's 8% doesn't detract from its taste at all. Great hoppy taste without being overly hoppy. A nice grapefruit juice color and nice head that fades quickly. when poured from the can. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
kind of hard to rate appearance when you drink it out of a can. this beer is so good they might declare it illegal.

Poured from a can compliments of friend Pete¬ís trip to Vermont into a Spiegelau glass. Light yellow at the base and deeper orange toward the huge off white head. As it settled down the cloudy brew was more consistent.
Aroma is juicy citrus fruits subtle pine.
Flavor is W-o-W! Luscious grapefruit & oranges sweet with a nice lingering bitterness. If it lingered longer I would bump this up to almost perfection.
Its all it supposed to be. Superb and hard to get. Worth every moment of pursing if you don¬ít live in Vermont.

Can shared at RichTheVillan¬ís, 27/11/13. Pours clear orange gold, offwhite head with decent retention. Huge blast of grapefruit and bitter orange on the nose, some caramel malt underneath but essentially this is all citrus. Tastes medium sweet, little caramel, then big bitter, loads of juicy citrus, again grapefruit and orange. Touch of booze, medium carbonation, oily, medium body. I feel my rating of this benefits from being in retrospect cos I now have a better idea of what separates the ¬ímythical¬í beers from the merely very good ones, and that¬ís not a lot tbh. Nevertheless, this is one of the best I¬íve had, for sure.

Can. Pours hazy yellow orange. Lasting off white head. Nose is big. Pine and citrus. Taste is sticky pine and grapefruit and citrus and dankness. Some nice sweetness. Dry. Lasting bitterness in the aftertaste that continues to build. A great alternative to Pliny.

close to perfection. very, very good IIPA. probably deserves a higher rating, but got so hyped up that is was delicious but not amazing. very hoppy, like my IIPAs even hoppier. wish I had more than one can to really give this an honest review.

Huge grapefruit notes with fresh pine scents. Poured half in glass so I could take a gander at this beaut. Hazy yellow body, minimal white head with limited lacing. Waves of grapefruit taste blanket a bed of fresh pine needles. Finishes with sweet citrus / apricot flavors and a bit of a spicy peppery aftertaste. Drank the remainder from can. 
¬ìOh, this beer here is cold, cold and hop-bitter, no point coming up for air, gulp, till it¬ís all¬ñhahhhh.¬î I would drink this beer for the rest of my life and be fully sated.

16oz can: cloudy straw colored pour. Tangerine, grapefruit, peach, honey, and apricot flavors and aromas. Smooth and balanced. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Can shared with brian and sara in St louis... pours orange with small head...This stuff is incredible

UPDATED: NOV 29, 2014 There?s something about the aroma that sets you up just perfectly for the intensity of this beer. The taste, at first striking, grows on you quickly and leaves you wanting more, and wanting nothing but. The experience with Heady Topper is one of a kind, and has led me on an endless path to find a challenger...but to no avail. Worth the trip to VT...every time.

UPDATED: MAR 3, 2017 Nov 2014 -Very pleased to try this one. From trade with tderoeck. Pint can, around 4 weeks old. Drank from the can whilst watching Wales lose to NZ¬Öagain. From the sample poured into a glass it¬ís hazy orange, still, big foamy white head. Looks great. Aroma is lemon, some tropical notes, light must and perfume. Body is medium, soft carbonation, slightly foamy. Taste is very grapefruit forward, lemon, peppery bitterness, some alcohol coming through. Pine burps. Good...but I¬íve had a lot better! (3.7)

OMG! If you can find it get it, this is a one of a kids enjoyable drinking experience!
