pours.. NOT? lets try and drink this as i should, fresh, canned, and with pleasure.
opened the can, i can smell a direct passing scent of bitterness and sweet hops, just like a small wind, it comes and goes in seconds... smelling to the can does say this baby WILL be delicious !
waaw! nothing like any other canned beer ! how do i say this right? it has like the ultimate mouthfeel, it fills it up like a good candi or ( i know this might sound weirs ) meat. LOVE it . hopps are bitter, yet also sweet, very in yer face, withoud going over the top. minutes of aftertaste, on a IPA... damn, this is totaly worth its name, if not even more ! and goddamn, i WANT more ! tasted it also at BBF, but cold, this beer is just something else ! WAAWED

Good solid hoppy murkiness (yes, I poured a bit into a glass)  - resiny and piney, pretty stock standard. Was expecting, considering the hype on here, a lot more.   Fresh? Oh yes, this can great fully recieved, I was informed that it was approx two weeks old.    

Considering all things, this is a good IPA, but I am suprised as to the following it has.   But, I am retisent to judge a beer on one can alone.

Wow!  Hops!  Aroma of pine resin, lemon, slight grapefruit zest and amazing hops.   Pours super hazy with orange and a foamy head.  Dreggs even look good.  Taste is like a hop explosion.  Not too bitter.  Sweet hops of grapefruit, resin, and caramel.  Delicious IPA.  I could drink this all night if I lived near Vermont.

16oz can from lemonhead, thanks Bry. Very hazy golden orange with a small dense off white head and lots of chunky coagulated proteins. Aroma of pine resin, floral, tropical fruit, citrus and caramel. Flavor is full of hops, you really can taste them, the bitterness is not overpowering and there is some light caramel sweetness. Medium body with soft carbonation and a creamy mouth feel. Fantastic beer, more hop flavor than I¬íve ever experienced in a beer with out being overly bitter, alcohol is well hidden too.

Can thanks to Drewbeerme! Pours a very hazy gold with a sticky white head. Nose is fruity and fresh, woody and resiny hops and soft sweet malt notes as well. On tasting, firm bitterness though not harsh. Light sweetness and very fruity and woody hops. Clean and fresh overall. Really solid but not top of the world.

Merci Charles!! Bue √† m√™me la cannette de 500ml tel que recommand√©. Au nez, herbe et agrumes de houblon, avec un c√¥t√©... r√©sineux, riche. Longue en bouche, moyennement sucr√©e, bien ronde tel qu¬íon s¬íy attend d¬íune double IPA, elle d√©gage des saveurs d¬íherbe (houblon) biens soutenues par le malt, et une finale am√®re tr√®s et tr√®s agr√©able au fil des rasades.   Je me serais attendu √† une sensation plus am√®re pour 120 IBU.

Spectaculaire.

UPDATED: NOV 4, 2012 Can. Pours a dark copper with mininal head. Aroma is incredible. Very strong hop smells. Taste is nice and hoppy. Not bitter or over-powering. Alcohol is well balanced. Overall an incredibly good beer. 

Re-tried this at Darkness Day and was very impressed. It was better than I remembered it, the cans were also fresher.
Aroma is cat piss simco hop.  Color is orange  with off white head. Taste starts out sweet with a nice malt finish.

Can pours a cloudy orange/copper with a medium white head. Aroma of apricot, oranges, grapefruit, slight scotch tape, caramel malts, and resinous hops. Taste of sweet caramel malts, slightly nutty, citrus, and resinous pine hops. Drank from the can and felt the same way. This is a really nice drinkable DIPA. However, it is nowhere near one of the best I¬íve ever had, the hops just aren¬ít there. Over-hyped? I think so. I¬íd take a Daisy Cutter, Zombie Dust, or Day Tripper over this any day.

UPDATED: AUG 16, 2014 1200th rating had to be a bit more or less special... Glad I got this one in a trade, allready was looking forward to it for a while. Got this in a can, and it should be pretty fresh. Drank it from the can, like is told on it, but also poured a small amount in a glass, to see how it looks. There are some small floaters inside (but allready drank some from the can, so mixed inside ofcourse with the bottom) in a golden coloured beer, a small to medium head, that maybe should hold some longer, but ok. Nice grassy hops, a decent amount of citrus and other fruits inside the smell, one of the best smelling beers I got till now. Also some grapefruits and peaches, very fruity and even sweet at the smell. The taste is very nice bittering grassy hops with a decent mixture of sour fruits, with a nice sweet touch to it, and a good bitter-citrus/grass end. Nice refreshing brew, maybe just over the top, but one I hope to get my hands on again, without pulling out a kidney or something. Retaste on 18 Aug 2014. Realy, drink this one fresh, cause the slightly aged I got today wasn¬ít that great. Still very good :)

Danish: N√•r man f√∏rst er kommet sig over prislappen og de rigelige g√¶r kloder der sv√∏mmer rundt i glasset., s√• er der kun et ord der popper op - himmerrigs √∏l. 
Brugen af humlen med s√• fantastisk aroma er sj√¶lden set i det omfang.  Skal smages af alle IPA elskere. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Hazy, rather ugly yellow with lots of yeast and hop floaties, swirling about. Thin head.  Superb nose of pine and pineapple. First sip yeilds piney, resiny bitterness with a big malt background of rich, chewy caramel.  As it warms and I drank more, I was tasting sweet pineapple and mango and sugary plums but still had a nice dry, bitterness at the finish.  Superb.  Had two 4-packs this year and definitely need more.

UPDATED: JAN 22, 2016 From a glass ! Updated rating A: piny, passion fruit, citrusy what a punch.App: hazy bond with hop particle small white head. T/p: med body with long bitter finish soft to med carbonation. O: had to update my rating based on reviewing two different batches  tasted fresh. One batch was brewed in November and this review is for past week batch. It¬ís more piny than fruity I tend to prefer my ipa fruitier those days, lost a few points there. The taste and palate remains close to perfection. In all, an amazing beer.

Thanks to time4lunch for the trade. Pours hazy orange with a big head with flecks of what must be hop resins or yeast? The past few times I¬íve had it I just drink it from the can, but I poured it for the review. Big citrus aroma with some pine and grassiness. Taste is well balanced for a DIPA, solid malt backbone for the bitterness. Lots more of the citrus, pine, and a bit of grassiness in the taste, surprising amount of flavor for a DIPA that doesn¬ít make you pucker you face (probably tons of late hop additions). The carbonation is average with a light to medium mouthfeel. The finish just hangs around for a while, bitterness and citrus rule my mouth. The best hoppy beer I¬íve had, one of the best of any beers I¬íve tried and I still have one more left!

From the September 2012 3R6P gathering. +++  Sampled from a 16 oz can this beer poured a cloudy pale yellow color with a large foamy yellow-white head that lingered and left decent lacing. The aroma was sweetish pine and resin. The flavor was sweet and tangy pine, resin, caramel and honey. Long finish of sweet pine and resin. Full bodied. Excellent.

1 pt can from a trade. Hazy golden orange, foamy white head. Aroma is a blast of grass, sweet citric fruits, pineappe, tropical fruits. Full bodied,resinous. Taste of sweet fruits similar to those of the aromas, moderate bitter. Extremly drinkable, abv barely noticeable. One of the best hoppy beers I had lately.

Can shared by Mike.  Thanks!  Pours dark golden with off white head.  Aroma is sick.  And by that I mean awesome.  Wet resiny sticky hops dominate the nose.  Flavor follows the nose and has a great meaty malt backbone to back it up.  Medium mouthfeel.  This tastes amazing.  Its worthy of all the praise it gets.  Just awesome.

This beer was as good, if not better than expected. The aroma is HUGE; pine, grapefruit, pineapple, lemongrass all meld together for an almost spicy bouquet of a smell. A true hop bomb, but not just bitter - there are lots of tangelo and dried orange chips in the flavor. It is pretty malty and sweet as well, balancing out nicely with a hint of caramel and mellow citrus.

16 oz Can (!!) This is about as close to DIPA perfection as you can get.  I absolutely cannot believe that beer from a can could be this good. Total fresh hop fragrance hits you as you pop the top of the can.  The can says "drink from the can" but I need to pour it into a glass to appreciate the hop aroma and flavor to its fullest.  really nice unfiltered murky pour with a huge off-white creamy head.  The flavor is perfection: huge hop flavor with none of the bitterness - how do they do it?!?  I thought I had burned out on DIPAs until I had this.  These folks know that the highest ABV or IBUs does not equal the best beer.  True brewing genius.  Now I can only hope and pray that distribution will eventually make its way to PA.  Please Please Please....

Can shared on the bus during RBSG 2012. Pours clear gold with a sudsy white head. Huge tropical and citrus aroma, grapefruit, peach, orange peel, pineapple. Nice blend of resin, pine and acidic citrus notes in the flavor. Dry bitter finish. Great DIPA, promoting big hoppy flavors instead of malt and booze.

a back room dealing for a single can. enjoyed from the can as recommended but enjoyed lil bit in a glass just to see the hazy yellow and big white head. Aroma is pith and zest or citrus fruit and wet grass clippings. The taste is a slow long burn of bitter that grows through my mouth for a solid minute after a sip. Great tingling carbonation for a high abv beer.  I always am suspicious of hyped up beers but this is an excellent DIPA.

#800! Can courtesy of pushkinwow. Pours a cloudy yellow with an off white head. Decent retention. Massive hoppy aroma of citrus, grapefruit, peach and some light malt and caramel. Flavor is a beautiful blend of fruity hops (mostly grapefruit and orange) caramel malt and medium bitterness. Nice toasted cracker malts as the backbone. Full body, soft carbonation. The finish is a long pine, oily bitterness. Light resin notes toward the backend as well. Amazing drinking considering the bitterness. This was as good as the hype made it out to be. Looking forward to the second can!

UPDATED: MAY 5, 2013 2013-04-27. Hazy orange body with a nice creamy white head. Hoppy aroma has light green hops, muddled but pleasant citrus, orange, grapefruit and lemon notes. 7++ Flavour is similar with grapefruit orange lemon citrus melange, and a good amount of bitterness throughout. Lingering lemon in the finish. Nuance of the hops and citrus grows as it goes. 7++ Average plus palate has pleasant carbonation. 3+  Nice stuff. 7/5/8/3/16-17 On tap at the brewery.

2012-08-17. Hazy orange body with a small off-white head. 3+ Nice hoppy aroma, citrus, muted leafy hops. 7++ Flavour is similar with nice modest citrus character, good amount of bitterness throughout. Smooth average bodied palate. 3+ Smooth average bodied palate. Quite nice, very drinkable, lovely hop character. I thought the label on the can was a joke, but I think it may have actually been just a bit better straight from the can! 8/3/8/3/16 Can, Campground Brewdown 2012

Thanks to adamjackson for this awesome brew via trade. It doesn¬ít look the part, but it definitely acts the part in every other category. First can poured into two pint glasses, one for me and one for my wife (hell of a post-baby beer!). Off yellow hazy pour with white head. Second one consumed from the can as advised by...the can. Smells like a dream orchard filled with ripe fruits: orange, grapefruit, tangerine, pineapple, mango, hint of evergreen. Tastes more ripe than it smells. Perfect resinous hops intermingle with ripe citrus. Bitterness is very low and alcohol is remarkably unnoticeable 8%. One of the three best IPAs I have ever enjoyed.
Pours a golden maize color with a tall soapy white head.  Aroma of pine, honey, citrus, and hops with a very well-balanced flavor of citrus, honey, pine, and hops.  This was truly exceptional!

can thanks to Time4Lunch pours hazy bright orange with a medium white head.  Lots of sediment floating around.  Aroma is huge hops through and through.  Grapefruit, sweet citrus, grass, a little skunk/cat piss.  Flavor does not disappoint, big resinous hop flavor of pine, grass and again citrus from bitter to sweet ending with a big bitter wallop.   This lives up to the hype and more, special stuff.

Can. Deep Golden, clear and with a White head. Aroma of citrus. Namely grapefruit. The flavour has some pleasant cara malt and lots of fruity hops. It¬ís very well balanced. I can see why everyone loves it.

In bottle. Pours a dark golden colour with a fair white head. Aroma of pineapple, passion fruit, honey, pine, caramel and alcohol. Similar flavours. Alcohol is well balanced with nice bitterness. Mild carbonation and an oily mouth-feel. Very nice.
Can. Thanks Craig for sharing. Golden with a white head. Massive hop aroma, pine and grapefruit. Similar taste, lots of grapefruit and citrus. Quite bitter. This is great

can at home ... thin white head ... zezty citrus passion fruit ... lime citrus nose ... soft fruits ... juicy fruits ... soft toffee malts ... big big citrus and tropical fruit ...  big juicy simple easy and tasty ...

Amber colour, medium off-white head. Aroma is grassy, fruity, flora, earthy, honeyish and nectary with some slight maltyness. Flavour is being quite similar in a nice balance. Lots of hops, but still not over the top hopped DIPA.

UPDATED: FEB 24, 2017 16 oz can courtesy of brewolf. thanks. Pours a cloudy orange-amber color with a small white head that recedes to film. The aroma is dominated by tropical fruits with oranges, mangoes and a bit of musk melon. The flavor, like the nose, features an abundance of tropical fruits set in a neutral malt base that is slightly sweet. The palate is is silky smooth, perhaps just a touch oily, and the carbonation is lively. Finishes long with a lingering bitterness. Overall: Loved it--this is a great DIPA. Re-rate notes 2-5-17. Its been nearly five years since I last had this so I decided its time to visit it again. Times change, my standards change and beer changes. The aroma that once had a a nice tropical aspect is now replaced by grass and minerals. The taste comes across as bitter for bitter sake with not much hop flavor other than some sweetened grapefruit. This to me now is a pretty ordinary DIPA.  I also note that there is no date on the can.

UPDATED: SEP 4, 2012 Can, poured into a tulip (oops forgot to read the directions).  Light orange and hazy.  A little Citrus, a tad honey like sweetness, a fair amt of hops finishes with resin and some bitterness. Pretty good, but there¬ís a lot of good IIPAs out there. Not sure it lives up to the hype, but then again what does.  

re-rate, had it out of the can per instructions, and a little bit in a tulip for side-by-side. Surprisingly it did seem better.

Case of cans shipped from johnnyd @ phish.net.  Pours hazy orange with small white head and a fair amount of sediment.  Aroma is sweet citrus fruit and bubblegum.  Nice complex bitter and sweet hop flavor and pink grapefruit.  Palate is nice and smooth with light carbonation.  Super quality beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Straight from the can the way they tell you to drink it, although I had to put a bit in a glass to get a good look at it.  I don¬ít think that I can say anything that hasn¬ít already been said.  Damn good, real good, and very easy drinking.

Pour from can. Bright golden yellow color w/ some chunks of hops still floating around. Huge aromas of fruity & bitter hops, including mango, peach & some grass. More flavors of mango, citrus & fresh cut grass. Just enough oily, resiny mouthfeel to remind me I¬ím drinking a big IPA. I¬íve been wanting to try this beer for awhile- was starting to think I never would. Thanks Josh! @ Dak¬ís party.
UPDATED: MAR 24, 2013 This is a lovely beer with some womderful hoppy goodness..citrus, grass and earthiness with some caramel malts in the flavor.  Love this beer!!!!

Can.  Dark unfiltered amber with white head and plenty of yeast bits. Interesting aroma is a melange of yeast, hops and mango. Sharp taste would cut across any number of food groups. Very very hoppy yet has a light body. Malt serves as an efficient hop delivery system. Liquid sunshine. Nice maltiness does rise as the beer warms and the tongue becomes accustomed to the hops. Pleasant mango citrus hops. Suppodedly there is a strong level of alcohol somewhere in the can.

UPDATED: DEC 24, 2015 Heavy and soft hop flavors balance beautifully in this one, with basil, mint and weed aromas suggesting a light touch, but with heavy bitterness and citrus rinds pushing its nearly over the top taste.  Light, pure accents of mango are fleetingly present.  Still, it¬ís smooth and soft, despite only the mildest balancing sweetness and weight of alcohol balancing its hoppy thickness.  It finishes perfectly dry and crisp, with only the least noticeable stickiness.  The flavors aren¬ít quite large or singular enough for my taste, and the malt notes are altogether too absent.  The hugeness of its hops that doesn¬ít rely on any resiny character is pretty cool though.
Best hop overload on the planet. Amazing aroma and extreme complexity. The evolution of taste in this beer is almost unequaled.

A clear golden colored beer, with a thick foamy white head. The aroma of fruits like citrus, with strong hop flavors. The taste of sweet fruits, nettle, with hop bitter. The aftertaste is sweet, dry and gentle bitter.

Murky orange beer poured out of a dented can (which makes it even better) with a short lived creamy off white head.  This beer has all the right IIPA smells or candied grapefruit rind and pineapple upsidedown cake.  Pinching bitterness of grapefruit, bitter orange peel, pineapple and apricot jam.  Nice cakey malts underneath.  Nice warming alcohol sense to it.  Thick syrupy mouthfeel.  Long hop resin bitter aftertaste.  This is a really nice hop head beer.

16 oz can thanks to Michael. Pours a light orange with a nice white head that dissipates quickly. Pour leaves a huge amount of suspended and settled sediment. Aroma is sweet mango and floral and citrus hops, toasty malt. Taste is lively hops, sweet but nice balance and easy to drink.  Palate is smooth, slightly oily. Finish is sweet and delicious. Truly one of the best I have had.

Can.  Hop hops and more hops.  As soon as the can was opened I could smells hops.  I really enjoy how balanced this beer is and the alcohol is well hidden.  I prefer the citrus hoppy beers but his one was really good with a very bitter finish.

Probably the Best b√©er (IPA) made in a can. They strongly suggest to drink it straight from th√© can and after few  test this is true! Lots of hop, good fresh taste and a r√©al surprise at the end. Wonderfyl.

Oh sweet god. This IPA is the closest I have tasted to a perfect IPA. So hoppy yet so drinkable. Def best out of the can as suggested, though I had to pour some in a glass to get the appereance ;) Good job!

There is no doubt that hype holds true on this one.  However, out of three that were opened in this one sitting, one was heavy sediment that seemed to have the most bitterness, one with almost no floaties that had the biggest tropical fruits character and the least bitter (albeit still massive bitterness). And one right in the middle.  So the look was all over but centered around an orange with light to heavy floaties and a nice white head.  Taste was big orange zest, grapefruit,  tropical mango, tangerines, light sweet malt backing.  Largely and gorgeously bitter.  Smell was a lot of the same.  I would say fuck quality control because no matter the color or makeup the beer was fantastic.

Can.  Nice lighter orange pour with a light tan head.  Aroma is massive hops.  Citrus and pine and it¬ís like they threw every hop in the brewery into this thing but it works.  Flavor is more of the same.  Really nicely balanced.  Not overly bitter and the hop notes just keep pouring through.  Excellent beer.

Can courtesy of Reynold314.  Cheers, Matt!  Pours a hazy orange-yellow with a cream-colored head.  Nose is caramel, sugar, booze, and a huge wafting of citrus, apricot, peach, and pine.  Flavor is caramel, pine, grapefruit, orange, apricot, and resiny pine.  Thick and on the lighter side of full-bodied.  Nice DIPA overall.

Light in color sort of a amber straw, nice white head and good aroma, not as much aroma as I would have expected, but good citrus and flower comes through. Also drank out of the can as suggested. The taste is nice and smooth, great drinkability. Maybe not as well balanced as others, the bitterness seems to linger with this one and I think it tends to take over the thin malt base. Great beer overall, but needs a bit better balance.

Can at Mikkeller Bar. Pours hazy golden with a creamy lasting white head. The aroma is heavy fruity with notes of peaches, passion fruit and some sweetness. The flavour is a great mix of tropical fruit with citrus, grape and a malty backbone. Nice!

Used to stop @ the Alchemist brewpub all the time for this- was there for dinner 7/27/11 the night before tropical storm Irene flooded that establishment.  Was thrilled to learn from my server that a cannery was about to open- turned out to be a great thing as the brewpub was a near total loss (but replaced with the Prohibition Pig BBQ, now the only place you can get this on draft other than samples @ cannery).  The can seals in a near miraculous concentrated hop flavor and aroma.  I did once disobey the instructions and pour this out to reveal a cloudy golden-yellow fluid & nice sticky head that will leave a mark on the glass as it dissipates.  Despite the high IBUs, there is a sweetness and crispness that counters any bitterness- many friends who are not generally fans of IPAs do enjoy this DIPA.  Citrusy, piney, and resinous, it's also extremely drinkable.  Despite increases in production, it still sells out quickly at $12.99/4-pk at the few VT locations where it is regularly available- a solid indication that I'm not the only one who's hooked.  It's now the IPA by which I judge all others. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Sampled at DLD ¬í12.  I¬ím glad I got to try this one again, since I liked it before but never rated it. I know the first one was thanks to Kan, this might be as well.  Orange yellow color with yeasty floats. Nice dose of hoppy goodness.  Bitter citrus juicy bready. Juicy nice and oh so tasty.  I could drink a few of these. 8/4/8/3/16

500ml Can - Amber in colour. Grapefruit, pine, toffee, passion fruit, peach and pineapple in the enticing aroma. Fairly bitter and hoppy, yet nicely balanced with notes of lemon, grapefruit, pineapple (lilt, perhaps) and fudge.

Hey, Mr. Adam Jackson, you¬íre cool as fuck, dude! :-)  Poured this awesome metallic-auburn color with a fine head and finer lace to represent its heady collisions. Smells of California hops, loafed rye, Carared malt, and  Maine salt. Tastes predominately of spicy hops, olive juice, grapefruit peels, tangerine zest and Chrysanthemum flower pedals. Niiiice!

Can from a store in Copenhagen. Very fruity and fresh DIPA with lots of tropical fruits, pineapple, strawberries, peach and passion fruit. Very enjoyable I want to drink more all the time. Great beer!

Can at O¬íConnor¬ís, Uppsala July 2012. (thanks SaintMatty)

Slightly hazy golden/orange with some sediments. The head was white and not that large. A great hoppy aroma on this one. Grape, citrus, pineapple and caramel. The taste was hoppy and very refreshing. Not brutally bitter. May I have another one, please?

UPDATED: MAR 7, 2014 Can picked up at cannery recently. Poured into a tulip for full experience. Orange body, 2 finger head that dissipates. Everything about this is simply outstanding. Aroma-out of this world, definitely the best smelling ipa I have had to date. Citrusy, hoppy and juicy. Amazingly easy drinking for the abv and ibu¬ís. Not bitter as one might expect. Perhaps the best thing about this is the mouthfeel, coats the palate with hoppy goodness as the can states. Everything is in harmony here, can see why this is so hyped. Definitely worth all the praise, wish I was a lot closer to VT so I could get this more often.

Drinking from the can because the can said so. Poured 25cl into a Boulevard tulip so I can judge the appearance and try it from a glass.

A- Wheaty yellow, lots of floating particles, 1 finger thick white head. 
S- Very floral, sweet, a bit earthy.
T- Dank hops, somewhat floral, citrus, bitter but ballanced by a light sweetness.
M- Right consistency, a bit lumpy, could use a bit more carbonation.
O- Looks like homebrew gone bad, but smells and tastes amazing. Only thing I would really change is to up the carbonation just a bit.

Serving type: can

From can to glass.  Definitely smooth for a double IPA.  Sharp and citrusy hops dominate this brew.   The drinkability does not suggest a considerable 8% abv.  Great head.  I wish I had tried this out of the can like it suggests.

UPDATED: DEC 7, 2012 Can on the RBSG bus. Great nose: tropical fruit, peaches and mango. Golden pastel color. Estery, bready flavor with honey malts. Prockly carbonation is a bit much. Peppery hop finish and noticeable alcohol. Well bitter. Nose is great, flavor much less exceptional than expected, though good. 
Second time was from the can at Manhattan Pizza in Burlington. Nose was less available, but the resinous, citrus hops were lovely.

Pint sized can from which I will drink(as instructed).  I¬íve never sniffed the inside of a can before.  This one smells like fresh pine needles and lemon zest.  Taste is full of flavor and pretty balanced for the style.  Tart citrus hops hit you first followed by juniper.  Slubtly sweet pale malt presents itself mid palate and bitter pine oils linger in the back of the mouth after the sip is gone.  A little alcohol heat warms the throat and chest.  Quite drinkable given the ABV.  This one lives up to the hype for sure and I¬ím glad I¬íve got 7 more to enjoy.  I¬íll update the rating if there¬ís a measurable difference after a pour one of these into a glass and taste then.

Can-HUGE thanks to Daknole for letting me basically have a whole can of this stuff to myself.  fantastic!  Pours lightly hazy orange with a small soapy rocky white head.  nose is out of this world!  Big citrus, lemon, huge floral notes, a bit of green onion, however, i didnt mind that.  some white grapes in there as well.  Very dank smelling-like fresh nugs.  flavors are all hops, no malt, just how i like however, the flavors are just so damn dank.  bitterness isnt all that big here, doesnt seem to be the 120 ibus however, the can i had was almsot 2 months old.  It would have been more bitter fresh.  I have to get some more of this stuff!!!!  one of the best IIPA¬ís out there!

Pour reveals a cloudy, golden-orange body with sediment topped by a large rocky white head. The 2 finger head displays good retention and dissipates to a thin cap, leaving some nice lacing as it slowly recedes.
The smell is amazing! Big dank resinous hop oil upfront. Bright grapefruit, orange and lemon peel followed by tropical fruit; mostly pineapple and mango. Also has a little bit of sweetness in the nose, similar to honey. Just a touch of bready malt, but not much. It is all about the hops here.
Instant zing of citrus and grapefruit with a hop wallop, but without the crazy bitterness. The hop flavor creeps up on you after swallowing. However, it doesn¬ít have that drink-with-caution bitterness that can overwhelm the palate. It takes all of the tastiness one would love about hops while leaving some of the bite behind. The freshness of the hops is really unparalleled, it is by far the "juiciest" DIPA I¬íve been able to track down. The hops are complimented by a sweet bread malt backbone and it is extremely well balanced. Very little booziness in the taste however, just loads of super fresh and pure hoppy goodness.Chewy and full bodied with somewhat low carbonation, but it¬ís spot on. A little oily and sticky on the lips, as expected. This is dangerously drinkable. I could drink this stuff all day it¬ís so damn good and it goes down so easy.One of the few beers that actually exceeds the hype. Are there more insane DIPAs out there? Of course. But this has to be one of the freshest and "purest" tasting DIPAs I have ever had. It¬ís near flawless and quite remarkable. The is one of those rare DIPA that will satisfy the hopheads as well as the fans of something more balanced. This is easily one of the best beers I¬íve ever consumed. That¬ís why it gets my first perfect score.

This is the best smelling IPA I can recall. Pure rubbing whole leaf American hops in your hand and taking in the pugent nose. Secondly, this beer is incredibly clean and easy to drink. Not overly bitter by any means. Really fruity, citrus, pineapple, peach flavors dance around with a piney resin hoppiness. It is like hoppy fruit juice. Pretty much a flawless IPA. I was not as blown away as I was drinking a Pliny, but its up there as one of my favorite IPAs.

Drank it straight from the can. The aroma is excellent; hoppy, citrus and nice pine. Can¬ít comment on the color as it remained in the can. Solid carbonation, medium body. Taste was superb , nice hop profile, just enough maltiness, not an over powering sweetness. Damn fine ipa.

Aroma- wet hay, oranges, papaya, fruit juice, metallics
Appearance- yellow-orange, nice white head and lacing
Taste- massive assault of hops upfront with a super clean, sweet middle with a twinge hops on the backend
Palate- full-bodied, mouth coating at its finest
Overall- A very hoppy, oddly complex beer that is awfully damn drinkable.  World class stuff here.

6/14/12 notes: can, thanks Eric!  Lychee, tangerine, lemon zest. Body is light and nimble. As the can says, this beer is about the depth and deliciousness of layers of hops. Which it succeeds admirably. A joy to drink straight out of the tallboy can.

A vigorous pour from the can produces a three-finger thick, pale tan colored head that leaves some lacing on the sides of my Tripel Karmeliet tulip. The beer is a hazy, dirty amber color that shows a chunky, hazy, orange-gold tinged, pale amber hue when held up to the light. Up front is a punchy hop character with notes of lychee, ripe tangelo zest, a dank herbal note, and pine needles all playing a prominent role. The malt here, while certainly playing a subordinate role, still contributes a definite crystal malt character that is biscuit like and notes of toasted whole grain crackers that is fairly noticeable.

Sharply bitter and herbaceaous from the get go, but the finish sees the hops picking up more of the lychee and ripe fruit character. There is a definite peppery note from the hops and this mixes in well with the biting bitterness as well as with the danker herbal notes. There is even some woody hop notes here that accentuate the flavors of pine. The malt character is fairly light, as it should be, but does contribute a chewy bread / cracker note, as well as some touches of toasted pale grain character. The body here has a certain chewiness to it, there is a definite viscosity here, I wouldn¬ít quite say this was quaffable, though it is certainly drinkable. Some noticeable alcohol in the finish adds some spiciness and a touch of heat. There is a light sweetness to this brew that is accentuated by the fruity hop notes; the latter contribute notes of lychee, tangelo zest, kumquat, and Curacao Orange zest.

Definitely a hop lovers beer. This is quite enjoyable, but somehow isn¬ít quite what I prefer in a Double IPA; there is a certain muddiness to the flavor, which likely corresponds to the murkiness that this has visually and somehow the hop character isn¬ít quite as bright as I would prefer.

Bottle at home. Stockholm, Sweden. American Imp Ipa at its best. Along with 
Pliny the elder( havent tried the younger yet) and Dreadnaught. Top of the line. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

50cl can @ home shared with Dutchdrebus. [thnx Eric for pickin¬í this up for me and holdin¬í on to it for a couple of weeks] Hazy yellow to orange color, lots of floaties in it, medium sized white head. Smell malts, a lot of hops, pine, resin and citrus. Taste hops, grapefruit, citrus, lightly pine and resin, superbly bitter finish. Medium body, medium carbonation.

Can @ and thx to benzai. Hazy orange with lots of chunks, small white head. Smells lovely hoppy, grapefruit, fresh, bitter. Great hoppy taste, grapefruit, apricot, sweet, fresh, amazing. Perfect balance. Not a perfect beer, but quite close to it. Soft carbo, medium body. Slightly sticky.

Can, 1 pint, trade with pushkinwow (thank you!), savoured on July 11 2012; eye: orangey with a caramel hue, lightly hazy, no effervescence, khaki head that turns into a minuscule ring, no lacing; nose: resinous hops, orange, light malt, light "dirty socks"; mouth: resinous hops, orange, light malt, dry but rather long finale in resinous hops, medium-full body, good carbonation, rather bitter and astringent, lightly harsh texture; overall: really good

FRAN√áAIS

Canette, 1 pinte, √©change avec pushkinwow (thank you!), savour√©e le 11 juillet 2012; ¬úil : orang√©e avec une teinte caramel, l√©g√®rement voil√©e, pas d¬íeffervescence, mousse kaki qui se transforme en un minuscule anneau, pas de dentelle; nez : houblon r√©sineux, orange, l√©ger malt, l√©ger chaussons; bouche : houblon r√©sineux, orange, l√©ger malt, finale s√®che et plut√¥t longue en houblon r√©sineux, corps moyen-cors√©, bonne carbonatation, plut√¥t am√®re et astringente, texture l√©g√®rement rugueuse; en r√©sum√© : pas mal bonne

Big thanks to Celtic001 for a couple of these sent my way. I was so excited for the arrival of these, that once they were chilled to perfection, they disappeared quickly. Poured into a pint glass. Pours a murky dark orange/gold with a thick lustrous off-white head on top. 

Slick yet heavy feel. Lightly oily on the back end. Big bitter pop of juicy hops. Full of lush flavor of bitter fruits, semi-sweet syrup on finish. White peppery "burn" in the midst, but this is bitter all out. Surprisingly an easy finish with such a boisterous profile. Great beer. Not my top DIPA, but a good one for sure that I wouldn¬ít turn down any day of the year.

OMG!!!   This was amazing.  This beer was consumed direct from the can, as per the can¬ís instructions.   The aroma burst forth as soon as the can was popped:  pine, citrus, resin, like a whole hop cone thrown in there.  The appearance is a gold/amber, white head.  The flavor is a blast of hops, citrus, pine and resin.  Incredible.  The finish is the same.  beautiful.  Medium in body, slightly thick even.  Obviously a hophead¬ís beer, but so unbelievably well-crafted.  Awesome.

Can direct from Alchemist Cannery.  Pours a cloudy yellow with an off white head. Decent retention. Massive hoppy aroma of citrus, grapefruit, peach and some light malt and caramel. Flavor is a beautiful blend of fruity hops (mostly grapefruit and orange) caramel malt and medium bitterness. Nice toasted cracker malts as the backbone.
Full body, soft carbonation. The finish is a long pine, oily bitterness. Light resin notes toward the backend as well. Amazing drinking considering the bitterness. This is just as good as Dreadnaught or Hopslam. I have to agree with the masses on this one. Superbly made.

UPDATED: NOV 21, 2012 Can.
Opaque dark golden with a white head leaving lacing.
Fresh and hoppy aroma with apricot and peach.
Taste: tropical fruits, nectar, honey, grapefruit, caramel, medium bitter, pine needles in the finish.
Medium-bodied.
Very nice and drinkable.
Edit: after having fresher cans I just have to raise the score from 4.2. This is great stuff!

Pint can (thanks Pawola22 for this treat!). Wow. That about sums this one up.  I¬ím blown away from the start. Tropical fruits galore here in the subtle, yet eye-opening aroma, with the acidity of the tropical/mango/passion fruits adding a nice degree of complexity. The fresh fruity hops, oranges, bananas are balanced out very well with a milder grain profile of rice and mixed light cereals. It poured with a light yet thick white bubbly layer of starch white head, a hazy through vibrant medium-heavy appearing, golden-orange body. The palate is probably 6/5 if that were possible. An incredible drinking experience with a deep and powerful palate, yet with a smooth, tart, acidic, and properly bitter balance. The notes in the aroma and flavor go hand in hand, though bolder in the flavor, and more delicately balanced in the aroma. Also, probably a bit more grass and herbal hop qualities, as well as more cotton candy and caramel sweetness in the flavor. This lingers so wonderfully with bitter, tangy mixed tropical fruits. Oh my. So much to ponder here. I didn¬ít want it to end. Nearly perfection.

UPDATED: NOV 19, 2016 Canned. Pours hazy golden with a medium sized off-white head. Leaving a good lacing. Aroma of citrus fruits, especially grapefruit, pine, peachy notes and caramel. Sweet flavor that ends up dry and nice bitter. Medium bodied, oily texture and average carbonation. A great DIPA üåüüåüüåüüåü

UPDATED: JUL 16, 2012 Can generously given to me by my buddy Matt! Not going to pour it into a glass, but I bet it¬ís a unfiltered deep copper color with a white head. Crack of the can presents strong resiny, dank citrus hops, pineapples, mangos and peaches packed in there. Flavor is the same lovely tropical fruit with no trace of sweet malt that I hate in double IPAs. Ends bitter with a gentle touch of alcohol. No hype, this is fucking delicious.
Pint Can. This was sure a nice wake me up for my palat. Full flavors like pineapple and grapefruit. Nice fluffy head. Excellent palat.

Well... this kicks ass.  Excellent beer.  Can thanks to  Beermefitz on BA.  Huge orange and tropical aroma, some pineapple, lightly vegetal/cheese.  Flavor follows, super hoppy goodness, bit of toastiness, not entirely dry (seemingly), slightly chewy, fluffy carbonation, chalky full body (even though it¬ís probably actually very dry), some wheat?, bitterness lingers with the orange, really lingers...  packed with flavor.  At first sip I was impressed, and still am, but might need just a bit more balance of this tongue bruising flavors.  Alcohol is actually fairly big on this one even though it¬ís only 8%.  Borderline 9 on aroma, 5 palate, 18 overall... I know fresh this beer is probably pure fire!

0.5l can from √òlbutikken. I don¬ít care how many times they print "drink from can" on the can, sorry, I¬ím just not doing it! Pouring a light cloudy honey-"looking body packed with unfiltered particles and floaters. It also has a small but quickly sidesticking off-white head. The aroma in this one is just fantastic! So hedgy and hoppy-bitter that it¬ís almost like walking in to a newly cut hedge! Not as fruity as I had expected, or hoped, but it¬ís just dang amazing hedgy. I also get some apricots mixed with sweet orange zest and citrus. It has a nice slick texture and it¬ís average carbonated. Not fully as hedgy and hoppy, but still pretty darn fresh and delicious. More fruity in the flavor. Lot¬ís of medium-sweet peaches and passion fruits, also a small mango tone as well. Ends light mouthdrying and bitter all the way in the back of my neck. This is a really tasty one, and I would not hesitate to buy a new one it it only were available. 09.06.2012

Poured from 16oz can.  Aroma of grapefruit hops.  Cloudy IPA lookin gold, white head.  Packed with lots of grapefruit, pine and floral hoP flavors.  Not much else to talk about - there is some malt but its overshadowed by the hop barrage.  I don¬ít even taste the alcohol.  Some citrus notes toward the end.   This is really well done - an unexpected surprise.
user_location: York, SC via NJ, South Carolina, USA

text:
This is by far the best beer I have ever tasted. The only thing I don't like about it is that it is a four hour drive to get it. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: JUL 1, 2012 Can at Craft Beer Co. (Poured a few ounces for the purpose of this rating). Pours a cloudy yellow / golden colour with some floaties. Bubblt white head. Aroma is a bit piney with tons of tropical fruits, pineapple and grapefruit. Taste is bitter with grapefruit and pineapple again. Soma resint hops as well. Mouthfell is medium to full with good carbonation. No signs of alcohol. Overall, a good IIPA from the glass becomes world class from the can. DRINK FROM THE CAN!

Fresh can given to me by Beermefitz on BA, a complete stranger until today. Thank you so much for the generous gesture. Good beer karma shines down on you this day. 

Drinking out of a Pipeworks Brewing goblet. Pours a cloudy golden hue with a fingers worth of bubbly white head.
Smells great. A nice balance of resin and citrusy fruit. 
Speaking of balance, wow. First taste knocked me on my butt. Sweet and bitter tangoed on my tongue both getting a turn at lead. 
Not too sticky on the mouthfeel, but leaves behind a bit of hop to bring you back for another drink. Carbonation tickles the throat as she goes down. 
Overall, fantastic beer that completely lives up to the hype and well deserving of my first review. Hope I didn¬ít let it down.

Bottle at Paps√∏.
Cloudy golden coloured with a medium sized off-white head.
Fruity aroma of caramel, hops and pine needles with notes of cardemomme.
Fruity flavour of hops, caramel, hops and pine needles.
Dry hoppy finish.

I'll be fair and rate the appearance at 3/5 - I haven't actually given in to temptation to pour this beer into a glass. Aroma on first crack of the can is sweet and skunky - this evolves as the beer warms up to reveal many layers of hoppy goodness. Matter of fact so does the taste. First sip is good, but always underwhelming for me, but with each sip the flavors develop a bit more to reveal the sultry nature of hops. This is a great beer, one of my favorites. Not bitter for a dipa, but the can explains that, just layers and layers of beautiful hop with enough malt backbone to keep it drinkable. 

Comrock12
- - - - - - - - - - -
"...and the rest of the day to you!"
Rated with Beer Buddy
Nice with aroma, taste of grass, rich floral notes, fruit (peach and some grape), but not as intense as I had hoped. Probably had my sights set too high..

Can, at Paps√∏¬ís. Cloudy orange with a small white head. Very fruity, very hoppy aroma with a dash of pine in the mix. Taste is sweet malty and rather bitter, long lingering finish, anesthetic. Fruit bowl, pine. Low carbonation, full body.

Drunk to celebrate my rating number 24,200. Can. A hazy golden beer with a thin lazing white head. The aroma has notes of peaches, malt, and hops. The flavor is sweet with notes of malt, hops, peaches, and straw, leading to a bitter finish.

Can 1 pt. Courtesy of Doodler. Pours a cloudy golden with a rich and lacing white head. Sweet fruity nose, heavy on citrus and pine. Medium body, very soft mouthfeel, a little lowish in carbonation. A rather sweet but very fresh fruitiness, lovely citrusy hops with an almost herbal astringency. The bitterness actually doesn¬ít feel all that extreme. A lovely DIPA, but not sure it¬ís THAT much better than so many other beers of the same style. 270612
Can. Nice head with good duration. Color is golden. Aroma and taste are lovely peach, rich hops, rich flowers, pine, citrus and malt. Nice long bitter finish. Awesome beer!
I get some big armpit aroma but it fades away to some awesomeness. drying astringency on the back end

Usually a beer taste better at home, yet had to venture out to find this. Wow , what a perfect experience . Not a dirty/ cloudy beer, as I was expecting (disappointing), but clean and sessionable. Makes me want to drive 5 hrs to vermont for . P. S. soon!

UPDATED: DEC 11, 2012 Bottle shared by Thorpe429. Thanks Mike!

A: This DIPA appears noticeably hazier than other brews of this ilk. The beer itself is light orange in color, with a 1/4" head that leaves a fair amount of lacing. 

S: Wow! The aroma is simply amazing. A bouquet of fresh tropical fruits, to include pineapple, mango, grapefruit, guava. No alcohol or malt scents to be found, just as it should be.

T: Wonderfully hop forward and delicious. The taste is fantastic, but not quite as unbelievable as the aroma, which was absolutely world class. The flavor is all about hops, citrus / tropical fruits, and floral notes. Terrific beer.

M: Bitter and dry, in the best possible way. Hop and fruit flavors linger on the palate between drinks.

D: I have wanted to try this beer for a long time. It is absolutely worthy of all the praise it has received. I look forward to drinking some on draft the next time I visit the lovely state of Vermont.

Edit: Drank over a case of this over the summer. Simply phenomenal beer. I¬ím not sure how or where this beer could improve. One of the best beers I have had. Dangerously drinkable and mouth wateringly delicious. My highest recommendation.

Hazy golden color. Strong floral aroma with balanced bitterness in the end. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

One of the best double ipas I have ever had, intense aromas of caramel, hops and alcohol. Tons of sediment and floating debris, taste is an awesome light pine and hoppy finish, amazing.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Can from Winooski Beverage Warehouse: Hazy golden brown, almost orange color with a thin white head. Amazing aroma bursting with bright juicy hops. Smells of citrus, apricots, tropical fruits and a slight resinous dankness. Firm bitterness, piney hop flavors, grapefruit zest and a touch of cracker-like malts. Nice and dry with a lingering hop bitterness. Fantastic stuff that lives up to the hype. Just wish I didn¬ít have to drive to Vermont for it.

50 cl can @ home. Pours murky yellow with some sediment and a white head that fades leaving some lacing. Aroma is very hoppy with hints of citrus, grapefruit, and pine and also a little malt. Taste is very hoppy with plenty of citrus and pine but there is also a small malt presence.

Bote de 1pt. S√≥lo un trago en vaso de ¬Ω pinta ¬ñpara apariencia y aroma- el resto directamente del bote como sugiere la cervecera. Saboreada en jun¬¥12. Color pajizo p√°lido y apariencia velada. Espuma marfil, de burbuja peque√±a y corona que se disipa lentamente dejando una fina capa en la superficie. Aroma intenso de fruta tropical madura, resinas y maltas dulces. Entrada agradable de dulce malteado mezclado con fruta tropical y amargor ascendente. Cuerpo medio/pleno, textura oleosa y baja carbonataci√≥n. Fruta madura en el intermedio ¬ìcortada¬î por un toque resinoso que permanecen hasta el breve y seco final. Deliciosa. Probablemente una de las mejores AIPAs que haya tomado. 
1pt Can. A drop into ¬Ω glass ¬ñjust for appearance & smelling- the rest direct from the can following brewer¬¥s suggestion. Enjoyed on jun¬¥12. Pale straw color, hazy. Off-white, small bubbled, froth. Slowly dissipated crown leaves a thin foam layer on top. Intense ripe tropical fruit, resin & sweet malt aromas. Pleasant sweet, creamy, maltiness at fist sip mixed with tropical fruits & increasing bitterness. Medium to full body, oily texture. Low carbonation. Ripe fruit in the middle cut by resiny touch lingers into the short, dry finish. Delightful. Probably one of the best  AIPA I¬¥ve ever had.

Can shared from Bierkoning.  Pours a cloudy lumpy orange with an off white head.  Gets a lot better with the massive hoppy aroma of citrus, grapefruit, peach and some light malt and caramel.  Flavour is massively bitter upfront, quickly calming into a beautiful fruity hoppy balance with caramel, malt and medium bitterness.  The finish is a long pine oily bitterness with alcohol warmth.  Medium to full bodied with medium carbonation.  Great beer!

50cl Can courtesy of Kermis
Ok white head.  Citrus aroma.  Very hazy blond pour.  Pretty bitter.  Yummy!

Can @ home. Pours the dirtiest, orange colour I¬íve ever seen. Full of floaties.. that¬ís why they want you to drink it from the can I suppose. Forms little head but releases an absolutely fantastic aroma!! Full of lemon, orange and juicy sweet hops!! Wow.. Flavour is full bitter with orange peel and grapefruit presence. Again wow!! Really easy drinkable, medium carbonated and even the floaties were easily consumed! Will definitely pick this up again when I see it!!

6/17/12. Tallboy shared by a dude in the BA Zhukov line. Nice pour. Wonderful hoppy aroma with lots of citrus and grapefruit. Nice hoppy flavor with plenty of sweet caramel backing up the bold citrus and grapefruit. Nice!

On tap at Battleship.  Pours a dark golden color.  Aroma is full of hops (obviously), pine, a little citrus, and more hops.  Flavor is a hop bomb in your mouth.  Dryer hop in the front with a citrus finish.  I¬ím betting Centennials.  A little bread and grain also.  Leaves a dry hop finish.  It¬ís a good beer and I remember when I was all about "the higher the IBU, the better man!"  but unfortunately I¬ím more of a fan of the nicely rounded IPA¬ís of hops and citrus.

Can @ Home. Pours slightly hazy orange with a white head, some floaties. Aroma of malt, caramal, lot of fruity hops, peach, grapefruit, cats piss. Taste is malt, caramel, hoppy, again grapefruit and other citrusfruit, sweet tropical fruit- peach and mango, Full body.,soft carbonation, long bitter finish. 160612

Can sample at a tasting at Dagan¬ís place. Thanks Ariel. Pours yellow with a small head and some floaties. Fresh aroma of tangerine, honey, greenness, lemon, flavor is bitter and fresh, greenness, tangerine and orange, medium to full bodied, great

Can @ Mikkeller Bar. Hazy orange with a white head with floaties. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel and very hoppy - grapefruit and peach. Flavor is quite sweet and very bitter. Dry and rather bitter finish. Absolutely fantastic! 120512

UPDATED: JUN 16, 2012 Can: Thanks to Steve:
Medium white head, disappears quick, ¬†leaves a half open thin white/off white lacing on top of a hazy orange colored beer.
Smell a nice fruity hoppy mix of citrus, abricot, pine, peach, there even seems to be something lambic ish like manure (and light farm/rubber ish-very light) in the far far distance, just a hint and quickly taken over by the delicious hop fruits again. Overall a good crispy hop and hop fruity abricot-peach-citrus smell. A bit like any other (d)ipa, but maybe a bit more subtle and actually the smell just keeps getting nicer and nicer! When you smell this you know something good is going to enter your mouth within seconds. Inhale with every swig!
Lovely and crispy taste of abricot, peach, citrus, grapefruit, hops and a good growing bitterness, fresh mown green grass, light malty touch and the slightest touch of something candy sweetness (disappears quick). A good well balanced hop, bitter, fruity mix that keeps getting better and better. Not too deep or complex, but just so easy at everything!
Aftertaste is getting more dry and has a firm bitterness with a touch of again hop and hop fruits.
Low carbo, creamy soft mouthfeel, full body and a creamy texture.
Another beer worth it¬ís hype, this is so easy drinkable, no alcohol flavors, soft, smooth and fine fruity. Very well balanced. Delicious beer.
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: Thanks to TURDFERGUSON for sharing this lovely can.So much hype to live up to... and... holy shit, this is good. Pours a hazy bright gold with a lovely foamy white head and great retention. Nose is hops, of course. Tropical fruits, grapefruit, pith, light resin, some minerally notes. Dry as can be, and also amazingly light for 8%. I¬ím in love.

Can picked up from √òlbutikken in Copenhagen. Really excited to be trying this one. I sip most of it from the can as advised but the small amount I pour out into a glass emerges as a pale gold shade with a thin ring of head. The aroma is a nice blend of citrus, peach and tropical fruit notes. It leads beautfully into the luscious tasting nectar that coats the mouth sublimely. Lots of lovely bitterness in the finish. Overall a top class double IPA.

What a great beer ... This is one worth savoring, it driving to Vermont in order to pick up a case.

This might be my most favorite beer I could consumer on a daily basis.

Can.Hazy orange colour with white head.Aroma is fruity of pine and citrus,heavy hoppy and powerful,good bitter taste and malty,with frutiy and hoppy finish,even hops left in the glass after drinken this beer.

Can @ MikkellerBar. Hazy amber with small off-white head. Aroma is malt, fruit, hops, citrus, peach and a little grapefruit. Flavour is malt, fruit, medium sweet, hops, citrus, little peach, little grapefruit, little lemon and bitter.

UPDATED: OCT 31, 2014 My new favorite IIPA.  This stuff is truly awe-inspiring and rockets to the top of the charts.  I have had the opportunity to try it several times now, but I have had to go to Vermont to get it, but having an excuse to visit Vermont is a good thing.  Fresh piney aroma, with the just the right touch of yeast and graham cracker.  Rocky head on a butterscotch pour. The brewer recommends sipping from the can, but this man is a  maniac who wants to crawl into the can and become one with the hops - maybe not such a bad idea, actually.  For some reason this stuff does seem to be at its best direct from the can.  HT is packed with rich, grassy, fruity, piney hops - with a nuanced, layered aroma and flavor. At its freshest, which is the best way to enjoy it, you taste cranberry, orange, and strawberry.  There is a nice amount of sweet honey flavor too.  This is about as good as an IIPA can get at this point in our development, or so it seems to me.

Can, thanks skyview.  Pours a darker honey golden with plenty of hop bits in suspension an a tight sticky slightly off white head.  Probably should had drank this can a bit sooner, but still a nice balanced hop aroma on the nose.  Dances between sweet peach and tropical fruit, sticky pine sap, with a bit of orange marmalade toast.  Pretty full mouth feel, but not in a bad way, tight prickly carb that works well to bring out the present, but not of the top bittering in the finish.  Great balanced hop flavors throughout, that I¬ím sure are only that much more bright and dominate of the malt bill when this is fresh.  Enjoyed this and hope to get another can or 2 in the future and drink them fresh.
Can. Hazy orange pour, lots of floaties. Aroma full of floral and pine, some resin. Flavor is somewhat bitter, fruity and very hopped. More bitterness in the finish. Decent body and great balance.
Can @ brewday. Aroma is huge citrus, pine and resinous hops, grapefruit and more. Flavour is medium hop bitterness, but very full and thich, layers upon layers of hops clinging to yout palate.

Can. pale golden color with a frothy off-white head. Aroma, very hoopy, grapefruit, peach, orange, pine & tropical fruits. Flavor,peach, grapefruit,very fruity, bitter & malty.  Body medium to full. texture creamy. carbonation lively. Finnish hoppy,bitter,fruity. One of the best DIPA I ever tasted
Poured from a pint can thanks to Kerry. This is a solid IIPA. Lots of citrus rind, slight grass, resin, tangerine, lemon. Such an amazing beer.

UPDATED: DEC 11, 2012 Tons of hop resin in the nose, can¬ít say what it looks like because I¬ím drinking straight from the can as directed. Very hop forward with lingering bitterness. This beer is still very very drinkable. Can¬ít go wrong here

Can. Pours clear orange amber, topped with a medium sized off white head that fades fairly quickly. Plenty of grapefruit in the aroma, with some lemon and pine. Flavor is more intense than the aroma, with tons of grapefruit up front, and pine needles building towards the finish. Hop resin clings to the palate. Really solid, a great DIPA.

Sample at the Central OH BA Tasting at From The Vine on 06/02/2012: Pours a dark orange-gold color with a medium white head that evaporates steadily. Short strings of lacing on the glass. Aroma of tropical fruits, herbal hops and malt. Medium body with a citrusy hops character and notes of pine and malt. The finish is hoppy with a lingering grapefruit aftertaste. Well-executed and tasty IIPA all around.

Sample from a can, enjoyed @√òlbutikken. Pours a hazy orange body, topped by mediumsized dense white head. Rich and inviting hop aroma; Ripe grapefruit and oranges. Pineapple and peaches. Also a light resinous tone. Superfruity hop flavor with grapefruit in the lead. Clean and strong bitterness. Notes of resin and spice. Subdued semi-dry malt body. Oily in the mouth. Medium full. Lingering fruity bitterness in long finish.  A tasty, clean and very well crafted IIPA.

30/V/2012 - 1Pt. can @ home - BB: n/a, but less than two weeks old, if I can believe adamjackson (2012-557) Thanks to adamjackson for getting me the beer!
Cloudy orange beer, small fuzzy off-white head, little stable, non adhesive, some small yellow sediment setting at the sides of the glass. Aroma: very piny, lots of exotic fruits, pineapple, passion fruit and sweet mango, in the end a bit of paint. MF: soft carbon, full body, thick viscose texture (also in pouring). Taste: lots of sweet exotic fruits, mango, passion fruits, very piny bitterness laying on top of sweet malts, honey and flowery notes. Aftertaste: very piny, bitter, dry, grassy and grapefruit. Dangerously easy to drink.
En lata  al hacer pssst el aroma te inunda te transporta! Aromas a resina, citricos exoticos,floral, sabor contundente embriagadar dame mas mas!

500 ml alu can - the first ever beer I drank from a can! Pours deep yellow with orange hints. Aroma¬ís of sweet peach, grapefruit, citrus, greasy notes of butter and buttermilk and some cinnamon. Medium body with a perfect bittersweet balance - very silky palate. Taste is grapefruit and coffee in the finish. Spectacular!

I decided to go for this long awaited treat from The Alchemist for my 200th review.

Poured from 16oz can to imperial Surly pint glass...

Pours a hazy honey gold, gorgeously unfiltered. I like my orange juice with pulp, I like my beer with floaties. A big, rocky off-white head swells to fill the 20oz glass. Spotty, sticky lacing. Great looking beer, I don¬ít really understand why this beer is suppose to be hidden inside of a can.

The nose is stuffed with fresh hop aromas - tangerine, orange peel, fresh floral bits, plenty of evergreen harshness to balance the heavy citrus. Not really any detectable malts here.

On the tongue... hop abrasion like I¬íve never really experienced. Grapefruit, orange peel, massive flavors. Exceedingly hoppy and bitter. The super dry, bitter afterburn keeps me going for more. What a delicious thing this is.

Overall, I can see why people go nuts over this stuff. A unique, aggressive, very satisfying drink.

UPDATED: JUN 18, 2014 June 2, 2012:Thanks to dresden for this. Amazing beer. Perfect hazy orange colour with creamy off white head. Piney aroma. Taste is bitter and hoppy but with a nice balanced sweetness, honey, cloves, apples, oranges, banana. Brilliant beer.
June 18, 2014. My third time having this and this time the bottle was far from fresh, as I obtained it in December and who knows how fresh it was when I got it....and yet, this is still awesome. What an amazing beer.
Gorgeous refreshing aroma. Peach colour. Lively but not jarring palate.Taste reminds me of a sweet grapefruit. Perfect for a hot summer day.

(1 pint can from Toft Vin; BBD: Couldn¬ít really find it) Flavour is nicely grassy with notes of pine. Not too resiny like so many DIPA¬ís nor overly bitter. Just pleasant, tongue tingling flavourful bitterness that leaves a nice dry sensation on the tongue. Medium carbonation and a medium body. 1 cl poured in a glass reveals a slightly hazy golden brew with small floaties and little, fading white head. Aroma is herbal following the flavour with grassy and piney notes and a hint of dust. Quite pleasant but extremely expensive here, unfortunately (9 USD for one pint). Girlfriend says: "I wouldn¬ít be able to drink a full one of that."

Can @ Mikkeller Bar. Enjoyed from a glass, because I don¬ít play by the rules. Light hazy orange color with a significant amount of floating white sediment that slowly settles at the bottom of the glass. The nose is concentrated fresh syruppy pine and resin. Pineapple, mango, sweet-lip-smacking hops. It¬ís the usual nose is a big DIPA, just ramped up in intensity. The taste is huge pine, resin, more tropical fruits. Bitter dry finish. Very sweet but crazily drinkable. I had to conciously slow myself down while drinking this. The body¬ís full and sticky. dank. Overall, great. I was expecting a letdown, but for me this beer totally delivered. Deservedly praised.
I drank it from the can like they suggest. Very smooth hop taste that is very drinkable on a warm summer day. One of the best IPA¬ís out there. Right up there with Pliny and Hopslam.

16oz can into a 23oz wheat glass b/c it looks awesome and Id rather drink out of a glass although the can tells me not to.  Taste is heavanly hoppy, grassy, organic soil and herbs, light on the internal carbination and pleasanlty refreshing and satisfying.,  Color is tan gold with golden grams and sunshine coating the glass.  this is hoppy up front, during ,and it the aftertaste.  so nice.  definatley one of the best, if not the best, dipa Ive ever had.  worth seeking out and enjoying.  Vermont beer at its finest.

Can at home. The can tells me to drink from can... And I always do what cans tell me to - so no idea how it looks, But I guess a clear golden with a white/off-white head, and give it a 3. Very bitter with a low, hoppy sweetness. Lots of hops aromas. Mostly of spruce and grape-fruit but also some plant sap. Medium to full bodied, with an oily mouthfeel. Medium carbonation. Long, bitter and extremely hoppy finish. Hoppy!
UPDATED: APR 23, 2015 I love the hoppiness of the beer and there¬ís very little to no bitterness. It¬ís a dark amber color and medium to full bodied.

Pours an orange/brownish color. Smell is bursting with hops and citrus. Taste is also very good, lots of hops, citrus, tropical fruits, not overly bitter. Overall a top quality beer worth seeking out.

Bottle shared by Dak. Pour is golden clear, with a small head, with oily texture.  Aroma is wonderful  hops which results in tons of citrus, with over the top grapefruit.  Taste is citrus and hoppy bitterness. Finish is bitter.
cloudy yellow, small white head. Aroma is yeasty, hoppy, bitter and us hoppy, flavor is crisp hoppy, bitter hoppy, flowery hoppy. Nice malty flavor

Can, from √òlbutikken. After all the "Best Performer of the Week"-hype here on Ratebeer I¬íve picked up one of these nifty cans out of curiosity. Let¬ís see what all this is about. Poured into my tulip glass, this one comes out as a slightly hazy, pale yellow beverage with a small white head. Nose is very fruity, with melon, cranberry, strawberry, hints of grass, pine and gooseberry. Very, very nice. Taste is flowery grass tones, lemon touches, grapefruit, hints of grass, earth and lime. Citric bitterness dominates, along with a substantial amount of sweetness at the same time, which doesn¬ít harmonize in my mouth somehow; where the aroma promised me heaven taste did not quite deliver. Medium carbonation, and very easily drunk for its ABV. All in all an OK DIPA, but nothing more. So what¬ís with the hype? :-P

Taking the on-can recommendation with this one and drinking it from the can. A bit strange, given that you lose the appearance/aroma qualities, but, hey, brewer¬ís choice. This is a really nice IPA. Alcohol is high (8%), but hidden, and it really is just all about delicious hop flavor. A bit sticky or resiny. The art is cool, too (I¬íll balance the lack of being able to see the beer with the good art and the black tab). Not over bitter. Somehow stays balanced within the realm of the hugely hopped. Nicely done.

16oz can shared by Dallas, thanks man 
Appearance: Cloudy orange with a small white head and some lacing 
Aroma: Citrus, lemon zest and resinous 
Taste: Grapefruit, lemon, grassy with some hot alcohols 
Wow, very nice. Wish I could drink this every day

D√•se: Gul let orange klar √∏l med et fint skumhoved. Dejlig s√∏dlig duft af humle, konen kunne ane kattepis. Jeg havde mest citrus og s√∏d malt. Smagen er igen dejlig humlet med en bl√∏d karbonering. Dejlig √∏l, godt balanceret, men ikke outstanding.

16 ounce can thanks to Dallas. A wonderful presentation. Pours a very cloudy orange color with some particulates floating around and a medium white head. The aroma is big resin and citrus, lemon dominates. A rich brew with grassy and zesty citrus flavors, lighter resin, very zesty and superbly drinkable.

I¬íll never forget the first time I tried this. Thanks Dak!  Big honey grapefruit nose with a mixture of other tropical fruits.  Wonderful flavor of orange and mostly thick oily grapefruit, with a great balance of sweet maltiness to back it up.  Low bitterness and great palate.  The finish still has citrus, but not too bitter or dry.  This beer can take the place of my morning juice and not only a great breakfast drink, but great any time!

This is just an awesome beer. The hops are thick and delicious, and with a wonderful taste, even though it comes from a can. I am not even going to try and describe the taste, all I can say is if you are in the area drive over to Waterbury Vermont and give it a try. Its a bit pricey, but worth every penny.

Looks like dirty sewer water dumped into a light beer, smaller off white head. Aroma is tropical fruit, marijuana, onions. Similar flavor, lots of onions, garlic, tomato, juicy fruit, papaya, and orange. Bitter finish, pretty dry for the ABV. Reminds me exactly of what Toppling Goliath is doing around here.

Pours murky, great tracing. Apricot colour, smells really fruity, sweet apples and oranges. Taste comes through hard core. Really drinkable aftertaste. It¬ís got the bitterness but comes through really smooth. Lives up to the reputation. Amazing sitting in the sun patio at Farmhouse Tap and Grill drinking something this good from an unassuming silver tall can.

Can sample at a tasting at Rotem¬ís place. Thanks DSG. Hazy, golden with residue that made the glass look like snow-globe, white head.  Delicate citrus and thick pine aroma, tastes very bitter but really nice. Abrupt finish, light body, smooth and very drinkable.
Can and yes i poured it in to a glass. Poured a burnt orange with a nice head. Nose was classic and firm hops. Delicious hop front, well balanced to a semi smooth lightly bitter finish. Really nice.

Stopped by and picked up 2 4paks of cans last year.  it was shortly after Hurricane Irene destroyed the area.  Wish I would have known just how good it was.  Now by far one of my favorite.  Great big hoppy taste, great finish.  Very smooth drinking
Canned from Randolph whatever on LES.   Pours orangishyellow, big ol¬í head,   Super floral aromatics; really quite good.

From √òlbutikken, Copenhagen, DK.
Can, 190512.
Orange with white head. Aroma of grapefruit, spices and hay. Flavour with orange, lemon, peach, passionfruit and solid bitterness.

UPDATED: SEP 30, 2016 Sadly orginal review 4.2; This ale blew my mind. Its one of my favorites. The initial & finishing taste were wonderful. It is such a balanced beverage.
Updated review; The aroma is like sniffing a bag of hop pellets with a hint of malted grain sweetness. The aroma is full of hops. There is spicy, citrus, grapefruit, pine, and floral hop notes. Tasting there was a clean yet sharp bitterness that stuck around into the finish, it was rather enjoyable. The beverage is balanced well from the sweet malts and bitterness intensity. The subtle dryness was welcomed too. The aroma was very similar to the flavor. Overall a great beverage to acquire.

Date: March 24, 2012
Mode: Bottle
Source: Tasting, HMOG
Appearance: hazy orange, wispy white head
Aroma: sweet citrus aroma, sugared grapefruit
Flavor: lots of citrus hop flavor, dry pale malt, touch of citrus, pithy grapefruit rind, light spicyness, light bitter finish
Aroma: 7/10; Appearance: 7/10; Flavor: 7/10; Palate: 6/10; Overall: 15/20
Rating: 3.6/5.0Drinkability: 7/10
Score: *** /4

UPDATED: FEB 5, 2015 Re-rate 1/15: Can sample at a tasting at the Beer & Beyond shop. Thanks Amit. Cloudy yellow with a white head. Aroma of tropical fruits hops with a "green" note. Fruity, piney and "green" hops in the flavor, a bit of sweet malt and nice bitterness. Medium-bodied. Very nice. 8/4/7/3/15= 3.7

Re-rate 5/22/12: Can sample at a tasting at Dagan¬ís place. Thanks Ariel. Can is at least 5 months old. Hazy orange. Aroma of "green" hops with grass and tropical fruits. Nice flavor of bitter fruity and grassy hops. Good, but not as good as a fresh one. 7/3/7/4/15=3.6

Can shared at a tasting at Rotem¬ís place. Slightly hazy golden with a white head. Great hoppy aroma of tropical fruits and citrus. Rather dry flavor of fresh fruity hops, slightly floral, and a nice lingering bitterness. Rounded mouthfeel. A great IPA. 8/3/8/4/16=3.9

UPDATED: JUN 15, 2013 Bottle from Brouwerij Lane Brooklyn.  It?s an ode to hops while not letting them over power the experience.  The only down marks are the haze and yeast floaters on this golden ale with a small head and fantastic lace.  The aroma is deep layers of sweet tropic fruits, pine, resin, funk and hop acids.  Those continue into the flavor where grapefruit and orange comes out with cool and increasingly bitter finish.  But it doesn?t over power the sweet maltiness and stays dangerously drinkable.  It is velvety and lively. I am smitten and glad to have another.  Oops. Hop acid burb.

En lata.Una maravilla de cerveza.Bien lupulada y bien balanceada!
Repito y repito.............
Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen. A bit hazy golden yellow beer with a offwhite head. Hoppy and fruity aroma. Floral, hoppy flavour. A bit sweet and a bit bitter. A lovley beer with a nice balance.

poured from a can. geez, this is a dangerous beer. amazingly easy to drink, smells great (citrus, green, grassy). Really nice and smooth mouthfeel for a double ipa. the 8 percent dont register at all and this is a beer you can drink all day. the fact that you can get it in a can for easy transport makes it that much better. highly recomended.

Can ....It pours hazy golden with floaters... with a medium white head.... The aroma is herbs, pine and citrus....The flavor is pine, herbs, grass and hops with a very nice dry hoppy bitter finish.....

Can, pours very hazy orange with medium off white head, lots of yeast sediments. Aroma is tropical fruits, pineapple, mango, passion fruits and so on. Taste is very hoppy with pineapple, peach, mango, citrus, some some malts. Very nice sweetness and bitterness. Very drinkable.

Just amazing, the nose is mindblowing as is the taste.

(Canned) Pours hazy orange with a small off-white head. The aroma holds passion fruit, peach, lychee, strawberry jam, papaya, canned pineapples lime, tangerine, pink grapefruit and pine up front with undertones of herbs, flowers (roses and white flowers), grass, wood, pepper, pear, vanilla ice cream, black currant and cucumber water. Mild toasted and clean malt in the background. Juicy, aggressive and yummy. The flavour is light sweet, medium bitter and light acidic with lots of tropical and citric juice notes alongside more ¬ìgreen¬î and woodsy hop notes. Toasted and clean malt backdrop. The mouthfeel is clean and tight with a light astringent finish. Light carbonated. Clean, grapefruity, light tropical and spicy, almost numbing piny finish. Near medium bodied.

Can. Hazy, yellow/straw liquid small to medium white/light off-white head. Aroma of fresh hops, grapefruit, citrus, cereal malt, lemon grass, orange peel, tangerines and blackberries. Awesome. Taste is dry and medium to high bitter with lots of fresh, hoppy notes of grass, grapefruit and tangerine. Medium bodied with nice carbonation. Very well brewEd DIPA. Love the fresh hoppy notes.
One of the best DIPAs so far tasted. Strong and sharp bitterness, but still gentle and not long-lasting. It also has a good body and a fresh fruity aroma.

Can. Pours super hazy orange. Orange and grape notes in aroma. Sweet taste with notes of orange, pine needles and resin. Lots of grape and alcohol bitterness in the aftertaste. Big bodied like a hop juice. Highly drinkable. Unique.

Can from Kihoskh.
Fruity taste of oranges and some pear. Huge smooth body.
Super duper drinkable for a 8% IIPA!
Can 50cl at home - shared with Mette. Clear golden - white head. Nice super fresh hoppy, lots of grass, nice high bitterness, ok malty sweetness, bisquit, cookies, super/super balanced.

Can. Pours a pale golden color with a small white head. Has a fresh hoppy grapefruit and tropical aroma. Fruity weak malty hoppy bitter peachy grapefruit flavor. Has a fruity malty hoppy bitter grapefruit finish.

Pours golden orange with a head that is thick and fluffy and retains. Aroma of bold citric and piney hops that is in your face in a good way, generous malts to back it up. Taste follows nose, so good so amazing. Smooth and easy to drink, I love this beer, it will perpetually stay in my wants!

Amazing stuff. 
Drink from the can? Ok!
N- very floral, at the same time full of pineapple, mango, citrus, and pine. Also getting white grape.  
Very earthy, dank and resinous.  You can definitely tell it¬ís unpasteurized. 

A- nice golden amber / orange color with haze for days

T- everything in the nose and then some! Finishes real dry and leaves a nice hoppy coating in your mouth. Mmmmmmm  also very smooth. Quite deceiving.  
I¬íve never had a beer that tastes like this.  So sweet and hoppy with a little spice.  Perfect brew IMO
Pours a yellowish orange with heavy flocculation. Heavy notes of pine, grapefruit/citrus. Very bitter. Rated from can, but part was poured into a glass in order to rate appearance.

UPDATED: SEP 23, 2013 Can @ Mikkeller Bar. Pours slightly hazy deep golden with a frothy white head that quickly dissipates while leaving some trace on the glass. Smell is fresh, sweet and hoppy with lemon zest, mango, pineapple, white bread, grapefruit juice, orange zest and hints of gooseberries, red currants, alcohol and dill. Taste is sweet, malty and hoppy with gooseberries, orange peal, bread, lemon zest, grapefruit juice, mango, passionfruit, pineapple, pine, grass and hints of alcohol, wet leaves, lemon balm, dill and honey. Mouthfeel is smooth, round, tiny boozy and medium to full bodied. Finish is sweet and bitter with pine, orange peal, grapefruit juice and fresh green herbs.

UPDATED: JUN 9, 2014 Canned. Poured golden in color with a nice white head. Hop aroma bursts from the can. Tons of grapefruit and other citrus flavors form a strong aroma. Flavor is clearly very bitter but has a rounded sweet taste. Very mellow and well balanced. If it wasn¬ít 8% ABV I could drink this all day long.

Can, bought @ √òlbutikken, Cph.
Pours clear golden with flakes of hops. Low, frothy, off-white head. Aroma has lovely resiny hops, peach, pine, fresh. Light doughy malts. Medium carbonation, lovely dry and creamy mouthfeel. Flavour has lots of bitterness, pine, peach, grapefruit. CAramel and doughy malts in the centre. But this is all bitterness. Warming finish. Lovely.

Light orange coloured and unclear. Has particles. White head, mostly lasting. Heavy hoppy aroma, fruity, passionfruit. Great flavor, starting sweet, finishing heavy bitter, revealing more hoppy notes, herbs, grass. Dry, creamy texture and soft carbonation.
light fruit aroma,yellow,hazy, white foam, light sweetness, medium bitterness, medium body, creamy, soft carbonation, bitter, long finish,

Stunned, bewildered, humbled, shocked . . . ok, just a regular encounter with daknole as he just gave me a can of this because I hadn¬ít had it before. Awesome! Thanks!! 16oz can pours with some eye pleasing hop haze, yes!, suspended in a fine mist within a deep gold colored body and supporting a near white head of foam. The aroma is nice and vibrant with grapefruit like citrus goodness along with some cracker nuanced dry maltiness and rimmed with mango fruitiness. The taste is a bold pleasing mix of grapefruit and mango like hop flavor running hand in hand with a thicket of resiny hop bitterness. Well underneath the fresh crisp hoppiness are faint murmurs of the malt sweet base. It dwindles away with yummy echoes of citrus hops. So this one gets good ratings and it is crystal clear why. This is a damn fine beer. Well done.

Pours a nice. Yellowish orange with a big fluffy head.  Aromas very tropical and fruity.  Flavor is very citric, orange, grapefruit, and tangerine.  Lightly Brady with hints of grass and darkness.  Nice medium body, smooth and drinkable.  Damn good stuff.

50 cl can @ hotel room, copenhagen.
Some yeast partickles in the glass. Aroma is slightly sweet with peaches and exotic fruits. Flavour is also slightly sweet with gooseberry bush, some resin, pine needles and hints of alcohol. Good, but I suppose the bottle version would have been better. The yeast is rather hard to handle with the can.

500 ml can.
Pours a hazy yellow colour with a white lacy head. Aroma of strong floral hops, mellow honey and mango. Flavour of strong floral hops, mellow honey, yeast, caramel and overly ripe mango. Medium bodied, dryish mouthfeel and a warming, floral, fruity finish. Would work even better on a hot summer day.

Thanks sooo much to Daknole for sending this one.  Been on my list for a while.  Pours a slightly cloudy pale yellow with peach hues. One finger of creamy eggshell white head.  Nose is super intense, very zesty with lots of grapefruit resin.  A slight onion quality comes through.  Very spicy with some floral notes.  Nice and dry with a very spicy/zesty hop quality.  Slightly resinous with a mildly onion like quality.  Medium bitterness.  Summit in there?

UPDATED: MAY 10, 2013 500ml can @ Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen

Pours light yellowish orange with a large foamy head. Aroma is fresh with exotic fruits, a lot of lemony and citrusy hops and caramel malts. Taste is fresh with fruity hops, citrus and lemon. Hints of caramel malts and biscuits. Finish is malty and hoppy with some fruitiness. Extremely well balanced and tasty IIPA. 9-4-8-4-16 = 4.1



Re-rated on 28.4.2013. FRESH can from a trade, thanks cp45!

Wow, this is incredibly good from a fresh can. Perfectly balanced mix of massive juicy and fruity hoppiness, sweetish malts and bitterness. Just amazing stuff. 9-4-9-4-18 = 4.4

Re-re-rated on 10.5.2013 SUPER FRESH can from a trade, thanks Hugonaut13! Even more tastier than the can I had a few weeks ago. Wish I could get this stuff every day. This is just pure awesomeness in a can.

50 cl can.
Pours hazy golden color with small head, lots of sediment. Aroma of exotic fruits, hops, grass, floral notes and mild caramel. Flavour of fruits, grass, mild herbs and pine needles. Very hoppy and crisp brew.
3615

Can 50 cl, Mikkeller Bar, big thanks to Alex. Pours clear golden with a nice off white head leaving small laces. Aroma is extremely piny fruity citric malty soapy peaches slightly raisins and apricots. Flavor is fruity bitter citric piny pungent peaches some caramel tones and good maltyness. Finishes longlived bitter grapefruit.
